review: Date of Visit: November 21, 2017 We came into here because our feet were hurting bad and we were starving after a full day at the park.  The place wasn't crowded at all.  Our Waitress, Natalie, was amazing. She was super attentive to my 6 yo old daughter's requests, and kept our drinks coming. Super attentive, friendly, a great attitude and generally overall, a lovely person.  I only take away a star because the food was significantly more expensive then it should have been. It tasted good, but I don't think they should be so expensive. I guess its the theme park pricing.  I am only really leaving a review because we received such great service from Natalie. Give that girl a raise. She deserves it! Thank you!  Happy Mama

Waited an hour for food.  Sesame jack strips had pieces of charred chicken. Cajun chicken pasta had oil sitting at the bottom of the plate. Signs that it's been sitting since before I walked in. Fries were cold and soft as a side. I love Fridays, they just were not on their game. Waitress was awesome though. Would most likely wait until I got closer to home next time though.

Date of visit: August 19. 2017 It had been a very long time since my girlfriend and I had been to a TGI Fridays - especially in my case, as the two closest ones in my neighborhood of San Diego had closed.  Since we were making our way out of Knott's Berry Farm, we saw this Fridays location, figured, "Why not?," and made our way inside for dinner. We chose to sit at the bar area, seeing how there were a number of people waiting, and shortly after placed our orders: My order - the French Dip sandwich with a side of mashed potatoes.  The sandwich actually was pretty good; the beef inside was cooked just right, and the au jus not only wasn't too salty, the onions inside boosted the flavor.  The mashed potatoes didn't even need gravy - they were just the right amount of firm but creamy.  (That is, once I got a chance to eat them, as you'll see in a bit.) My girlfriend's order - the Mediterranean Shrimp Naan with a side salad.  We were both surprised that the naan worked well as a wrap instead of the usual flatbread, and the shrimp and greens melded nicely with the cucumber yogurt sauce.  Kathy also liked her salad (eventually)... I also had a Newcastle Brown Ale; very good stuff and helped round out the meal.  However, while the staff was pretty quick with bringing out our orders, it took them ten minutes to give us some forks and napkins!  (Not good especially with the mashed potatoes cooling down quickly.)  By the time we did get the forks and napkins, we were halfway through our main dishes. Also, when looking through the menu, not only did it seem like this particular Fridays location had less items on it than other ones, I'm not sure if they offer the Endless Apps promotion here as well.  Something to ask about for next time. Overall, not TOO bad, but maybe Mrs. Knott's will be a better option.

Hubby and I celebrated our 23 rd Wedding Anniversary on December 15. Since we are also Gold passholder we thought dinner and a stroll through the park would be an affordable date night. We chose to sit in the bar area at a half booth. It was not crowed, there was about five other occupied tables and people at the bar. Mike came over to us and introduced himself and asked if we were ready to order or did we need a little time. We asked for more time please. About 15 minutes later he came back and asked us if we wanted to order drinks. We asked for a strawberry lemonade and an ice tea. We were brought an ice tea and some sort of mixed drink. Although it was not what my hubby ordered, he took a sip of it and liked it, so he kept it. After dropping off our drinks he went back behind the bar to socialize with the customers at the bar, he was having a blast. We waited for about another 15 minutes before we stopped someone else to let them know we were more than ready to order. A group of four young men came into the bar at that same time he was made aware that we wanted to order. He helped the group first and then came to take our order and promptly went back behind the bar to submit our order and then went back to chatting up the group of young men. By this time my tea is gone and I'm in much need of a refill. We tried to flag our waiter by waving our hand but it went unnoticed. We tried stopping a female wait staff who was in a rush to get to the back, she quickly came back out but it was clear by the full plates in her arms that she would not be able to help. Another waiter quickly walked by and did not hear my husband say excuse me. Now my hubby is pretty mad. He has to get up from our table to approach the bar to ask for a refill. He is two feet from the group of guys that have our waiter so entertained and about six feet from the other waiter that just walked by. He stood there for a few seconds when he realized they both "didn't" notice him. He had to say excuse me several times and each one a little louder before the second waiter turned around and asked how he could help. Can you believe we actually had to get up and chase down a waiter to refill an ice tea! All the time our waiter never missed a beat with his new found buddies. The food can out fairly quickly and was delicious. We once again had to flag down a young lady to let her know we needed another refill. Our waiter, not any wait staff, never checked on us to see how we were doing or if we needed anything else. We finished our dinner and I realized how much of a Funk I am now in because of the lack of good customer service. This is not our first time doing the TGIFRIDAY and then walk it off at Knotts thing. We have been passholder for almost 10 years now. TGIFRIDAY is my favorite restaurant, so ever since it has been there, we have eaten there. So I was highly disappointed with the lack of customer service we received. We waited for about 10 minutes after we had finished eating for someone to notice, take the dishes away, ask us if we would like dessert and bring is the check. All the while our waiter is about 10 feet from us, facing us but is still busy with the same group to notice us. I stacked all the plates at the end of the table, hoping this would catch his or anyone's attention. Almost another 10 minutes go by and we are both so annoyed by now that my hubby jumped in front of the first person that crossed our table, it just happened to be the other gentleman that had helped us earlier. My hubby told him we just needed our check. He went behind the bar and walked by our waiter and told him we wanted our bill and went to the register to print it out for us. In the mean time our waiter proceeds to tell the group of guys, who are now very buzzed after having several shots and a few mixed drinks, that we are pissed because we had to wait on our bill. Hey Jackass, I'm less than ten feet from you! I can HEAR you! One of the guys comments, fuck them, I'll order more drinks and they can wait a little longer. They are all laughing and talking crap with our waiter. I said very loudly to my husband that the waiter and the group are talking crap about us because we asked for our check. I know I said it loud enough for them to hear me. The group left as the other waiter brought us our check. There was a charge on our ticket for a cup of coffee, neither of us have ever drank coffee. I let the waiter know this was a miss charge and to please correct it and I wanted to provide my rewards number for points credit. He took this over to our original waiter and asked him to fix it. When he brought us the corrected ticket he was so kind and polite, bullshit, too late! I know we were in the bar, I know we did not order drinks (even though we ended up with one anyway), but we are still paying customers who deserve to be treated just as well as your drinking and drunk customers! This will not stop me from doing our date night thing. But this was our Anniversary!

Our waitress was nice enough and the proximity to Knott's was good but thats about where the positive stuff ends. This location is operated by Knott's and the pricing definitely reflects that. Whatever specials that you see or hear in advertisements arent going on over here. Also the menu is limited and condensed and doesnt offer a wide variety of options as your standard TGIFridays. My biggest gripe was that there was a small hair on a piece of cucumber in my little side salad. I didnt notice it until about halfway through. I informed our waitress, and they replaced my salad with a new one which looked 10x better which was cool I guess but I was just apprehensive about finding more mystery hairs. And I dont even like cucumber to begin with. They offer a 10%-20% discount for Knott's passholders (depending on what pass you have). That was actually really handy because again, the pricing here is a little above what other locations use.  They are literally right next to the Knott's theme park, so we ate here because it was on the way out to our cars. So yeah the closeness is convenient but in retrospect I'm not sure that overspending $100 on mediocre food was really worth it. Oh, their AC is really good too.

Unacceptable. Waited an hour for our food. My salad arrived 15 minutes before my boyfriends meal. I also had to ask twice for my breadstick. To make matters worst my mans burger was undercooked despite him asking for well done and bacon was undercooked. We would have been better off eating at Fatburger before entering park.

The food was all wrong and cold. The server was awesome and brought fresh fries and offered to redo a salad that was covered in onions that wasn't supposed to be. I get being higher prices because of knotts but at least have hot food and get it right

It's the only Fridays in the area and I'd been seeing all those commercials with the protein and side for $14.99, so I told my boyfriend, let's go! Don't make the same mistake! Prices are inflated! It's the only We ordered 2 Coors lights, a margarita, an appetizer, chicken pasta and a burger for $104 with tip. The service was marginal, we had to ask for silverware, napkins, and waters that we had already requested. If the service was half way decent it might have taken a little of the sting away. Nope, we couldn't even get that! Never again!!! Lesson learned. Just because it says Fridays, it doesn't mean it has normal Fridays pricing.

This is a good location with good vibes and decoration. The serves and bartenders are friendly but doesn't really approach you unless you ask. The problem is management. There are empty tables everywhere but still a line and a wait. They need more servers or servers who will take on more tables. They need to be more efficient about this bc how can a location be empty with a wait on the day before Christmas eve located IN Knotts Berry Farm. It should be PACKED with a wait, not empty with the wait. The food is on a the good side, definitely not bad. I feel like this place is an opportunity lost for such a good location.

Keyword here is meh.  We attended Knott's Scary Farm. We wanted something good, but not expensive. We chose poorly. No happy hour at that location, almost every drink started at $15. I mean really? Way too expensive. We ordered some appetizers and they were ok, no problems, just nothing notable. I would choose another place when I return to Knott's. Maybe Mrs. Knott's? They have a full bar now.

We have been here twice as passholders at knotts and have had nothing but positive experiences!  Jovani, our waiter was even nice enough to take off the virgin mango margarita our son ordered because he noticed he wasn't too keen on it.  Top notch service!  Very polite.  I don't know what the night time crowd is like as our experiences have been during lunch, but based on our experience, I would highly recommend!

I'll admit that I haven't been to a TGI Fridays in while, but I think the prices are marked up here by a few bucks because Knott's owns this one. I've seen a lot of one and two star reviews here, and I'm a little shocked. Okay, not too shocked, but I honestly don't know what people expect from a chain restaurant owned by a theme park, that, duh, is obviously outside of a theme park. I think that maybe, people are expecting too much, and should have been prepared for some of the main points that people have been hitting on like drink prices, seating, and wait times. We went this past Thursday, and here is what I have concluded: 1) Appetizers are overpriced for sure. Almost $20 for the wings, cheese stick and potato boat sampler. Split between 4 of us, it equaled one item from each for each of us, with the exception of the boneless buffalo wings, which were somewhere between the size of popcorn shrimp and a chicken nugget. I will admit that the wings were moist and actually had some flavor, that the cheese sticks were good as were the potato boat things. HOWEVER, they must've been baby potatoes, because they were small! LOL. 2) My bacon cheeseburger was actually outstanding (thick and cooked the way I wanted it), BUT, the cheese was a little weird. Not sure if it was imitation or something, but it was melted, but the cheese and the oil were actually like separated and kind of reminded me of the way candle wax looks when it is melted and drips all over the place. Half liquid, half waxy? I don't know but it was certainly a thing that made me go hmmmmmmmmmm. 3) Rosemary was a decent server. Replaced my Sprite right away because it tasted like Alka Seltzer, and got us everything we needed when we flagged her down for it. 4) If you are Knott's season pass holder, you rate a 10% discount so make sure you mention it. 5) They didn't offer the $10 AYCE appetizers......... : ( Overall, ours wasn't a bad dining experience, but that is probably because we knew what to expect. If you don't feel like eating inside the park, this is a very doable option, so long as you don't go in expecting too much.
Was seated at the bar and had drink and ordered the chicken nachos.They were great but different. As they serve them on a half of a fried tortilla.  The service was great given how busy it was.

Ridiculous prices! $10.29 for a kids meal? Flippin stupid. $10.60 for a blue moon. I will never be back. Just because they share a parking lot with Knotts I guess they believe they can give crappy service and higher prices and it's ok! I should have driven over to the one by the block and faced close to $10 off the bill! Food was good and that is the only redeeming thing.

Bad food, cold fries, bad service, and high prices on 11/24/17 am never coming back and no wonder owned by knotts....

Great restaurant right outside the gate from Knott's Berry farm! Nice selection of items for a quick bite. Definitely will be going here again. Have always had fast friendly service. Food is consistently good.

Mediocre service. Food OKAY but not up to the standard I get in San Bernardino. The menu seemed to be $4.00 higher across the board. I will never be back.  Maybe they have a $15.00 minimum wage here? Even that should not explain the outrageous pricing.

Bit pricey..Not exactly good.  Fish was overcooked and dry and the two tiny prices were outrageous for the price.  Not recommended
Service here was horrible you would think because it's owned by knots they would have great  service but it was horrible

I didnt want to eat at Knotts chicken place, as One of my patients worked  there int the kitchen was filthy so we stopping in to TGIF Friday was glad I did, i shared the Ceaser salad  it was plenty for two, we also ordered a child macaroni with fries was plenty for a six-year-old.

This place is ok we hadn't gone in years so we decided to try it out again. Our waiter was really friendly but it took forever for us to get our food and we had to keep asking our waiter for condiments cause he would forget to bring them.
Doesn't have the same menu as Fridays as this is operated by knotts..  no endless appetizers....

Yelp challenge 2015.  86/365. *update* TGIF...AKA Thank God I forgot that I don't like TGIF, or I would of insisted of going somewhere else. The thing about Fridays is, Its a chain. And we all know chain food is inconsistent and never looks like the picture.  Call me spoiled but I have perfected chicken and steak in my kitchen.  I am usually disappointed when I order it off a menu because I can do better. This, was no exception, to the food tonight either.  I am also not a big drinker  so the extended faucets of booze here never entice me at TGIF. Service was attentive tonight. Our waitress was sweet and delivered our meal to our table quickly and was on top of our drink refills. She had her area packed with a few large parties, and she never forgot us little folk. Price wise, dinner for 2, without any appetizers was about $40. Which to me is kind of pricey for what I had. My chicken and cheese was about $17.00 and cost about $3.00 to make. My thin pieces of chicken were dry and unflavored, cheese was burnt on the skillet and the mashed potatoes were instant. It was just okay. The Rueban the hubsters said was decent, but could of used more meat. His sweet potato fries were frozen to the fryer and not very crispy. Parking here is a major Pain in the Bootie. You have to rely on the traffic guards to let you enter the lot at Knotts and you have watch for the zillion million tourists that flock in the lot, who don't pay attention where they walk. Lalalalalala. The restaurant  does not validate, but your receipt is proof enough for the gate keepers, and then its free to park for a couple of hours. TGIF, is just okay. Maybe its another story during Happy Hour. If you have a large party they can accommodate you easily. I am not a fan of Fridays. I have no problem paying for good food, but the $40 bill tonight was not worth it. I am not a fan of TGIFs.

horribly rude staff every last one of them had an attitude and we're rude. You can feel the tension between the staff worst place every. Would Not recommend can't believe this

We came to this place before knotts scary farm expecting a decent lunch. Well to start off the the lemonade was watered down. Then the ketchup on our table was dark and tasted really disgusting. Would never ever recommend this place to anyone! 0 stars if possible....

I just want to throw out that I'm giving my 5 star review because our waitress Monique was amazing. We were a group of 8 and she was ON IT!! She was attentive and super friendly! Made the experience great!

Worst service we have ever experienced ever. We waited 30 minutes for our food to come. We were about to walk out when the food finally came. The server (Surena) acted  as if nothing was wrong. We asked for silverware and napkins and she brought napkins and silverware and then never checked on us again. Our burgers were raw. We ate only around the outside as it was the most cooked. If we asked for it to be corrected we know we would have waited another half hour. Plus, nobody came around to check on us. The restaurant was very slow when we were there and the few tables that were seated were all eating so the reason for us waiting so long was not because they were busy. It was as if the chef was on a break. We had to get up and walk around looking for someone to ask for our check. I asked the hostess. She brought it to me. The server did not. I paid for half the bill with a $25 gift card, which Is the only reason we went in the first place. The food is gross and the prices are surprisingly expensive. If we were not at Knott's we never would have gone here. We will never be back.

Well this is an occasion that I wish I had taken the time to read the Yelp reviews before deciding to leave Knotts for a bite across the street at TGI Friday's. Yelp says it's a 2 star experience and I have to agree. The main reason we chose to leave Knotts was that we wanted to find a cheaper beer than the $11 option in the park. We did succeed on this part of the mission as the beers were cheaper at TGI Friday's. Unfortunately, the food was very mediocre. We ordered the beer cheese pretzels and two side salads. The salads were quite tiny and topped with a few tomatoes, cucumbers and croutons. The salad dressing was drizzled across the top and I had to ask for an extra side of ranch, which was just okay in flavor. At first we thought we had ordered the dinner salads, which were priced at $8 and we were super disappointed but when the bill came it turns out we had side salads at $4 instead so it wasn't quite as bad. We forgot to order the beer cheese pretzels without the bacon topping (my guy is a vegetarian and I don't eat pig) so we had to scoop that bacon off the top. Not sure if the slight bacon flavor tainted our experience with the cheese dip or if it just has a strange smoky flavor to begin with but we weren't very impressed. The quantity is also lacking and we ran out of dip before finishing our pretzels.  Basically, I'd only return here for drinks.

Won't come back here. I think McDonalds tops it better. The server all cared about was to count his tips and left us waiting for 5-8 min. So I got up to use the restroom came back and still ignore me. He said I'll be with you in a minute. I had to get another server because it's just not all there. No wonder this location doesn't have good stars. Cocktails suck. Just syrup with water and overpriced. Ruined my first day of vacation. Save your money y'all or if you don't mind drinking water and syrup then your at the right place.

Okay so can I start off by saying I was so excited for it being my first time here and I promise I won't be coming back Service was Horrible I went up to the front I was going to say something to the manager but the host said she would go get them but it's like it was not meant for me to say nothing. So I said no thanks , I asked for a Long Island ice tea to my server 25 min pass still no drink my food gets here and still no drink I ask the other waiter for it 15 min pass and no drink I was getting really upset I hate being rude so the second time she came I asked for the drink again her response was "oh yeah let me get that for you " yes she apologized I understand but come on after that I was not asked again if I needed anything and I needed napkins and another ranch come on my first time and now I just don't know what to think thanks TGi

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER not only I had to hunt down a manger in a purple shirt so my order was taken. When the food was served, we had no cutlery so had to wait yet AGAIN to get a set of forks n knives so I could eat. I spotted a table being cleaned by 3 waiters at a given time. And my dirty plates where picked up from my table rather quick. Too bad the food was cold when I was able to start eating due to the long wait time. They should rename the location to "TGYW. Thank God You Waited"

Whoa. Whoa. Whoa. Let's talk about how phenomenal the customer service at this TGIF location is!!! I mean first off the patio was closed (Sunday at 930pm) and we were interested in sitting outside with our three year old to watch the fireworks! The hostess gladly accommodated us and our awesome server, Justin, volunteered to take our table! Justin was personable, friendly, and most importantly prompt! (He was JUST-IN time....See what I did there(Especially considering we were out of his "section!) I was pleasantly surprised that the Manager, Miriam, came out and checked on us!  She was equally as friendly and welcoming!  Oh and we had the best seat in the house! The 945pm firework show Knott's put on was spectacular!!!!!! Perfect end to our family's Sunday fun day/end of summer!!  ****I'm surprised by at the amount of negative reviews and wanted to share my POSITIVE experience with y'all!!!****

We came to TGIF before we went to haunt thinking it would be easier to have dinner and walk towards the entrance afterwards . I think if we could do it again , we would definitely prefer eating elsewhere and driving to the park. The line was insanely long just to get your name on the list. Luckily people in our party got there early and didn't have to wait. Just to get in , it was completely disorganized people were just standing around blocking the walkway and not letting people in or out. Just completely crowded and the hostesses just looked frazzled. Anywho, we were a larger party, a group of 9 and had one server. We ordered 2 appetizers, a round of water and drinks. Half of us got water, the other half waited around for about another 20 mins for their water and the rest of us were done with our waters and don't get refills. Our drinks took about 30 minutes to get to us, along with our appetizers. Our drink order was wrong and we didn't even get all the drinks at the same time. Different people came by to give us or drinks and we repeatedly asked for more water, at this point we just asked if we could get a pitcher for the table, and for the missing beverages. Finally, everyone had a drink, their correct drink at that and we got to order our food.  The food itself was good. 3 people in my group got old fries, which were replaced. Our waiter oscar, ehh, was mediocre at best! Very dry, not personable and definitely not attentive. Justin who wasn't even assigned to us was more efficient that oscar. Really seemed like he didn't even want to be bothered by us. Justin is the one who brought us the pitcher of water, plates for our appetizers and napkins. Go Justin! We literally got our appetizers and didn't get plates for like 5 mins . We all had started eating on napkins  . Our utensils that we're given to us alll had lipstick on them. All 9 of them. We mentioned it to a server and they just kind of brushed it off and we asked for new napkins. However, my drink was delicious.  a big shout out to the bartender that made awesome drinks! They toook fooreveerrr  but they were really good. I had a jack and ginger and it was delicious! A member from our group had a frozen strawberry margarita and it was amazing as well. So that increased stars for me . However, the prices for drinks are ridiculously much higher than any other TGIF. All in all, I see why this place only has a 2 star rating . We should of yelped this place before going . We thought we couldn't go wrong with Friday's but I guess the location matters. Won't be returning due to bad customer service. There are good people that work there but overall it wasn't anything special that makes me want to come back to this place.

Terrible service.  I mean the worse!  The menus were crusty, dirty and wet. Took a long time to get water.  They did not have clean utensils and told us we had to wait until they washed some.  Our food was delivered but only 3 out of 6 of us had forks to eat.  20 minutes after our food came, we got more forks.  I ordered the shrimp and chicken pasta but not a single shrimp to be food.  They took the plate to "remake" it but honestly it was bought back 15 minutes later cold with 3 shrimp.  My husband hated his food and returned it to the waitress.  The manager never came to ask about it. Over all it took 60 minutes to get all the food.  Of course nobody ate at the same time because we didn't all have forks or the food wasn't right.  Plus we got 1 refill of water after 45 minutes and she couldn't remember whose glass was whose so she just gave them out randomly.  It was $98 for horrible food, bad service and no damn forks! I left this same review on the back of the receipt.  Not that they'll notice. Definitely would not recommend to anyone.  Ever.

This location is by far one of the worse I've been too! Not only is their service is poor but their food is just about the same.  I was sat in the patio which I had no problem with - but my table was a horrible one (rusty dirty metal table) which they didn't bother to clean. I placed my order of drinks but after looking around ... we just walked out.  Ended up having dinner TGIF in Torrance in which I give them 5+ stars

I wanted to eat at the chicken place but they are closed for remodeling so we gave TGIF Friday I try they have neat Decour in their staff was friendly food was good I would be here again and they were not that busy for being at amusement park I wish they had one in Bakersfield the closest one I know of is in Valencia

OVERLY PRICED!! I wish I could give 0 stars for this place. Because it's next to Knott's, the pricing is ridiculous. Any specials you see advertised on TV will never be available here. Endless apps? Nope. But you can order boneless buffalo wings for $13. Long Island ice tea? $13. A regular burger? $17. My fiancé and I had a drink each, I ordered buffalo wings and he had a burger and the bill came out to $59. With tip, because our server was very good, it ended up being $71 in total. I don't care about the tip because she very well deserved it, but $13 for boneless wings that were nothing special (I mean it's chicken nuggets tossed in buffalo sauce) is outrageous. I was livid. You might as well go down the street to Outback. Much better food for a better deal. Needless to say, although this TGI is so close to us, we will NEVER go here again. If we had eaten at Outback we could have each gotten a sirloin, alcohol and gotten way more food for a cheaper bill total. I feel robbed.
Folks, don't come here. It's a ghost town. They don't have happy hour either. Good service and all...but sorry it's a thumbs down.
This place doesn't even have the deals that the normal chains do and the food takes wayyyyy too long to come. I give this 2/5 potato skins.
Great service. Shout out to Alex for excellent service. Cajun Shrimp and Chicken Pasta is delicious.

Although the bartender who greated us was friendly, we left due to the steep prices and lack of happy hour and specials a typical Friday's would have. This restaurant is owned by Knott's Berry farm, whom apparently sucked all the fun from it. The complete lack of customers (besides our two minute appearance) should've been a tale-tell sign. SKIP

We had lunch here on 9-22-16, 1pm. Only 4 tables taken ( including the bar), The Orange and CM locations are usually packed. This was a bad sign.      The food was low-quality, poor value, unhealthy and expensive for what is served. We had 2 different entree's of shrimp, at $17.59 each. I got 10 small, heavily battered, over cooked ( hard) shrimp that was loaded/packed with salt, served with salty fries. Highest level of sodium in shrimp I've had. The other tasted a little better, also heavily salted. We tossed the leftovers in the trash when we got home.       My cocktail was weak, probably 1/2 the strength of a normal drink, filled with ice for only $9.00, and a coke was $4.29. The menu is smaller here, and less cocktails offered than other TGIF locations.       Some of the windows and wall displays were smeared with food, drink, sticky hand prints ( check the bat mobile photo on the corner wall- it can hardly be seen). Restroom door sticky and gross. Actual restroom was clean and well designed, which is how they earned 1 star. I over tipped the waitress, service was ok/good. Would never go here again unless I needed a drink while at knott's or the haunt.      We went to TGIF twice this month to get the Tiki Drinks/Mugs summer promotions. Neither the Orange or BP locations were participating! So we spent over $90.00 to get no tiki's at all. That's pretty sad advertising, we won't bother to try a promo from TGIF again.

Clean place, quick service, good food... Just what we were looking for. We've had bad experiences at other location, as far as service. But here, not at all.  See if Justin's working when you come in, he was very welcoming and friendly.
Very rude staff, ordered an appetizer and our food came at the same time. Food was cold and soggy. Will never be coming back.

I seen the reviews but decided to give this location a shot... I love TGIF but my service here was not the best at all... In the bar area my food came out before my appetizer and when I brought it to my server's attention he never apologized. He simply said "oh I will cancel it". This server for the table next to me checked on my table 3 times before my actual server did once. Then my server went on lunch without introducing us to who was taking over. It was just really weird. What saved the night was the fact that the food was amazing but I still only rate the overall experience as 2 stars... I will give it another try just not in the bar area
Jd chicken sandwhich!!!  The best server is steven morales and alyssa   Also crispy is a good bartender  He always gives the best mixed drinks  !!!!!!

Made a mistake thinking there's no crowd on Mother's Day Another mistake is to stop at TGIF run by Knotts directly  I sat down and watched that bartender Chrispy working for 1 min after he noticed me sitting down very obviously  I greeted him before he did I gave him compliment about his name He gave me an answer seriously "it's just my name." I still smiled and said that's my daughter's name without a "p"! I was given a receipt after I ordered corona extra because it's cheapest $8/bottle I called the manager Mirium and she gave me the regular speech from Knotts trainers: that is our company policy to give bar customers who sit on the rim the receipts immediately after drinks were delivered beside a lot of customers just walked out without paying I said: just because 10% or 30% of your customers did that so you treated all of us like that? Why that popular newest restaurant across street didn't have the same practice?" Mirium: "I'll let the management know." I: " once you gave me those words such as policy, management, customers will not help you any more." The only happy server was that raisin bread clerk who asked, "do you need me to cut this bread for you?" You, the public, be the judge, is Knotts service better than that popular amusement park in Anaheim or not? It's my home town so I kept my tax dollars here. Shall I go across the street?  After I finished my review, I noticed that there's no straw provided. I had to ask 2nd server to give me a straw. Does a new customer deserve this kind of treatment? It's a Mother's Day today and I looked like a mother. At age 60, I realized that I should have pick up beer from market and drink at home.

I'll start with asking you to look at all my previous reviews. You will see that I don't really give bad ones I only let people know about the good ones but this place deserves a negative rating. 1- star is too much. I'm the easiest and kindest most respectful customer to a restaurant because I own one and I know how it goes.  First, they sat us on a table that was dirty and was not even cleared all the way.  It took the server 15min to clean it up and it was a 4- seater. She took our drink order and rushed to leave. It was slow by the way... Then came back to take our order 20min later. She forgot the 1- beer we ordered but remembered the waters that where served in a dirty glass. Our food was sent out scattered and still no silver ware or plates for us to dig in. I was there with my sister my 5- year old son and 9 year old nephew. Every one of us where starving. My son watched his already cold Mac and cheese get colder and we did the same on everything else. The spinach dip came out with dry crust around the edges like it was sitting there for an hour or so. I sent that back and said just give me the bill. I had to ask 3-4 other waitresses to assist because ours never came by.  52 bucks later with only 3-appetizer ordered and 1-1/2 wait I was just so mad but stayed calm.  There is more but I'm getting pist off just thinking about it.  Service sucked, Food sucked,  Place was dirty,  And way too expensive and I'm a spender when I want to eat. I did not order food because the appetizers took wayyyyy toooo looong to come out.  I assure you I will never enter this TGIF or any other location.  These guys need to regroup and figure their restaurant out. No wonder they are a 2- star facility.  I'm done!

I ate lunch at this TGI Friday's in Buena Park, CA on 3/8/2016.  It was my 1st time there.  We were planning to eat at Knott's Chicken Dinner Restaurant across the street but it was closed for renovation.   We had the fried mozzarella appetizer ($9.29), I had the bourbon barrel chicken with spinach plus macaroni & cheese ($18.79), while my companion had salmon wiping spinach and broccoli ($17.29).  My iced tea was $4.00, while coffee was $2.60.  Our server, Ashana, did a fine job.  In fact, the whole staff was friendly and helpful.  Plus, I took photos.
It's owned by knotts so expect for everything to be over priced, and they do not have happy hour..for 2 beers one meal and 1 appetizer we paid $55.. do not  recommend due to over pricing..

We took a break from the park and came here to eat. Our food was really good, I enjoyed the Jack Daniels ribs. Our server, Marla, was also very attentive and friendly.  We'll be back next time we go to Knotts.

We've been to this location a few times. It has a limited menu compared to other TGI Fridays and is usually slow (ie few customers). We like TGI Fridays and this one is located right down the street, so we really wanted to like this one, but after our last experience we're not going back.  We sat in the bar area. There were 5 sometimes 6 employees in the bar area, but only 1 actually serving. I've worked in a restaurant, I realize not anyone can or should just take your order, but they have to realize it looks pretty bad when there are that many employees around and literally no one is helping or paying any attention to customers. There was one other table and no one sitting at the bar. We waited for about 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. It truly was kind of bizarre as it's an open area and we can very clearly see all of them and they can very clearly see us. Our server, who had been present in the bar area the whole time, finally told us he'd be right with us... but he lied. Instead he messed around behind the bar for a little longer (not making drinks or anything), chatted with a female co-worker for a minute, and then went over and chatted with the other table. And I don't mean he just checked on them, made brief small talk, and came to us. I mean he hung out, leaned against the other booth, and talked casually for several minutes. When he finally did head over to us, my boyfriend joked to me that he should make a joke about it being busy (place was dead), but didn't actually have a chance to because our server actually, seriously, used the excuse that he was busy and blamed it on the fact that he was the only one serving (in the bar, not the whole restaurant). I wonder if he thought we couldn't see him the whole time we'd been sitting there? Because we could.  We ordered two beers, waters, and an appetizer. He asked if we wanted to order anything else. We told him we would order when the appetizer came because we wanted that first. He then explained to us that the purpose of an appetizer was that it came first (thank you, kind sir, for defining the term for us), and assured us we could order everything at once. We orderd that way because of the last time we were there; my boyfriend wanted to order the appetizer first and then our meal to make sure it didn't come at once, but I assured him that they would, in fact, know the definition of "appetizer" and would bring it first. I was wrong. It all came at once. So this time, we ordered separate.   We got our beers. Mine tasted dirty. I don't know if it was the glass or their taps, but it tasted dirty. He didn't bring waters. Someone brought us our appetizer. I love spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer and convinced my boyfriend to get it even though it isn't something he normally likes. It kinda sucked. It was too salty and was served with salted tortilla chips. $12 for a small bowl of dip and a handful of tortilla chips. What we got I would expect to maybe be $6-7, it was kinda ridiculous. Then came the fun of trying to get our server's attention so we could order our sandwich. But he ignored us. He knew we had our appetizer and knew we wanted order when it came. I'm not sure if he thought he was making a point about the appetizer thing? Again, he wasn't helping anyone else, still no one there but the one other table and he wasn't helping them either. At one point he was standing about 10 feet from us behind the bar, facing our direction, so we tried to get his attention by waving and calling out to him. He turned and walked the other direction. There is no way he didn't hear us. It was quiet. The one table at the other end of the room probably heard us. One of his co-workers even looked at him weird and then looked over at us, and back at him as he walked away.  We were never rude to him, we hadn't complained about anything, we hadn't even bothered with our passive aggressive joke about being busy.   We eventually got our sandwich. Which is where we finally complained. We got the chicken club (lettuce, tomato, cheese, chicken, avocado & bacon on a baguette). For the meat, one half of the sandwich had two very small slices of a chicken breast and a half piece of bacon. Pretty skimpy, covered slightly more than half the bread, but could be tolerable. The other half had one single thin slice of chicken that covered maybe 1/4 of the bread, and a few bacon bits. After trying unsuccessfully to get our servers attention, we flagged down the closest person, showed her the sandwich, and asked for her help. She got a manager who then brought us more chicken in a bowl. $15 for a sandwich and it was served with half a chicken breast (and that's being generous). Our server was behind the bar not helping people this whole time but seemed unconcerned.  We asked for water again, finally got it and one glass was dirty. A different server offered and got my boyfriend a second beer while our server, as usual, stood behind the bar. Our bill was $60.

Eat in the park! Do not eat here!  So disappointed. Apparently this location is owned and operated by Knott's so they jacked up the prices and have a different menu. I don't mind paying for a good meal, so if the food was good, the prices wouldn't have bothered me. But the food was TERRIBLE! My French fries tasted old, and I asked for the sauce on my burger on the side. When they brought it to me, it had a crust on the top. Gross. When we ordered our kids drinks, we ordered them from the drinks that aren't included in the kids meal because the menu is deceiving!  And when we asked our waitress for new drinks and told her we had made a mistake, she had an attitude. The service was bad as well. We waited forever for our food and our experience was so terrible that we wanted to get out, but our check took forever as well! I felt like we were being punished for the whole drink debacle the whole meal. Save your money and eat in the park! This was so not worth it! I have no problem paying high prices if the product of worth it, but this place is a joke. So disappointing!!

After a bad morning at Knotts, wanted to grab a bite with my family and inlaws. 8 of us including 4 kids under 6 had a great lunch today. Our server, Jose, was one of the best we have had anywhere. The burgers tasted great and the bacon was cooked just right. Get the sweet potato fries, they were much better than the regular fries.

There was a 35-40 minute wait at the Knott's Chicken Restaurant, so we wondered into TGI Fridays. Huge mistake. Our server Anna Marie was horrible, she took forever to take our order. Then she brought our drinks and food at the same time. They had both restrooms out of order at the same time. No coffee pot so she had to bring out a fresh cup all the time. Not sure if this server or this restaurant sucks worse, to solve will never go eat here again. My nephew was going to leave a tip and my friend talked him out of it.

Wow. Where do I start? Let me first say this is my 2nd (possibly 3rd review) in the many, many years that I use Yelp. I have one policy when it comes to reviews: the experience has to be so rare that it deserves mentioning. It can be good, but in this case it is most certainly bad. Let us start with the service or severe lack thereof. We came at around 2 PM on a Saturday while at Knotts. We wanted something with more substance (ha!) and the 3 hostesses showed us to our table. It took 25+ minutes for the server to arrive at our table. My friend had to tell the waiter we were here first when he went to the table next to ours.  About 45 minutes into our experience, we finally order. I received my food (Jack Daniels Sliders) about 5 minutes after ordering. It was cold and the quality was very low. I have never in my life asked for food to be taken back. It was that bad. That evening I got severely ill. I cannot necessarily blame this on the food as I did go on roller coasters afterwards, but I am an experienced theme park visitor and have never encountered this issue. The only thing different about the typical day - TGI's "food." At the end of the day, I ended up splitting the bill with 3 other friends and paying $40 for 2 beers. I hate this place. My first (and last) TGI Fridays experience. If you want to throw up during your trip to Knotts Berry Farm and don't like roller coasters... I suggest eating at TGI Fridays. Stick with Chicken Dinner.

i arrived about 830 without the notion of knowing they closed at 9pm--- according to this yelp that the location closed at 11pm. i walked in and was greeted by the host (long hair girl) on wednesday january 11, 2016. she informed me that the restaurant was closed but i am more than welcome to sit at the bar and order. i found myself a seat and sat in the bar. she then handed me a menu and i began to look.  heres the kicker: the server or employee named michael (bald headed guy) walked up to her and  while making snidey facial expressions said out loud "seriously? we close in 15 minutes?" -- i dont think he noticed i was looking at him and as soon as he saw i saw him i said "omg, i didnt know yelp said you guys close at 11--- i began to grab my bag and started to leave---. he then said " no no ur welcome to still order" i politely declined and said "no i dont want to hassle anyone or to be inconvenient"  i then grabbed my bag and left--- why? you do not freakin make dumb facial expression as if your upset that someone came in 15 minutes before closing time!!!! come the f on!!!! seriously especially if you dont know if the customer is ordering food to go or a quick drink after having a crappy day!!!  congratulations bald headed michael---- you officially have put the icing to the cake of my ruined night. all i wanted was a quick drink to calm my nerves after hearing my grandmother passed away before i drove home. some people cope differently!!! now i am on my way to her viewing at green hills memorial in pv.  michael, thank you for your snidey facial expressions, tgif employees are trained and oriented with customer service from open to close (9pm) being that i was there when the restaurant/bar was still open and had guests michael you truly demonstrated customer service and made a great formal complaint letter for me to write to corporate!

They don't take same day reservations. I called right when they opened to make a 2 pm reservation for 7 people.  They said no.  Apparently they think they are better than other restaurants to be this inconsiderate.  I suggest go somewhere else.  Plenty of 5 star restaurants take same day reservations.

Went to dinner before hitting knotts scary farm. We got there around 5. Hostess told us about 10 min wait. We waited about 25 mins. Our waitress didnt come till almost 545... Was not friendly at all. Didnt get our drinks til almost 615.. At this time we were all very annoyed because we had to leave by 7. We watched her walked by many times. Not once did she asked if we needed refills or anything else. We finally got up to talk to a manager. She came by around 645 and we told her we wanted to cancel our order and just get our bill. She told us even if we did cancel our order and didnt eat she would still charge us for the food. She said they were very busy. There wasnt that many people even in the restaurant. I have worked in the food industry and that was NOT busy at all. Our food came about 6:55. Soup was cold. Chicken on salads was cold. She brought the bill . Didnt give us our discount for being pass holders. When we told her she got mad and told us why didnt we remind her and now she would have to go back and re do our bill and get my card authorized. Like it was such a HASSLE for her... Didnt even bother to do a discount for the wait. Nothing. Very rude . I will not be returning.

Dear Alex , mr bartender himself! I just want to say thank you . Today I only came into fridays because I was so sad . I had my own life going on , but when I came in you made me feel so welcomed and cared for . I haven't had such great customer service in a while . I used to be a server at Dave and busters and you inspired me to go back . You have wonderful customer service and even more consideration . I don't usually leave yelps that are good but I think you deserve it . Thank you for being so nice to me on my rainy day ! Means a lot , your the only one that reached out to me and that matters ! Thank you ! Go team Fridays !

Needs to be inspected by the health department immediately! Rude staff as soon as we walk in, over priced menu for rotten food. Ordered a $21 appetizer a received 3 hairs in my food as I was cutting into my ribs. When I was asked to take it back I was given attitude & still put on my bill.

The food was okay but I came here on a Sunday thinking that had happy hr all day Sunday like all other Tgis THIS IS NOT THE CASE. So if you want to get your happy hr all day prices do not come here. Other than that service was great.
Hair in my sons chicken salad......5 min I discover a dark hair in my Cajun shrimp pasta. I know this happens once in a while but 2 plates at one table with hair in the food is a huge issue for me.

I was somewhat surprised to have a good experience here after reading the other reviews. We were seated quickly and attended the whole meal by a very friendly and helpful waitress. Granted, the appetizer plates were dirty (we chose not to use them) and the manager seemed to be talking loudly about her life philosophies to various tables. But the food was great, and I have to say the Fried Shrimp meal I had here was the best I've had at a TGI Friday's.

I'm currently sitting here before we even have gotten our food, writing this.  Sitting in the bar, and the bartender Mike is the one taking care of my friends and I.  If you EVER just need a delicious drink, tell him to surprise you.   With every drink he brought us, we were absolutely delighted! He has taken care of us beyond what most bartenders could,  and the level of customer service and attitude that he brought to our group has made our day.  Enough that we count the food as irrelevant in judging this place.   When we come back it will be specifically to have him be our server.  Just because we enjoyed the experience that much.

This was our second time visiting this particular location. The service was not that great the first time, but thought we'd give it another try. BIG Mistake! We sat at the bar since there were seats available & we didn't want to wait an hour to be seated in the dining area. It took at least 20 mins to get menus. When the bartender came over we all asked for water, silverware & napkins. We got the water, but no silverware/napkins. Once we ordered, the food came out fairly quickly, but the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich was tough & the BBQ chicken flatbread pizza barely had any toppings- very dry. We again had to ask for silverware/napkins, as well as ranch which we never received... not to mention, the bartender never once  asked if we needed refills on our water. We ended up asking another employee who happened to be ringing up another parties bill to refill our glasses, which she kindly did.  We've eaten at our local TGIF many times- the food & service has always been great! Don't think we'll be visiting the Knott's location again. Next time we'll walk over to another dining spot.

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. I ordered the French dip for $13 dollars and some change. I asked for cheddar instead of Swiss and apparently cheddar comes at a premium at this place cause they charged me extra. Shame on you Knotts and Shame on you Friday's. There's no need to gouge people like that. And to charge over 4 dollars for a Diet Coke is ridiculous.  Just because you can overcharge doesn't mean you should. We come here to get away form the typical "theme" park prices. I've eaten here in the past and never paid $60 dollars (including tip) for 2 meals, one kids meal, and one appetizer. I know your business will do fine with out us,  but I'll never eat at your restaurant again.

Fridays is fun enough however, after a fun day at Knott's, we stopped in for a drink. Both my wife and I ordered a Crown Apple cocktail that included agave sour. I thought agave was sweet. Anyway, the drink was way too sour and even though the bartender tried to adjust,it was still too sour. Another bartender checked the agave and it was spoiled. We both changed our drinks. That night, I had the worst acid reflux I have ever had. I am very disappointed in the quality of that experience.

This place steals your money. The prices are too overly priced & the portions are small. They don't do the unlimited apps because they are apart of Knotts yet they won't fill up our Knotts souvenir cup. The waitress was friendly but everything else sucks.

Not the best location. Service was sub par and they didnt have any vodka for the drink that I ordered. Seeing as I'm only here for Knott's, I wont be back at this location again. The bartender was very nice tho. He offered to make me another drink. Dont remember his name tho.

Wow. Service just fine, But! $8.00 FOR ONE BOTTLE OF BEER? Really?  Plus tax so one pacifico $8.64 , plus $1.00 tip, always have to tip, not her fault TGIF prices arr insane, know reason to come back here. Now i remember why we stoped going. CHEERS Ok i will edit a little bit. Because its on knotts berry farms protery and not owed by TGIF thats why do expensive. I get it.  Stars do not represent employee its for the High Prices and no Specials.

My bf & I have the knotts season pass so we come to knotts pretty often. We've never been to Fridays before so we came to this one. I expected the prices to be high because it is close to the theme park. Decor is really nice, staff was nice too. Our waiter greeted us quickly and took our order. We got the mozzarella sticks which were okay. I got the BBQ grilled chicken salad that I made vegetarian, but when I got it it had bacon. They were not hesitant to make me a new one though which I was very happy about :) My bf got the boneless hot wings that he really liked. Overall it was a good experience.

I visit TGIF in my area religiously but only come to the Buena Park location when I'm in the area for Knott's. So for me to give this place a low rating is difficult but this place makes it very easy for me to rate them a low rating. First of all, this place is EXPENSIVE. Since it's on the Knott's Berry Farm property, it gives them the right to UP their prices up, which I was open for. Besides me and some other guy siting at the bar, there was no one else ordering anything from the bar. I ordered a drink and it took them a few minutes for them to bring me a drink. Heck, my appetizers came out faster than my drink. The bartenders seemed to be a bit distracted but remained friendly. Only cool thing about this Friday's location is that they have a cool decor set up. I racked up a $50 bill just for a few drinks which I would of payed half of that at my regular TGIF location with tip included but oh well. Overall experience was alright. Would I be back? Sure. I'll just ask my bank to give me loan before I come here.

Unauthorized charge on my card from this location! A couple of friends and I went here several months ago, and the server changed my check to give himself a $20.00 tip! Yes, you read that right.  The food was mediocre, and he never came back to our table to check on us. He only shouted from 3 tables away and asked us if we were okay maybe once the whole time we were there. We were so dissatisfied with his effort that we decided not to leave a tip.  I check my account a week later and I realize he wrote in $20 for his tip because the charge was $20 dollars more than I authorized! I called the store manager when I found out. They refunded my money, but I will never come here again.

You know when you're at a tourist spot, they've got you by the balls and you're stuck eating wherever is close, since you've already paid for parking.  So, you dive in and hope for the best.  Well, 40 minutes after sitting in the bar area and ordering drinks and food, we finally got our drinks. 10 minutes later, after complaining to there manager, we got our food...AND NO PLATES!  Now, over an hour in, after asking to speak to the manager twice, she has yet to come over.  Avoid this place at all costs. This is ridiculous!

Really bad service. They have a million people working and yet everything takes forever to get. Server forgot my salad dressing.  The burger came out cold and over cooked. The server (a tall chubby guy with glasses) was wearing his black work shirt that looked like he rolled around in cat hair.  The steak was super fatty and bland in flavor considering the price was $25 half the steak was well done the other half medium.  The steak tasted like ground hamburger meat with no seasoning. The appetizer the bacon wrapped stuff jalapeños looked like they were stuffed with cat food.  Worst Friday's ever. My stomach is starting to hurt as I type this. I wouldn't wish this place on my worst enemy!

We don't eat at TGIF often. This chain wants to charge prices in line with other chains that serve much better food and have greater menu selections (e.g., Yard House). The service at this location that is next to Knottsberry farm was so-so, and the food was disappointing. We ordered the Cajun pasta and a chicken salad; we also ordered chicken strips, at a price of $16! At least the portions served at the Yard House are generous. Last time we eat at a TGIF.

YELP 100 review challenge 40/100 Loved loved loved my 1st experience at TGI Fridays. I came in a Saturday afternoon for lunch. After a long morning at Knotts Berry Farm, we were all pooped and ready for something yummy.  My brother ordered a blue raspberry lemonade which he didn't like much. He regretted ordering it but drank anyways. I mentioned to waitress half way through his drink, and she was willing to bring something else out. She was a total doll her name was Gina. But, bro settled for a water.  We ordered the green fingers aka "Crispy Green Bean Fries." The green fingers were too oily for me. We ordered two appetizer bbq chicken pizzas without chicken. A lovely big fat hamburger for bestie that came with a huge side of fries. All I can say is my bbq chicken pizza without meat was bomb. I shared one slice with bestie and the rest was gobbled. I loved that it was thin crust, the combo of the bbq flavor, cheese, onions, and cilantro was insane.  I loved loved loved the interior decor. They played 80s best! The service was super friendly. We left happy and hyper! Ready to take on the rest of Knotts Berry Farm!  Ps-clean restrooms.

After a day at Knott's with my family I just wanted to have some good food. Since I was watchin it weight wise, I ordered a salad. My mom and I also ordered the spinach dip and as an app. We were served pretty fast which was great because my niece was complaining.  When we got our food I saw that their  salad had more chicken than lettuce. There was tons of dressing and it was served on a small plate. I just wanted a fresh salad. It wasn't that great. My mom ordered a steak lunch and wasn't that excited about it either. My niece didn't complain she enjoyed her fries.  Overall, I thought the service was excellent but the food was  :/ . Also the prices are a bit inflated due to the close proximity of Knott's.  I think you would be better off with a standard burger and fries here. Not a salad joint. Just keep it simple here. I like the convenience being so close to the park but the food could be better.

My boyfriend and I ate here the other night after we went to Knotts Scary Farm. The food was absolutely horrible.. I got the BBQ chicken flat bread, there was a ton of cheese and it was so soggy. Not how a flatbread should be at all. My boyfriend got the black bean & avocado burger, the patty was so mushy it was falling apart and there was no avocado. Very disappointing. Won't be returning to any TGI Friday's

Leaving Knott's and going to have a bite to eat you expect to get something good, totally the opposite.... Food was just bad. We thought we had ordered HOT wings and we end up with COLD wings!! On two different orders. The French fries stale and cold.  My drink oh boy! I ordered it because it looked appealing and I wanted to try it out.... For the $13.00 that I paid for, I sure was expecting something way better than what I got.  It is simply a joke. I'll just stick to eating at Knott's.

Soda is $4.29! Plus this steep price is absent on the menu. Refills only on iced tea. My friends have a season pass to Knotts Berry Farm and get a 10% discount here. But our server, who we later found out was new, did not ask if we have a season pass. We were inconvenienced in coming back later for the discount. Being new is no excuse.  Overall service was ok. I was only one in party who needed more time to decide. Our waiter said he'd come back for me. We had to ask for him to come back. However, he did check in with us on our food twice. Kids meals - 2 cheese burgers are like mini sliders, with a huge serving of fries, enough for 2 people. Fries were good, not too salty. But the fries and huge turkey burger on the kids' menu made me wonder if TGIF aims to promote childhood obesity.   The chicken fingers and fries, and deep fried shrimp with fries entrees looked standard. The shrimp were heavily battered.   I wish they had a lite menu like BJ's other similar franchise restaurants. A "healthier" salad option had about 660 calories. Prices are high for what you get although I did like my parmesan crusted chicken breast. Moist with mozzarella and cherry tomato fresh basil and purple onion salad. It came with a big side of mac and cheese, topped with bread crumbs. But I think my meal upset my stomach in evening. This is a nice place to eat in, with walls decorated cool w rock album covers in entrance and miscalaneous pop culture stuff on the walls. Definitely better looking than Red Robin. The A/C was on too high. Clean bathroom. Nice looking bar. Cool display of walk of spirits as you walk to the restrooms.  I think I'd rate this place and my experience 2 stars. 3 if not for the pricey soda with no refills and the inconvenience of going back for our significant $12 discount. Good thing the bill adjustment didn't take long cuz otherwise we would have left. Next time I'm at Knotts, I would probably want to walk further outside to Flame Broiler for lunch.

Such a horrible location. I love tgifridays but this place is a wreck. For being a destination location they really have horrible service. The waitress was nice but dang she took forever to take our orders then we sit here waiting for food. It's been empty, only one other group came in since we arrived but this place is practically empty yet we are still sitting here, an hour later, and still no food. To top it off I've killed at least 8 ants on table and been itching all over like there are more. We never got silverware and when apps were brought out we had to ask manager for silverware and that took a while to get to. Hard to eat salad without a fork. NEVER coming here again.

Service good. Ordered no cheese on a salad and it came with cheese. They brought it back and it looked like they made a new one. Found out half way through they just tried to pick the cheese out. Having a dairy allergy this sucks for me. No guidance to staff on how to handle a complaint. Waiter tried to leave the full bill, then sent the kitchen manager out, then offered not even a discount but then asked us if he should do that. Sign of poor management. Won't go again. Beware if you have allergies!!'
This plate i got was so nasty the shrimp is rubbery, the pasta is hard and the chicken tasted like water!

If I could give 0 stars I would for Jonathan the manager who is playing host instead of managing his restaurant. Chelsea is an awesome server who is working hard to make the best of a mismanaged restaurant. Waited 25 minutes for our drinks. Finally went to the bar to get it myself. One hour later still waiting for our food. Never again!

Be aware this not a regular TGI Fridays, what I mean is they are owned by Knott's so they don't have the same specials as the rest of the chain restaurants.  They ad lib on their menu items which is too bad. I had their Mediterranean Mahi Naan sandwich and it was an epic fail, the bread was pita not naan, the yogurt aioli was plain yogurt mixed with mayo, they added cotija cheese (so Mediterranean right?!) It was hard to eat it since it was only held together with a pick. I wouldn't recommend  it to anyone again. Their menus don't have prices for everything. Other members in my party were also not impressed with their food.

I went to this TGIF location today. We went to watch football and have a beer , maybe eat. We sat at the bar and ordered a beer. We were asked for our ID's. I did not have my I D as we were at Knotts Berry Farms and I did not want to carry my purse. I am 60 years old. They refused to serve me . I explained that my purse was in the car, and I have a blown out Achillies tendon and was unable to walk back to the car and return. The rude bartender said yo bad and I can not serve you. I could understand if I looked young but I am solid white headed and look my age. We will NEVER go back to this location!!! We have been there many times in the past.

The waitress Surena was attentive, polite, and extremely friendly. Besides my waitress, the customer service was horrible; non-attentive to consumers needs. There wasn't a host/hostess to greet me, and I waited 3-4 minutes before being seated with hardly a lot of people dining. It is lunch hour and this particular 'TGI Fridays Knotts Berry Farm' on Friday, 9/15/17 is empty. It is 5-6 tables in the entire establishment. Lord help them with customer service and greeting people with a warm welcome. The staff is cold and lazy. I was very specific in telling my waitress Surena how I wanted my Cheeseburger WELL DONE, no blood. I don't like blood in my meat. Give it back to the farm if there is going to be blood in the meat (for ME). It REALLY UPSETS ME when there is blood in my (meat) BEEF when I tell the server NO BLOOD. The chef must not have intaked my request. It was 70/30 with blood and well-done. I told Surena of my dissatisfaction of my lunch. She was EXCELLENT with serving the consumers during my time here. The alcoholic beverages were alright; average.... I asked for my 'Gin & Juice' strong and light on the rocks. The bar tender (s) needs improvement. Overall, this is not a TGI Fridays I would recommend to consumers whom are familiar with the brand. It is under 'Knotts Berry Farm' and completely disassociated from the  traditional TGI Fridays of EXCELLENCE. I am on this side of town today for business and desired lunch. I am unimpressed and don't suggest you come here. My waitress Surena was the most impressive element!

Came for a quick drink before going to Knotts. I asked for a Jack and Coke (Double) and got a large glass cup with 75% Coca Cola. I was going to say something immediately but the guy serving us was in such rush to clock out (I knew this's because he kept telling the other bartender) so preferred to wait until he left. So after he left I asked the other bartender if they usually serve Jack and Coke in a Large glass cup. She said no but their smaller cups were dirty. There's more to this story.. To keep it short and simple, the Bartenders at TGIF next to Knotts are not here to satisfy their guest but to earn their hourly and clock out. Ohh, I got my Double Jack and Coke as I wanted at the end, as you can see in the picture
I've been to this location twice and both times, my beer has had a funny taste. I then ordered a coke and it was completely flat. The food never fails, but someone has to work on those drinks.

I have no idea what you guys are being charged on rent or how much of a cut Knotts wants but its beyond ridiculous with your no happy hour and overpriced alcohol and food....I recommend people going to Claim Jumpers, Outback Steak House, or Buffalo Wilds Wings in the area.

Don't come here.  First of all the service and food was terrible. Over an hour wait for our food to be served. Barely any refill or attention from our waitress.  The food got there all cold like it's been sitting for a while. And you can tell it had been bc the avocado was turning brown. The buns were stale and overly toasted. My cousin ordered a tea and the outside of the cup was slimy and it slipped off her hand and got everywhere. Which will probably stain her clothes. I would expect for the 80 dollars we spent we could at least get our waitress to clean the cups, make sure that our food is warm, etc. Bad experience!! And to top it off, we believe she tried to steal from us. We had a gift card to pay off. She came back saying it had 0 balance so I was forced to pay w my visa.  We left and check the transaction of the gift card and you could see that she charged it. Thankfully the manager (which was kinda careless) got the refund back but it was just 3 hours off our life that we could have had a better experience at a McDonald's .

There was no silverware, gave us a half booth even though we wanted a full booth. Our waitress only came to check up on us only 1 time that i remembered. When i go out to eat, anywhere in fact, im a very harsh critic, and i like everything to go perfect, i didn't sense that from this establishment. Sorry but the 1 star still follows.

Wow servers really really suck the only one that did there job was the one that lead me too my seat but everyone else was bad like no one came up too me to ask what i would like too drink until like 10mins later and then they didnt even serve our drinks until like 5mims later like and they left and then another 5mins later they finally came and took our order like and come on there was barely people eating here so there should be no excuse to be this slow but all in all the food was good

Would not recommend this location. Not like the usual TGF. No specials.  Beware of the drink prices. They don't list the price in the menu, when we got the bill we were shocked, $13 per drink! And they were small too. Wife ordered a soup. It was in a tiny cup, like the size of a small coffee cup. She wanted a soup/salad combo, no luck, can only order them separately. Food and service were ok, but prices are inflated.

Went here with 7 other people today. So the good things first..:. Service was pretty good for 8 people. Food was actually good and fresh. They sat us right away. Bad things: kind of dirty The worst was the price... THIS IS A WARNING TO EVERYONE who wants to go to this one.... NO HAPPY HOUR and the prices are double of a regular TGIF. A 22 Oz blue moon draft is 12.60 dollars plus tax and with tip?? About 15 bucks for just a beer. Ridiculous. Corona light bottle 12 ounce is 8 bucks plus tax and fees. I got 3 appetizers and 3 beers (corona light) after tax and tip I was at 65 dollars! By myself wow!

Went to Friday's regardless of the review's I've seen so far. Was told they've hired new people and the service was amazing! My server, I think her name was Danielle was super friendly and informed us she was in training and was on top of everything. She greeted us with a smile and took our drinks and food orders quickly, food tasted great and at the end of the night she even made sure we got our discount for season passes.  Was very pleased and would definitely come back!  Would definitely suggest for people to try this place again, seems like they've got it down!

My friends and I stopped by for a quick appetizer and drink session while visiting knots berry farm and were absolutely delighted by our bartender/server Alex! He was so welcoming and made our drinks extra strong and was so handsome lol. Thank you TGI FRIDAYS for booking it up with great drinks and food!

The service here is top notch. All of the servers and bartenders worked as a team to make sure that we were taken care of and were able to accommodate our special requests. Cindy especially went above and beyond in making us feel like welcomed guests. In a mistake that I made when ordering for my party, she stepped in and was able to remedy the situation super quickly and efficiently. Will definitely recommend, all due to the service and delicious drinks :)

Don't know why this Fridays has such a low rating I've been here a few times over the years and never had any issues. Granted it does get really busy here because its @ Knotts but that's a given. Our food was hot and delicious our server was nice and from what I saw the facility was clean! We will be back before Knotts because the food wasn't bad they sell booze here and you get a 10% discount for being a Knotts season passholder! This is definitely one of the better places to eat wile at Knotts!

Wish I had gone on Yelp before making plans for lunch today.  My sister gave us a giftcard she didn't want so I thought, what the heck, it's been years, let's give 'em another try.   I'm pretty sure, the Cerritos location has a lunch menu, this one did not, but then, inside the park at Knott's means it will be a tourist trap.   We ordered the Jack Daniel's hamburger $14.60 and the French Dip sandwich for $12.60 with 2 waters.  The French Dip was described as having mushrooms but there was NO mushrooms in the sandwich.  It was decent as was the burger.  The service was just ok.   When we got the bill, we were charged $15.50 and $13.00 plus 9% tax.  So, we kindly told our waitress and the manager took care of it and adjusted our bill.  I thought, how often do people check to make sure the price on the menu is the same on the bill?!  Methinks, this happens all the time and not enough people notice for them to care. Bottom line:  we would NEVER eat at this place again.  The service reminds me of The Hard Rock Cafe in Hollywood, nothing special because they know most of these people won't be back until the next time they're in town on vacation.  If they come back, at all.

if you're thinking of eating here,  you might as well eat at McDonald's.  food was blah... fries were soggy burger had no flavor.  please off you don't want to throw away your money,  go somewhere else.

DO NOT come to this Friday's. It's connected to Knott's Berry Farm which means you have to pay for parking and they do not have the same menu as other locations. They have super weird awkward tables. Just do yourself a favor and don't come. Go to Orange instead. On top of all of that, our waitress was very annoying and condescending. Very bad experience.

The food was really good ! We had to be seated by the bar area cuz last sat was packed cuz of scary farm .. We got our drinks and food ! They were really good .. I hate sitting in barstools they are uncomfortable lol but oh well .. Our waitress was friendly too .. But that area was sooo hot :(  ughhh but its ok .. Love tgi fridays:)

This place is a rip off! No happy hour, no coupon promotions allowed, no nothing. And only bc it's next to Knotts they don't allow this, hence all the money you just spent at Knotts. Oh not to mention $11 bud light. Come on!!! It seemed like every time I asked the server for something it was always a no, no, no. Waste of time, waste of money. Never again.

HORRIRBLE! POSSIBLY THE WORST TGIF IVE EVER BEEN TOO! I got the spinach artichoke dip and few hours later it was making me PUKE, and until right now I'm still puking. I also currently developed slight DIARRHEA and it hurts like no other. We also had very bad service and I HIGHLY recommend no one ever comes here especially if you're going or leaving Knotts. NEVER TRUST THEIR FOOD and on a personal matter your restaurant ruined my New Year's Day. So thank you guys for that. I'll never forget this experience!

Vacationing at Knotts Berry Farms for our annual family vacation. Decided to try having dinner here since it has been a while since we've been to TGIF.  The wait was minimal which was nice. Since we had a party of 13. My dad and husband both ordered the steak which they said was good. I loved my peacon crusted chicken salad. I ate the whole thing! I gave 4 stars because my daughter meal came out cold. I didn't send it back because she had fallen asleep while waiting for her dinner.  Would have liked to see more pasta entrees on the menu.

Okay so hostesses don't get reviewed much so I'm going to do that. The hostess, Jasmine, was so polite and did her job thoroughly. She knew how to deal with all the customers and is great at what she does. She was so polite while seating us even though the place was packed with nagging people. Jasmine is so amazing and I would tip her out if I had more cash. However, this place bankrupted me.
Not like other TGI Fridays. I do not recommend. Poor management and customer service.

Will not return!! Service sucked (it took 15 plus minutes for someone to even bother coming over to our table) food sucked (it was cold and tasted like it has been sitting over night) everything was dirty (including our silverware). This Friday's could care less about their business or customers.
Only ones in there and the waiter and cook both forgot and messed up. Also crrrraazy $$

Came here today with my husband and the kids for dinner. Got seated in less than 5 minutes. Waitress was friendly and accommodating. Our food came out pretty quick. My husband had the ribs which he said were good. My son had the mac and cheese which was pretty good too. I had the California club. Pretty plain sandwich. Possibly needing more flavor. Not a fan of the ranch they have. Other than that pretty good place to eat. Next time I'll have to pick something else off the menu.

Worst place I have ever sat down to eat service was slow. The place was not even busy. Pricing is a little high but hey location is the key I get it across from Knotts Berry Farm. Food was not up to par could have got better quality from fast food place. Will not ever return nor recommend to anyone. The best part of my dinner was my lemon water. Have 1 star cause you have to. I don't like to complain. But stay away from this place.

Don't go to this place no happy hour specials found this out the hard way ,because knotts owns this place so they have their own prices, I had 6 small beers and sampler player with 4 ribs 4 breaded shrimp and 8 pieces of honey chicken was 78$ plus tip you better off going to BBWW down the street

Sat down with 20+ in my party.  An hour and an a half went by and the food came out, but 1/4 of the order was missing.  They didn't know who's food was who's and so had to call it out.  The outdoor seating tables were filthy and there was water on them, plus the table cloth is just a plastic cover that they re-use.  I guess they don't do a pre-check on when they seat customers.  We called ahead to let them know our party size.
