My buddy had to wait another 20 minutes for his food since they forgot and in the meantime was thirsty so he wanted another raspberry iced tea, they said they had to charge him for the refill... WoW, btw it took a total of over 2hrs to get my food.

i have always visited this place since i was very young. i used to question why we would come when it wasn't friday. the service is always amazing, but the place is always overly crowded which always is a hassle going to and eating. it it almost stressful to be at the establishment with all the people and noice inside the place. waiting time is always long, which is terrible.

A group of us came in for lunch, taking a break from knotts. Not only are the prices super expensive, but the service is terrible. Our waitress was being really rude. The food was cold and missing ingredients. The slushies were syrup with ice floating at the top. Never coming back.

I'm not sure why all the bad reviews. We came on a Saturday around 1145a and it wasn't that busy. We were greeted and sat as soon as we walked in. Our waiter came to our table right away and was very nice. We got our drinks and ordered. Food came out hot and fresh. I mean what else do you want people? The place was clean and looked fine to me. Thanks for the great experience Knotts TGI Fridays!!!

This place is no Good...Service Sucks! Food Sucks! And they can't mix a drink if their life depended on it! We sat ourselves and waited for someone to acknowledge us...bout 30 mins later we got menus and water in dirty cups...nasty! Ordered some cocktails and what a disappointment!...Ordered Appitizers...got them 30 mins later cold...asked for a replacement and by this time I was over it and just waited for my main dish..Jack Daniels ribs and shrimp...Yuck...Ribs were dry...hardly any Bbq sauce..and the shrimp seemed to have been dropped in cold oil before plating them...so greasy...Never Again will I go to this Friday's...And maybe never go to any another again! Knott's Berry Farm Should get Rid of this place and bring in some new..with a fresh menu!

Second time here and nothing has changed from the first visit.  Overpriced because it's in Knott's? Ok makes sense. HOWEVER, with one of the most famously known restaurant brands, how dare you have horrible customer service?!  Place was pretty empty for a Friday night, so there's no excuse why we saw our waitress twice. One to bring one round of drinks and one to bring appetizers. Saw her walk all over the bar area and never bothered to come around our dinner order (eventhough we had specifically asked her to come back in a few) and our drinks we empty for the full hour we managed to stay there!  Never again.... at least never at this particular spot.

This place sucks!..All the bad reviews are true... I'll leave it at that... Was there today. Watered down rip-off drinks and mediocre overpriced food. This one soured me on the whole chain. Never going back to any TGI Fridays... Walk out to Beach Blvd., folks--tons of other, better options...
Great service friendly staff, but if your looking for the typical tgi Fridays specials or unlimited apps. Don't not come here. They do not offer anything

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Rude staff. Our food was cold. The rude host was staring at my sister who has Down's syndrome, giving her a disgusted look up and down as if she was looking at an animal!!! So disrespectful. Calling corporate first thing in the morning. Rude waitress and manager as well, no wonder this place has so many negative reviews !!! Never come here !! Also my bank card declined when I had money on there so they made ME walk to the knotts hotel so that I can pull the money out of my card from the ATM machine there  instead of trying to fix the problem with their system ! (Keep in mind I was not staying at that hotel because I'm a local) so it was so unnecessary! And not only that, while I was walking to pull money out,  my mom and sister stood at the restaurant, my sister had to use the bathroom so my mom started walking her and all the staff ran to my mom and sister as if they were trying to run out of the restaurant and tried telling my mom and sister they couldn't use the bathroom !!! What the f*** !!!! Not only that, but because this tgi is owned by knotts, it's way more expensive, they don't have happy hour, and they're menu is small, so little choices to choose from. Never ever come to this restaurant!! I will be calling corporate, because the manager sure as hell doesn't care how his staff acts because he's rude too!

Do not go here unless you want to get ripped off... Not a full Friday's menu, extremely over priced with tiny portions.  We tried to go pregame before going to medieval times and thought Friday's would be a great place to do that. Man were we wrong. $9 for a beer,  $12 for a mini quesadilla and no nachos even on the menu. Potatoes skins were practically fabricated put of drywall. The service was the only thing that was acceptable. Honestly I regret going here and would have rather given my money anywhere else. Be warned...

One of the worst locations. This restaurant is owned by Knotts so NO they do not have a happy hour menu, which brings me to say that you are spending Full price for everything.... no deals, and the service is horrible, did I mention that the service is horrible. I sat in the bar area at the bar  I could count on one hand just about how many people were sitting in the bar area, and I still had to ask for assistance the bar tender did not ask once if I was good or if I needed anything. Horrible. I must mention that I live TGI Friday just not this one.

This place is alittle slow when it comes to service, but tonight I came in with my family and it was slow which we decided to sit in the bar area on one of the booths. Our server Allison, looked tired as soon as she came in and took our drink order, 10 min passed and she finally came and brought our drinks. Soon after that she took our order and never saw her again, the bar guy "Michael" saw us sitting there for over 20 min and came up and took over from there on. I would of walked out after ordering 120.00 worth of food but this guy totally saved the day and appreciated his excellent service, we need more servers like him. I tip well except when it's terrible service, which is what we just experienced should of been a 1 but gave them a three do to the bar guy.. Thanks Michael
Long lines, small portions, over inflated price and takes a long time for the food to come out. I wish I would have spent my money elsewhere. $10 dollar kids meals.
HORRIBLE!!!! The place is filthy, overpriced and not to mention bad service. If I could give it no stars I would. Never spending my money there again.

Dropped in for a quick beer today while I was in the area. What i can suggest from my brief visit was that the place was immaculate and our server, Megan was terrific. The country music was blaring, just like I like it.  Sorry for the brief review. It was a grab and go thing!

I LOVE TGI Fridays, but I HATE this location!! There should honestly be 3 or 4 dollar signs for this place. It's  obsurd that they think anyone should pay $30 for a diner quality steak. Might as well put Knott's name on the front of the building since they obviously have their hands deep in the pockets. I paid for my $5 soda and got outta there.

I would give 0 stars if I could. Absolutely everything about this location is ridiculous. First of all their phone number was busy everytime I tried to call before I got there to ask about the wait. Me and my boyfriend were attending the Halloween haunt at Knotts tonight and we wanted some food and drinks before so we came here (I was celebrating my birthday). We put our name down and eventually found a spot in the corner of the bar and sat there and asked for menus and they cleaned our table- never brought menus and waitress never came back for at least 5-10 minutes. I asked the front desk for menus instead. Then with still no service we found a spot at the actual bartop after some people left and moved there. We noticed the food prices were much higher than our local TGI Fridays (at the long beach towne center). We regretted not going to the one by our house instead. Also there is no happy hour at this location. Their price gouging was not the only turn off, but also the service we were getting at the bartop. The bartender asked for our IDs and then saw we had menus and asked immediately for a debit or credit card to open a tab for us even though we hadn't ordered anything yet. I asked him if I could see an additional drink menu (besides those listed on the food menu) and something that might have prices and he replied with unnecessary sass and said "restaurants do not ever have prices for drinks listed". And I thought that was strange because I work at a restaurant in Lakewood, CA and we definitely have all drink prices listed on our menu. Also the over TGI Fridays location has a booklet of drinks and at the end there is a list of prices. My boyfriend ordered an Oktoberfest Sam Adams and the bartender said it would be over $13!!! We told him nevermind. ((It was cheaper to buy that same beer inside the actual theme park, Knotts berry farm!!)) The waitor then responded with "well you guys are at a theme park on a busy Friday night during an event." Which I thought was rude and condescending. I understand it's a busy night and Im next to a theme park but I do not understand the attitude and lacking of attentive staff in the bar.  I can't believe anyone actually eats at this TGI Fridays. My boyfriend and I ended up walking to Claim Jumper and had a delicious dinner and awesome happy hour priced drinks and some appetizers.  Overall extremely disappointed with this service at this TGI Fridays and will NEVER be returning- definitely sticking to my local location and staff back at home.  Very disappointed ;( wish I had something awesome to say.

Overpriced. That summarizes it really. The menu is limited compared to a normal Friday's, the prices are inflated. The food just okay. We didn't have a lot of choice so settled for here. Next time we will plan better and try somewhere cheaper and taster. Service was okay. That is why it's wasn't one star.

This particular Friday's doesn't do any of the promotions, so don't bother with that.  As a matter of fact, just skip this location all together.  I came to this location years ago when they first opened and it was great. I had a second visit a few years ago, and it was still pretty good except for the service. I guess that's why I hadn't come back until 9/15/2014. The hubs and I came in for a bite after catching a movie, since we had some gift cards left over from Christmas that we still hadn't spent. I should have known to turn and walk away immediately after entering because the place was dead. There were a few people who were obviously tourists, but it was just dead. The service was okay, nothing spectacular (though you think it would be given that we were some of the ONLY customers, but whatever).  My big issue is with the food. The menu is super limited in comparison to other TGI Friday's locations, and they jack up the prices big time. I ordered one of the cheaper items on the menu: a French dip sandwich for $12.50. It came with a small (and I mean small) salad on the side, which was the best part of the whole thing. The sandwich itself was just nasty. The au jus was just salt and no flavor, the meat was dry and crappy (though they claim it's prime rib). It was just....blah. The hubs got some burger that he said was "just okay" which came with the tiniest portion of fries ever. Our bill was about $35. In retrospect, it would have been better just to stay around the mall and grab food at one of the establishments there, because then I would have at least gotten my money's worth.  If you have your heart set on Friday's, do yourself a favor and find a different location.

If I could give it no stars, I would. First off, we ordered our food and had to call the manager over after waiting over 30mins. We didn't order big, I ordered a side of shrimp and a side of mashed potatoes, my kids ordered mac n cheese and kids sliders, my husband ordered appetizer  sliders and a side of fries. That should not take as long as it did. A man with child came in after us and got his food before us. I was pissed. I called the manager over, she apologized and asked what she could do. As a manager I think she should of offered something herself, not ask what she could do. Our food finally came, which she brought and our food was cold. She felt it as well, apologized again and took back our food and offered to bring out again. I told her forget it. The kids were excited to go to Knotts. We went to this Fridays to save money but i would pay more for food inside Knotts because that would at least be wqrm when we got it

I went this past Friday while waiting for my daughter who was at KSF. I asked the host if there was a quiet place for me to sit, have some food and a glass of wine and read for a while. He was SO nice, said the patio is quiet, and they would even turn the music down for me! The girl  who seated me was super sweet too. My server was wonderful and attentive, and even another server came out several times to see if I needed anything. Then to top it all off, I left my Kindle tablet there and didn't realize it. The manager emailed me to let me know she had it and would keep it in the safe until I could come get it. Customer for life! Now when I have to take tweens to park I know where I will be hanging out!!
Wow! What a dump! Still waiting game for the kids' orders to come in.... Not impressed. Would of gotten a better deal and service at the all you can eat.... Not justified for the prices..

Well I would tell you about a food experience if we actually had one.  I would tell you about a drink experience if we had one.  We didn't even get that far. 4 of us sat at the bar. 2 people sat next to us at the same time.  After waiting about 10 min without being acknowledged, we finally got a "give me just a sec". Waited another 10 min. The 2 next to us had already asked if they could order something and didn't get acknowledged.  They left.   Finally someone else walked up to us and puts napkins down on the bar, asks us if we wanted menus which we did, then she nonchalantly walks over to get the menus, hands them to us and then walks away!!! Ummmm why did you put napkins down if you weren't going to take our drink order?!  Mind you, yes this is on a Friday night and all the tables were pretty full. But a little acknowledgement goes a long way.  I get it, it's cold season, maybe they had call outs, maybe..... whatever.  I am trying to give them the benefit of the doubt but seriously.  Ridiculous.  We walked out. And the guy behind the bar apologizes.  Little late for that. If you want a place to sit and rest your feet after a long day at Knotts, then this is the place.  But if you actually want some service...... good luck.

If I could put negative stars I would!  This by far is the worst TGI Fidays EVER!!! I got food poisoning immediately after leaving the so called resturaunt.  I knew the chicken tasted old!  Horrible drinks please don't go here I have been throwing up for 3 days straight.

Entered with my husband and 4 kids. No one was there to greet us. There was no sign stating we could seat ourselves. After waiting a few minutes we walked right out. Ended up going to Knotts chicken dinner across the street where we were tended to immediately.
The business hours state they are open until 11. It is 9:06 and their doors are locked

I'm assuming if there was a TGI Friday's at Disneyland or Downtown Disney, the service wouldn't be as horrendous as it is here at this location by Knott's Ghetto Farm (I mean...Berry..).  FYI: -Menu here is not like every other TGI Friday's you've been to. It's smaller with basically the items on the bigger menu (at all other locations) that no one wants to order. -Waitstaff is utterly confused and all over the place. -Food tastes like rhino balls. Only thing I enjoyed was the fact that when we got there to eat, after being dizzy from a couple roller coasters, we found seats at the bar right away and we got our waters in a timely manner.

Ok, I knew this place would be overpriced, being at knotts...but dear lord... They don't put drink prices on their drink menu...theres a reason, they don't want you to know. I chose the chicken and shrimp combo...they don't show the price for that either and the waiter didnt share it, it's over 33 by the way...but don't for the love of God and your stomachs order it. I would have been better off eating my shoe. The menu has a lovely picture of chicken coated in rich sauce...nope.  it tasted as dry as it looked, unfortunately. It appears clear the place doesn't care. We  notified the waiter who brought our check of my dissatisfaction...his answer, well we are owned by Knotts...good to know...dear Knotts Berry Farm, the staff at tgifridays says not only the price but the misleading pictures and awful cooking are your fault. You should be ashamed..GOOD GRIEF, YOUR GRANDMA SHOUKD INVITE US OVER FOR TURKEY AND ALL THE FIXINGS!

My family and I went to knotts Berry Farm Saturday to celebrate my daughters 8th birthday and wanted a nice place to sit down and eat. We discovered this TGIF as we walked out of the park after getting stamped, so naturally we decided to try it out since we all have liked and ate and a TGIF before. Our service was horrible from the start, not to mention the ridiculously high priced food at this TGIF. The food was skimpy and lacking freshness and menu options seem like they have only a few items for lunch and dinner that are priced double the regular TGIF price. The nachos my husband and I ordered were 5 mini tostadas with dried black beans and pico de gallo I was so embarrassed for this place. We also didn't get silverware and napkins till we were done eating. Don't waste your money or time going here it's a rip off and you'll be disappointed. The food inside knotts berry farm is so much better and worth it compared to this horrible place. Based on my experience this place needs zero starts.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  Worst service I've ever received.  1. After being seated for about 10 minutes we finally got some service.  2. The waitress (Allison) got the order wrong. I tried to flag her down for about 7 minutes until I finally gave up and just ate it.  3. She walked past us countess times without making eye contact so we wouldn't ask anything else of her.  4. When she finally came to refill our drinks we had already finished eating so we also asked for the check and napkins. She came back with the refills but no check or napkins. Again we asked for the check and napkins and she finally gets back to us with check only.  I don't know if all the severs here are like this, but the one I encountered was. And because of her I will never come back here.  Pro Tip: Sit at the bar if you get a chance, the service is always better.

$10 kids meal?? Really? Horrible!  Overpriced rippoff "park" location. Bad enough that food in Knotts is bad and overpriced, but to be ripped off by a brand I like just because it's outside the park! Save you money and walk a block.. You will save BIG!

Just came for the $10 all you can eat appetizers, was told they do not honor any promotions that you see on TV or print. This location is owned by Knotts and they just leased the name.  Will not be coming back even though I'm a local. It looks like Chili's will be getting all my business from now on.

This was by far the worst TGIF we have ever eaten at. Food was not fresh! Rib eye over cooked. Ribs tasted old. Service was very slow. Prices are higher too since its owned by Knotts! I will be contacting corporate! Horrible! Don't waste your money or time!

To start, bartender (Michael) was supremely rude and trying to act like a macho man. This guy needs to be fired, gives this place a bad name. I had never been to TGI Fridays and he totally turned me off from this place and I will make sure to tell my friends and family to avoid this place. This guy was a total jerk when I asked him to top off my drink. He said it was company policy to not top off drinks and he started mocking me around the bar top with other customers. The manager of course protected this guy, but I'll give them credit they got him out of the bar after incident. Overall, not happy with this place and I hope people avoid this place.

Waitress was very nice. Everything from there was downhill...more like off a large cliff. $21 fish dinner was dry, burger was burnt, very small portions--with this food that was welcomed, tables unclean.  $10 for kids meal!! When you walk into this TGIF, Knotts Berry Farm location, they need a large sign that says "WE CATER TO TOURISTS ONLY THAT WE KNOW WILL NEVER BE HERE AGAIN, THEREFORE, WE DO NOT CARE ABOUT SERVICE, FOOD, QUALITY OR EXPERIENCE..."  That sign would be 100% accurate.

Horrible, crappy, Dont do it, stay away, do not enter  Over priced, bad service mediocre food. If you are tourist walk across the street to Claim Jumpers. Locals go anywhere else but this place. We sat in the bar area to avoid waiting to be seated. Took a very long time for everything. Had to ask for water 3 times for my son and it never came. Went to the bar for the water and employee directly in front of me washing glasses never acknowledged me. I actually went to an area at the bar to get my own water when a female employee showed up and she was nice and helped me. Like many have said food is ridiculously over priced. It is a tourist area and expensive is expected but this should be illegal. They will place a surcharge on appetizers if that is what you chose for your meal. I noticed a lot of California club sandwiches coming out, mainly because at 13 bucks its one of the cheapest things on the menu. And like my experience here this sandwich also sucked. I sh it you not these things were exactly like the kind of food I got at the park for free when I was a kid. Also reminds me of jail food (dont ask). Thankfully I got a discount because of my season pass for Knotts (this is a knotts property) unfortunately I had to under tip, which I hate doing and rarely do, but thats how bad this was

If there was an option to select no stars I would select that we sat at the bar. Not even the slightest bit busy. For 10 minutes and not one person spoke with us. Then we go to the front asking for a table looking around the restaurant seeing how empty it is and they say there's a 10 minute wait. Must be way understaffed it's a Friday night

The hate this restaurant gets is unwarranted.   I came here last Saturday after spending the day at Knotts Berry Farm.  I found the entire wait staff and bartenders to be very friendly and accommodating.   Our food came out very fast and the drinks were better than what I've been served at high end bars.  TGI Fridays is a casual restaurant, don't expect a evening at Mastros.  I see so many restaurant snobs these days bashing restaurants due to the small details.  Come on!  Its TGI Fridays.  If you came here looking for good drinks, fatty but delicious meals at reasonable prices this place will deliver.   Our waitress/bartender was polite and courteous the entire time, always had a smile on her face.

Friendly waitress is really all they have going for them.  Service takes quite a while. We didn't even go during peak hours. I can only imagine how they must function at peak hours. Seating hostess had trouble finding a table for a party of six. She tried seating us at a trouble for four :-/.  It was just a bad experience. I would only have given 1 star, however, the 2 stars comes from manager not charging for a pretty overcharged side of fries. I warn do not order the side of fries, they are not worth the taste or portion.

This restaurant doesn't even deserve a star when it comes to alcohol. I spent $120 on alcohol and didn't even give me a buzzed. Their alcohol taste like  mixed water....happy hour is still still pricy..so no I am not coming back here anymore. The server is nice tho

We ate at the bar before going into Knott's Berry Farm . The service was good , the food was good , but the table wobbled really bad. So every time I cut my food the table shook . Had to watch the drinks so they didn't spill.

Don't get me wrong, great food, decent service. But the fact that this particular TGI Fridays chooses not to honor the corporate Veteran's Day deal is very disappointing to me. As good as the food and service is, I will not be returning until their policy is amended.
Worst restaurant i have ever been too! My marinara sauce had a macaroni noodle in it, then they remade my order and my potsticker had a hair in it.. unbelievable.

I wish I could give them zero stars. By the way this is my first yelp review ever. I hate to complain, but this time it was ridiculous. We waited and waited no waiter, my kids hamburger was burn,forks where bend,my husband food never came,and if your waiter is Oscar just run for the door. .. worse service ever. WILL NEVER COME BACK. EVEN WHEN THEY OFFERED COUPONS FOR FREE APPETIZERS.!

This place was horrible! We ordered the kids food first to get it first, we got our food before theirs ever was even in the making! All of our food was cold, made half of us sick. They are over priced(probably because they're super close to knotts). The service was horrible, took us 2 hours to order and eat. Will never visit them again and we have season passes to knotts berry farms.

We ordered for the kids first since they were hungry and then we ordered our stuff and appetizers, my build your appetizer was cold as heck, the food got to us late, then when we did get it no utensils, then the kids food was still missing. then came along a manager  the sweet lady in a cane and made it all better but the food taste still was horrible, this coming from a person the eats at TGI  at least once a month. the ONLY REASON THEY GET TWO STARS IS cause they had the raiders game and that manager tried to make it right. She was awesome the servers were no where to be found and it wasn't  even busy

Service was super quick . Was very surprised as it was a haunt night . Took a bit to get a table but once seated everything was great. Food was good for a chain restaurant . We have been coming here for a few years on haunt nights and today I'm very impressed keep up the good work guys!!!

Well ... I went in for happy hour with my friends. We ordered and received our food fairly quick but after that we didn't see the waiter around.  My sister had to go to the bar to request the check and then we waited forever to pay (it doesn't seem busy either). Needless to say, it's been 26mins since we requested the check and still no one has stopped by to pick up our credit cards.  Not good for business!

Probably one of the worst dining experiences I've had. Service actually wasn't that bad, but the food quality was horrible. Ordered chips and salsa, salsa was clearly old. It was visibly bubbling. We told our server and he brought us new salsa, that was still bubbling. My son's sliders were obviously frozen meat patties that were like hockey pucks, and the buns were old and hard, he couldn't even eat them. The fries eben tasted old. My husband's rib eye was drenched in a teriyaki like sauce. Our total with tip, for lunch, was $84... for 2 people and a child! I didn't even see the point of complaining to the manager, because i didnt want to waste my time and they must know that all of the food they are selling is garbage, and over priced.

Sooooooo don't come here when it's busy. We waited 45 min for a party of six. Now I understand parties of 2 and 3 getting sat before us. But when you seat parties of 8 and 10 before a party that's been waiting for 30 min already????  So we order our drinks, and they never come. But the server came back to take our order. We get our salads but still no drinks. We can't eat em...because we don't have silverware. After asking for silverware 3 times, a different server runs over and quite literally dumps a pile of forks and knives on our table and leaves before we can ask for napkins too. At this point, our original server never comes back to our table for the rest of the meal. Probably from shame.  So we ask for a manager, a nice lady claiming to be one of the managers (Amanda?) comes out and seems apologetic and she has clean silverware and napkins brought to us. Still took another 10 min to get our drinks though.  Other runners bring our food. My buddy ordered a burger "as rare as possible" that comes out well done. No pink at all. At this point, there's no point in sending it back. We just ate our food, paid and left. No discount or comps after talking to the manager.  I get it. Scary farm time gets busy but staff accordingly and don't sacrifice service.

Stopped by Wednesday about 2 after day at knotts berryfarm.  Host sat us. About 5 mins later host noticed we had not been helped he returned with drinks. We sat there.  Yea. They were slowing down from lunch rush. But usually people walk by "hey I will be right with you" nope we were ignored.    We left after 10 mins. No one noticed.  Go somewhere else. I'm sure they bank on tourist who are one time only. Also. It's been awhile since I've been in tgif. But menu pricing seemed steep. Not sure if it's up charged since it's in theme park but most menu items were 15-20
The food was good and the people were nice but the prices were a little bit higher than other TGI Fridays. And no $10 endless appetizers

Drive five minutes to get to a decent restaurant.  I usually have a rule, if something doesn't have a price on the menu, I don't order it. I decided to break that rule and ordered a beer. I have been charged less for microbrew beers at actually nice restaurants than I was charged for a mass production corporate beer at this place.  That probably wouldn't have brought me to Yelp to write a bad review, but to go along with the over-priced beer they had really horrible service. For example after waiting nearly an hour, and having not yet even had them take my order I finally gave in and got my own high chair. I had not seen the waiter enough to ask him for one, and there was one left a few tables away which I could procure much easier than I could find a waiter.  There are some really great Korean restaurants a few minutes North on Beach. I suggest going to one of those. Or, if you are not so adventurous, pretty much go anywhere else, this is a tourist trap.
I rate this place, food was waaaaay better than the other locations I've been too. Melissa was very helpful and extremely professional. Service was prompt and the staff was friendly. Thumbs up...

HORRIBLE!  they made my cousin cry! She had something in her food and while she complained politely the staff yelled at her in front of her whole family. She started crying on the spot. They told her that they saw her put it there and she DID NOT. The whole staff was rude! I do not recommend!

This place was a nightmare. Was told it would be 35-45 min for our party of 11. An hour later they told us they were cleaning our table and it would be a few minutes. Then we see another party being seated at our table so I ask about it. They had originally asked for patio so they would be seated faster and then decided it was too cold so the manager let them cut in front of us. When I asked for the manager she just said "Ya, I let them, sorry about that." Really? That's all you're gonna do is say sorry!?!  I'm sorry we came here and it won't happen again. So here's a tip: if you don't wanna wait for a table inside just pretend like you'll take patio and then complain that it's too cold and the manager will let you take cuts in front of all the people waiting.

This was my very first time going to a TGI Fridays.  I don't think it's all that great to say "it's my most favorite restaurant in the world", but at the same time I didn't hate it. TGI's did have its own little charm with all the stuff and decorations around the restaurant, but then again, most places do.  I like the location as it's just across the street from Knott's and withing the complex of the Theme park.  Good when you are in the mood for a nice little meal and not just a corn dog or funnel cake. The wait wasn't too bad when we (Girlfriend and I) came in.  We were given our buzzer and went into the sports shop next door.  About 10 mins later, a table was ready for us so the wait wasn't bad all when it was pretty crowded during the mid afternoon meals.  We were sat, and took our order.  Few minutes later our orders were ready and we both enjoy our lunch.  The customer service here was nice, cleanliness was good, and our dining experience was very comfortable.  There was just that "umph" that was missing, which I can't put my finger on that would make me love this place just a little. Over all, I don't love or hate this place and I would definitely come back again.

Came here craving their Jack Daniel's plate only to find that the prices here for the Jack Daniels (and reading other reviews, other plates) were ridiculously high priced.  The service was very good very friendly and the food came pretty quickly, but it's not worth the price. I asked the server why the prices were so high, he told me they have to have the prices that way because they have to compete with the other restaurants that are near by. Didn't quite understand that, but i'm making sure not to eat here again.
food was tasteless, fries cold stale, asked for bbq sauce twice came when finished. use to be nice place now not so nice

Came with a group of 9 for dinner on a Saturday night.  They initially put us on the patio at a table that had very worn tablecloths and someone smoking on the patio in view of No Smoking signs. We decided to move inside and they easily accommodated us. The service was OK but the food was not.  Don't waste your time.  This place is not managed well. I would have given it a 1 star rating but the service was satisfactory.

Convenient location since we were going to knotts berry farm for halloween. Average service, somewhat high prices, but the food was pretty good! I don't see why we wouldn't eat here again the next time we decide to visit the park.

First review on Yelp whilst visiting from the UK, piled into here starving after exiting knotts berry farm. Wish I had checked Yelp first! DO NOT waste your time. I ordered Parmesan crusted chicken, when it came I cut into the chicken and ate a bite and it was barely warm. You touched the chicken with your finger and it was not hot at all. So I complained, they scraped my chicken off my plate, left me with the pasta, and just got me a "fresh" piece of chicken. When the new chicken came, same again cut it open and it was barely warm. By then my pasta was cold too so I sent the whole thing back and didn't eat. The staff weren't even courteous or apologetic. My daughter ate her Mac and cheese but probably only because she was starving. Also my small draught bud light was flat as anything and not enjoyable, nearly $10 too! What a waste of time and money!!!!!

food was alright but service sucked. Our server didn't know the menu and had to ask the kitchen and then come back with our answers, and then my order was STILL screwed up and wrong so I had to wait 15 mins for a new order. My brothers food wasn't even put in because the server forgot, so he had to eat when we were all done. The servers made up for it (kinda) by providing us with a free large fry, but...also prices are wayyy higher than a typical TGI Fridays and we left the park to go there expecting cheaper prices than the restaurants in the park. Turns out it's owned by Knotts and is still just as much money!! Oh well. The food was really good (when it was right) and portions were plentiful!

Overpriced food and drinks. Horrible service. If you like paying over 10 bucks for a domestic beer and waiting over a hour for you're food then this is you're place. If you want awesome food, ice cold beer, and not being ripped off then you should visit Rock and Brews less then a block north on Beach Blvd. Amazing food, better beer selection, and lower prices.

I was here on a Sunday evening, 5/15/16. Our meal and service was just fine, but I'm motivated to write a review on account of my drink. The bartender, Crispy, made the best (vodka) martini I've ever had!

The food here was on par with most Friday's locations. The service though...it was GREAT! This location hit the nail on the head when it comes to strategy considering the amount of traffic they get from Knotts. Good Job guys! Our server was on top of our table and the other 10 tables she must have had. I will come back and update this review with her name once I go back and find the receipt.

We usually listen to reviews. I will never make the same mistake twice. Everyone that mentioned the price to food ratio were correct. For the sampler we chose boneless wings, pot stickers and (loaded) potato skins. What we received was NOT worth $20 dollars. The pot stickers were the best thing about the sampler while the potato skins were overly fried fries with dried out cheese and bacon (how is that loaded?) The boneless wings were umf, very small pieces of chicken. We also had two drinks, the first one was incorrect and when we pointed it out they took it back. Instead of waste it, wouldn't they just offer it as gesture of their mistake? Everyone was correct who pointed out the terrible service. The guy started out as pleasant but that quickly faded as we waited 5 minutes for a beer on tap, ten minutes for my cocktail and then having to explain the beer was wrong. We will not be returning

Unfortunately this was a complete disappointing experience. The food took forever to get to our table and then it was cold. We sent some of the food back just so it can b returned at room temperature which is not what we expected. Will definitely not come back. Our server was very helpful and polite but unfortunately its not enough for my family and I to come back.
The family loved the food and the service!  Right in and our food was ready fast.  Wings, ribs, everything was goood

This place was horrible.  Waited about 20 minutes for are food. It came out gross and cold. The cheese was horrible and looked and tasted like plastic. Had to wait 5 minutes for a refill for my coke and it took 10 minutes just to get the bill.

Chrispy  (I guess that's how you spell his name). Along with Michael have been a blast.  I have been here multiple times and always at the bar and each and every time has been simply amazing. Thank you for GREAT customer service Waac and every time.

This location was dirty and had the worst service I've ever experienced. Seated quickly, but no one came to get our drink order for 15 min. The prices at this location also seemed to be higher than usual. Some could argue this is due to the tourist factor but it's just wrong. $14.99 for a cold hamburger and fries?!  The wait staff was nice but couldn't seem to hold it together. The place was empty. I'd hate to be a patron on a busy day. Yikes. Never again. Stay away.

Well let me first start by saying I work for TGI Fridays.  We went for dinner after we finished at Knotts. We got in and we're told about 10 minutes. Ok we get seated. We're waiting for our server to come take our drink orders....almost 20 minutes later and I go to the host stand to ask for our server to come take our order. In the meantime I hear the table behind us mention no one has been to take their order either. Well finally a hostess comes over and gets our drink order, however she is not 21 so she can not bring us our beer. Now some male server comes and apologies for the inconvenience that our server went on break and he would take care of us....huh...Ok if our server went to break why would you seat us in that section?!? We put our order in. Get our beers (Sam Adams Cold Snap) and they do not taste like Cold snap. We drink it pretty often. We ordered an app to Start with the Pretzels with beer cheese, now mind you again I work for TGI Fridays and have eaten the pretzels many times, the beer cheese....omg smh was HORRIBLE. Absolutely disturbing. It was BROWN and chunky and tasted like it had been sitting for 2 days or more. In the mean time waiting for our food we've gone through 3 different servers plus a host. We mention the pretzels cheese to the server who tells the manager and they offer us a dessert which we decline. Now the server who should have been our server in the first place that was on break and they sat us in her section while she was on break comes to our table to let us know she was going to be taking care of us and if we needed anything, yes the check please. $85.00 later and no tip for any of the 4/5 different servers/host who came to our table, never ever will we eat there again. What a shame. Oh not to mention the restaurant was dirty!

I came here with my son and my mom a few weeks ago for lunch while we were at Knotts.  It took me FOREVER to find something that sounded good on the menu and on the rare occasion that I did, the prices were SO outrageous.  A kid's chicken tenders meal was $10!  I about fell out of my chair!  Everything was extremely overpriced and food is mediocre...to the point where you're irritated about it for quite a while.  I try to give this place chances every so often to see if they'd get better but never again.

Our server was friendly and attentive.  The host was also friendly and quickly accommodated our large group.  This location is owned by Knott's.  The menu is modified with less options than your average TGI Fridays.  We got in around 7pm and the place was dead.  The bar was completely empty and the dining area had a couple parties.  When I checked the menu I found out why.  This location doesn't have any promos that TGI Fridays have and the prices are inflated since it's on Knott's property. The kids meals alone were $9.29 and only hade four options.  My wife and I ended up eating a cheaper entree due to the pricing.  They do accept the discount offered with the Knott's season pass.   After eating, we drove by Chili's at Buena Park Downtown and the bar was packed.

Michael was beyond great, he was the server/bartender that took over our original server who went on break without saying anything lol but thank goodness we got lucky with Michael he fixed a sandwich that came out pretty hard. The chef, Jaime brought out a much better one. Service like that is hard to come by these days. Ask for Michael if you want exceptionally great service

We ate dinner around 6pm and the restaurant was not busy at all.  After ordering our food (which seemed overpriced compared to other locations) we waited for a while for our food to arrive which seemed too long considering there wasn't a lot of customers.  I ordered the bourbon chicken to share with my toddler. I asked for an extra plate but never got one.  The fries that came with it tasted old.  And the chicken breast was very small for the price and the only flavor ithad was the butter that was melting on top.  Our waiter never checked on us or refilled our drinks.  Pretty much this location sucked.

I wish I would have read Ashley A's comment about the HORRIBLE customer service bc I wouldn't have even bothered. If I could give negative stars, I would. Sounds like server, Michael, needs to be written up for his snarky attitude but I found he works for incompetent managers so doubt that will happen. This location clearly doesn't care about their negative reviews bc they are right outside of Knott's and people will still go to their restaurant. A formal complaint to corporate is coming though.... We had a large group. Have gone every year. It's tradition. Left the park at about 2:00pm to put in our 6:30 pm reservation like we've done every year. Was told "we take RSVP's 24 hrs in advance". Really? I was given the option to put my name in and wait outside the restaurant for 2 hours. Made absolutely NO SENSE! Told them it was a group of 17 to give them the courtesy of having time to set things up and it was like they immediately didn't even want to deal with us. Asked to speak to a manager. The nervous male host went and talked to a manager and she didn't even have the professionalism to come talk to us. She sent this poor kid back up to tell us. I asked for the managers name and the dark skinned female host laughed like it was a joke. Note to you sweetheart- good way to start a conflict that you clearly can't handle.  Keep your smirks to yourself. So to whatever manager was working "Miriam" or "Alaina" your managing skills are lacking and you really should look into more training or a different profession! Never again will we go to this restaurant. Good job!

I like this spot. When I come to Knott's, which is frequent given that I am a Season Pass holder, I prefer to eat here than anywhere else.  The food and cost has never appeared to me to be anything but appropriate --- the issue with this spot is a given: it services a major theme park so it's going to be packed.  Sometimes you end up waiting a bit to get seated and then you find yourself waiting a bit more for the food.  But I'm a patient individual, as I would hope most of you would be as well --- that being said, logistics would definitely help them improve their overall service. Well time to eat!
We ate here a couple days ago. The nachos was ok. The burger was expensive. The fries was way to hard. The margaritas were too small. And the parking sucked. Knotts. Yaw gotta do better.

Restaurants tagged to theme parks always have their problems,  but this one in particular has shown poor service.  The service is friendly but the wait times to order, get refill,  etc is pretty bad.  After waiting probably close to 15 minutes after being seated no one had come by.  So we flagged down the manager and then were able to order.  Then from there,  seeing our server again was far and few between.  Coupled with the service are the higher theme park prices... I guess it is what it is but it doesn't have to be!  We are going to try a new "Rock n' Roll" restaurant down the street across from the Pirate show place next time in search for faster accountable service.

Came here after having a good time at Knotts Berry Farm with a group of 7. It took us over 20 minutes to get a table even though it wasn't busy and few tables were empty. Our waiter was actually ok and gave good service. Now, why doesn't this TGIF have the specials that the other ones have? When I asked they said that it was owned by Knotts or something like that. When we ordered our food, it took forever! Over 45 minutes and we just ordered appetizers and burgers. The prices were too high also and the food quality wasn't even that good to say. When I decided to use the restroom I wish I didn't. It smelled really bad! And the floor was really dirty.  They certainly need to fix all these issues ASAP!

If you're around Knott's Berry farm and decide you want to eat here, grab the kids, turn around, and make your way back to Knott's. There are a lot more better food selections inside than eating here.  One, the food here is ridiculously overpriced. Some plates exceed $20 and to me, a plate like that should taste awesome. Here, it was ok.... just ok. Also, cooks don't know the difference between "well done" and "medium rare" It's almost like eating cereal without the milk!  Expect to be seated in a loud environment. The waiters and hostesses were polite and attentive but that's pretty much why this place got a 2 star rating.  And the one thing that made this place not get the full rating was that I found a hair (eyelash hair) in my drink. GROSS
This place is by far the worst TGI fridays I have ever been to. Dirty. Overpriced. Horrid service. Stay away!

So my husband, kids and i went here after spending the day at Knotts Berry Farm, BIG MISTAKE! We were sitted quickly, bt I expected that since there was another family there. Once we were sitted we were forgotten! After 15 mins my husband had to go get the waiter to even get our drinks, once we placed our drink and food orders our waiter was missing again! I had to get the hostess and her response was "he does this all the time" then why in the f**k is he there?? We get our food and it was cold! None of us ate all of our food and didn't even bother getting a box for it, it was that bad! Not coming back

Worst service ever!! I have a shellfish allergy, made sure I was clear. The waitress was super nice and made sure to tell every cook about it! Get my food and they put fries on it which I didn't order! The fries have shellfish in the seasoning. So they take my plate and correct it, my whole family was done eating by the time I get my food, plus not once did they ever come by and ask if we needed refills! We had to get up several times to find someone to help us. Never going back again!

If you're expecting TGIF, this ISN'T it!!!  This place is owned by Knotts, so their menu is a lot smaller and I think pricier.  An average price for steaks is $20-$26, no pasta dishes at this place, average cost of a burger around $16. The French onion soup was even bland. Definitely won't be back.  This rating is based on food alone, which was mediocre.  The service was okay.

Came here for knots scary farm and ordered two appetizers and and entree with drinks and we got all of our food first and never got our drinks!!! This place sucks for service and glad I don't live anywhere close to this horrible service restaurant and promised to never come back to this retarded restaurant that has no idea of good customer service

Have never experienced such bad service. We've been waited on by 3 different servers. Somewhere along the way one of them forgot to place my sons food order. If it wasn't for me mentioning it , he would of never gotten his food. It took them an hour to bring him an order of pasta. The server apologized but really it wasn't her fault. The manager came and dropped off the pasta and didn't even say a word to us. Never coming back!!!!

Well, decided to try this Friday's because it was close to us than the one at the block of Orange. First of all, there's a weird funky smell to the establishment. It smells like mold and mildew. Second of all, our potato skins were greasy and over fried. The Tall Coors I ordered was flat. I had a coupon for a free appetizer and my waitress didn't even honor it. I will never return to this place. The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the cook who grilled my steak made it excellent and the shrimp was the best crunchy shrimp I've ever had!
$9.00+ for a small glass of Bud Light? wtf! And $13 for a dried turkey burger and white lettuce on top. At least give me the green outer part!!!!

Terrible.  Better that eating inside Knotts? Maybe. We we went there because the kids were hungry.... They each ordered a burger (ordered medium well, which was beyond pink) and a sandwich. Those two entrees plus a $10 COORS LIGHT and a $13 BARELY DRINKABLE cab. A $60 bill for barely edible meal. Pathetic. We should have eaten inside the theme park....would have been a better experience.

Overpriced, tasteless food, terrible service, had to ask multiple times for generic items (napkins, cutlery, water). Waiters did not care one bit about service. The worst part is having to pay a gratuity for food and service that did not require a tip. There are plenty of other food joints that are worth the wait.

Service was not bad, but food.was bad. My daughter's mac n cheese came out and was still frozen , literally frozen in the center. We sent it back and it came back burning hot, to hot for my daughter to touch My sandwich was barely luke warm. All I gotta say is blah!

Service here was great. We were served within minutes after placing our order. What I didn't like was the lack of ice in our glasses of sink water. The fried shrimps were so unbearably salty that my date and I pushed the plate to the side after having a sample. The parmesan chicken was ok but the tortellini that came on the side was as cold as the ice that never came with our drinks. It had definitely been sitting there for a while. And what happened to the sizzling shrimp and chicken? I was really disappointed tonight when I found out that my favorite dish had been taken off of the menu. The small portions were also a big disappointment. Anybody who is looking to enjoy a dinner date with that special someone, DO NOT TAKE THEM HERE. They will probably get mixed signals and break up with you.

Long story short: they lost my debit card I don't completely blame blame my server. His name was Crispy (sp) and he was bartending, taking orders, serving, and handling checks. He was handling probably a dozen tables when we were there, the odds for mistakes go up in that situation. I assume something happened where my card was dropped or something. The check came, I gave him my card, I received two receipts with no card in the card holder. No one at my table saw a card, no one ever left the table, it was lost. Crispy insisted he gave it back but 3 pairs of sober eyes at my table disagreed. I gave him my information. I never received a call. I went back to the restaurant to speak to the manager who said it was never found but she would give me a credit for a future meal at Friday's. No thank you! I will not be coming at this location, or any Friday's again if I can help it.  Crispy is probably a great employee on any other day but  however, given the fact that the restaurant was so tremendously understaffed it resulted in waiting a very long time for our food and my waiter/bartender losing my card I cannot reccomend this location to anyone.  And just for the record, I work for knotts berry farm. Very disappointed that a restaurant a few yards from where I work lost my card.

They don't honor the deals you see on the commercials at this location . . Food was average . . Service mediocre  . .  Portions small. Defiantly don't feel we got what we paid for. Won't eat here again

I've never been a fan of Friday's, but after a long day at Knott's we didn't feel like driving anywhere so we took our chances. Worst decision ever. There was a crazy wait but they told us if we sat in the bar area we would get the same service as the regular restaurant area. Wrong. Pretty sure they forgot about us three times. It took forever before we were able to order our food (of tiny portions I might add) and then it took even longer to get our bill. We probably could have just dined and dashed honestly. It took THAT long. I cannot believe how horrible the service was for being affiliated with an amusement park. Other than the fact that people are tired and it's close, it wouldn't be able to stay in business!

Don't know why TGI Fridays is rated so low. Lets face it, its a TGI Fridays next to Knotts. You don't have very many options up there. And it least this place is consistent. And its cheaper and better food than getting a over cooked burger for $15 in the park.  The wait staff was friendly. The place was quiet and was a nice break from the park. The JD Chicken Sandwich was good and flavorful.

So I don't know why this place has such a low rating. I came in with my friend to grab a few drinks before we went to the theme park. The bar tender, Erik is one of the coolest/nicest/chilliest dude. I would def come here as a regular if I didn't live so damn far.

Why cant I give this place ZERO stars?    Warm, flat, stale beer.  Sticky counter tops.  My coke was about as clear as 7-up.   The burger tasted like it was sitting around the counter and re-heated.    The service was near non-existent.   i did see the two bartenders at the corner of the bar talking to two suit and tie managers for about 10-15 minutes, ignoring everybody that was at the bar staring at them, waiting for any kind of recognition of needing to order.      I can guess the only reason this place is still open is because of the TGIFridays, brand and a whole new group of suckers visiting Knotts everyday.

Horrible horrible horrible. ... we sat at the bar had a small party of 3 figured we would have drinks and appetizers before we hit Knotts ... worst fridays ever horrible service we got ignored . .. horrible drinks super light pours ..my drink was ALL sugar  just all around horrible

This is one of the worse in the chain! I am in my 60's and they carded me  when I wanted a drink! So I opened my wallet and showed my ID. That wasn't good enough, he wanted me to take it out of the picture window and hand it to him. I refused and said all the information he needed to see he could see through the window. It's hard for me to take it out and I told him unless he's a cop that should be good enough. So he went and got the manager and I showed it to her. Not good enough, she wanted me to take it out and hand it to her. At that point I had enough. She said because they are owned by Knott's they have to do that. That's bullsh*t cause we have gone to Mrs. Knott's for a chicken dinner and had drinks and wasn't carded. I have been at this one before and they never carded us so this is something new! In   a state where the drinking age is 21, as a person in her 60's I should not have to be subjected to this form of harassment. I am a member of their stripes program and this is the first time I have been carded at a TGIF!!! I do not recommend this place if you're over 60 and want to enjoy a glass of wine!!!

Once our stomach settled from the twists and turns of the ride, we decided to do lunch here.  The menu seemed limited and did not offer some of the specials as advertised on television.  I had a turkey burger and my friend had a black bean burger.  My turkey burger was dry and rather average as compared to any other turkey burger.  My friend enjoyed the rather average black bean burger.  We left feeling like we were overcharged and totally unimpressed.

My review is based on my experience. I came before going to Haunt so I was really just trying to experiment with drinks and get drunk quickly. I walk in and the host is really hot and friendly. I go sit at the bar top and wait about five minutes to get greeted. I ask the bartender (Geraldin) for the drink booklet. Another five minutes...I'll admit that her drinks were tasteful but her service was awful. She spent the entire time on her phone, neglecting her customers. I was trying to leave asap so I could go to Haunt and it took her 27 minutes until I started yelling out "excuse me? Excuse me!?" For her to finally get off get phone and acknowledge me. When I got the receipt, she rang me up wrong... She fixes it and I notice that the bottom of the receipt has a "suggested" 20% tip. Ha! Whatever. I still tip her because I have manners. As I walk out the hot host says bye and happy Halloween. She seems to be the only pleasant aspect of this place.

Spent New Years day at Knotts Berry Farm  Stopped into Fridays for a quick dinner , It was as expected Service was good the food was as expected , I was alittle disappointed they didnt have the 2 for $10 or 3 for $15  promotion , Im not sure if it was because the promotion is over or if they dont offer it at this location because its across from the amusement park .  I had the spicy beer burger and it was okay the spicy was a few jalapenos , and my girl had a salad .  It was a run of the mill chain restaurant meal . I would try some place else next time .

Well, this place certainly sucks. Actually, I already knew that from a previous visit. However, I found (yes, literally FOUND) a $25 gift card and since this place is around the corner from my home, I thought we would try again. Arrived at 5:30 on a Monday night, found very close parking, no wait, got a seat immediately. So far, so good. Screaming children at every table, it seemed... but that's not the restaurant's fault. I ordered a burger & fries. Fries had been sitting for a long time somewhere, as they were shriveled and served at room temperature. Burger was nothing special either.  My partner ordered some sort of salad with breaded chicken, but apparently they mean DREADED chicken... the chicken in the salad was hard, dry and really not edible. He picked around it and ate the greens in the salad.  Both meals were crap. I would NEVER let that type of thing leave my kitchen if this were my place. I can see no one here gives a damn about what they're serving. I would have pushed the issue and complained if I had not had that free gift card. The tip we left for  service was earned by our server by being nice, but food like that should be free to all, like the government cheese program, or the food you get while in prison. Whatever happened to pride in your product?

Wanted to order a beer at the bar, but they did not take my photo ID even with the valid temporary dmv slip (had a name change in process). Staff was friendly, and they had decent happy hour bar food - chicken nuggets were pretty juicy, potato skins were crispy but super greasy, and mozzarella sticks were average.
$$$ for basic regular meals are way more then normal. Service pretty much half ass also. I wouldn't come back again

What I can remember about this place the most isn't the food but the freaking prices!! If I knew that this particular chain was owned by Knott's, I wouldn't have eaten here with 4 of my nieces & nephews & boy was it expensive. OK, now that I have gotten that out of the way, I think they had excellent customer service. I like how the waiter got my niece a coloring template with the Peanuts gang theme. It was a nice clean restaurant & the food was as expected from any TGIF.

All the bad reviews are oh so true and I've just experienced them first hand. Horrible service, no greeting from the hostess standing right Infront of you, no welcome from your waiter, whoever the hell it might be cuz you'll probably never know. Happy Hour drink specials are not so happy at all. All the regular prices are cranked up just because this place is owned by Knotts, but I expected it.
Service is slow and the menu sucks bad..... Not a regular tgifs... This is owned by Knotts.. Look at the name tags.. They say Knotts... Crappy food and drinks are pricey..

ARE YOU KIDDING ME? $81 for two small dinners, and 4 beers!  There are too many great places you can go to for much less! Like The Ranch in Anaheim, or Walt's Wharf in Seal Beach! Anywhere but here, especially if you're local and know the area. I don't mind paying, but don't want to be abused as I'm giving my business to someone! After seeing the recent commercials on TV, my husband and I thought we'd head to TGIFriday's last night. I asked the server about the specials we'd seen and he informed us that this particular location doesn't honor or offer any of the specials. We decided to stay regardless. I asked about a couple of the rib eye plates they offered. Our server said he thought the sirloin items were better. We order and had a really good dinner, very flavorful. If anything the portions were a bit smaller than I'd expected, but that was fine, as it was really good. We paid $20 each for our plates (which is the advertised $10 special we went in for). My husband had two draft beers (Coors light) and I had two Miller lights. We were absolutely floored when we got our bill... $81 and change! They charged $21 and change for two coors on draft, and $13 and change for two bottles of Miller. AMAZING! $34 for 4 beers at TGIFriday's... are you kidding me? To say they over-charge is an understatement. As a local, with this place under 2 miles from me, it could be decent place to grab dinner. But no. I can't imagine charging the prices they do!  You might be saying we should have noticed the price of the beer. We honestly didn't look. Because WHO WOULD THINK they would charge the exorbitant prices they do? NOT ME!  Big. fat. FAIL!  I asked why the beer was so expensive and was told that Knott's franchises with TGIFriday and so Knott's sets the prices, and doesn't honor (or opts out of) the chain specials.  No wonder this place is empty! Needless to say we won't be back!

This place almost killed me, literally. My boyfriend and I were on our way to Medieval Times but wanted to get some drinks before so we went to the bar for happy hour. We ordered a martini and an electric lemonade and almost half way through my drink, I found a shard of glass. I told the bartender who made our drinks and he apologized and made me a new one. His exact words were, "I made this one extra strong since I almost killed you." Then we asked if he shook the martini with the same ice and he reluctantly said yes and asked if we wanted another but we ordered a beer instead. Worse part was that this bartender didn't start to clean out the well until after we mentioned the martini. A manager never came over to see us, she merely comped the martini and charged us for everything else. No one in the bar seemed to be surprised that there was an issue with our drinks nor did the manager seem fazed by the situation. I've never had any kind of problems with any other Friday's. I don't know if this is because Knott's owns this restaurant but this place sucks.
Could have been better. Burger was average, fries were soggy. The only really good eat were the soft pretzels. Service was ok not great, not terrible
Get ready to pay outrageous, can't believe they're still in business, almost walked out, high prices for average (sometimes below average) food.

TGI Fridays in Buena Park had the worst service I had ever had at any restaurant. The service was awful the minute we sat down. After waiting 15 minutes before getting a waiter, (which we only got because we asked), the waiter was terrible. Especially if you get OSCAR!!!!!! Oscar was lazy, unless, and extremely forgetful. My family and I ordered our food just to have everything come back cold, my burger was extremely burned, and tasteless. And my Diabetic father never received his food. We complained about his food about 7 times, but all Oscar didn't do anything and kept telling us to tell the busboy as if he wasn't the waiter. We were the first people in the restaurant and everyone else received their food first. Oscar was extremely forgetful, we asked him 3 times for extra fries. When he came back and asked if we needed anything, we replied with, "where are our fries?",  He said, " Oh....you ordered fries?" Can you believe that CRAP!!! To make things even worse my sister stabbed her mouth with one of their broken forks, she was bleeding! By then we had it, yelled at the manager! And refused to pay. By then my father's blood sugar was so low he almost passed out from not getting any food! We will never come back, and if TGI Fridays is lucky to get one star, if I could they would get 0 stars.

The food was so disgusting. It took 3 napkins to get the grease off my burger. The manager just said she would tell the kitchen. I'm also a light weight and appreciate that one long island at most TGIFs get me pretty tipsy. I had two and felt nothing. I can't believe this place bears the TGIF name. Do not eat here.
Our sever was great. However, it took 45 minutes to get our food. Our spinach appetizer came last as our dessert :( No Bueno.
Worst place ever, if your going to spend money on shitty food and service then this is the place to be. The fries were cold and obviously old, and the servers looked dead inside. Like my stomach.

I would prefer not to Leave a star but it's not an option...the wait to place our order was horrendous. This place is dead and we're stilll waiting. .half our food was brought out and 2 of our plates were forgotten. .how fo you not notice 2 patrons with no food..never coming back

Wow Lot's of people don't seem to like T.G.I.Friday's, but I do. After riding coaster rides and having to hear screaming kids. I think a getaway from Knotts is a great idea, better then spending $15 for a burger and fries insides Knotts when you can get your hand stamped go across the theme park and enjoy a nice meal, childless at least for us that afternoon. It was nice to be in some air-conditioned comfy seats and enjoy a pleasant meal. Unfortunately there isn't a TGIF near my home, but If I ever hit Knotts again this is 100% my choice for my meal of the day.
great place we came for late dinner last saturday and everything was delicious our server Justin was really heplful we will come back soon .

We went to tgi Fridays after being so hungry at knotts berry farm. I ordered the flat iron 8oz steak with broccoli and mashed potatoes. I liked the steak but the size was the same size as almost the 6 oz steak my friend ordered. The mashed potatoes were probably the best part.. Of the meal.. We also orders a half rack of ribs and the sauce was the best part. Overall, we came here out of all the restaurants in the park and outside of the park because they had a tv and we needed to watch the Seahawks game!!
No happy hour and no 2 for 20. Really?  Isn't that why we come to Fridays?  Overall it was just ok.  Definitely not my favorite location.

Horrible,horrible,horrible service.  They should have Zero stars on yelp---The only reason I go to Friday's is to eat Jack Daniel's rib eye steak, worst mistake ever to come to this location. First, they are way overpriced compared to any other Friday's restaurant, then they said they are out of rib eye steak, fine I asked for sirloin, I asked for onion rings and they don't have them either, ok i ordered veggies, now, my steak and my daughters came completely rare (we ordered med well) veggies were old and with no flavor, we asked for the steaks to be cooked a bit more and brought them back BURNED!!!! Geez!! Can they cook or do something right?  At that point i am just ready to pay and get out. The manager and servers were nice and apologetic but their standards of service and meal preparation are ridiculously on the lowest level.  Don't waste your time and money at this location, you will regret it.   Go eat tacos down the street or whatever else but don't come here.

I had never been to a TGI Friday's...and I don't think I will ever go back.  When I saw their commercials I thought that it would be a cheap place to eat with mediocre food. Instead it was a not-so-cheap place to eat with mediocre food.  I munched on my $11 burger which arrived a good 10 minutes after everyone else at the table received their burgers and it was decent. The bacon on my burger looked like it had been microwaved at McDonald's. For $11 I really need to get real bacon.  I will eat a $4 burger with ghetto bacon, but it's not cool when you are paying 3x as much.  I only came here because the food inside Knott's Berry Farm was crap and this was my attempt to eat something decent.  The wait staff was nice, but I don't see myself coming back here.

If I could write this review with zero stars I would,  but Yelp wont let you do it.   Anyway my wife and I went with our four kids after a long day at Knott's Berry Farm.   After 1 Hour, only the grilled cheese sandwich came out.  Thirty mins. later the cheese burger. Several mins later the spaghetti came which is their specialty as you will see.  So even after waiting forever for our food, the waitress never refilled our drinks.  Where was the ranch dressing for our now cold fries?  Well it arrived after my kids finished their fries, needless to say.   OK so back to the spaghetti. So I began cutting the noodles so my daughter could manage the spaghetti...As I lifted some spaghetti from her bowl, my other daughter screams" Oh my God their is blonde hair in your spaghetti!"  Fortunately, the other customers heard it and responded with similar disgust.  Yes! nasty as can be! a long, thin blonde hair stretched out about six inches from the fork to the bowl.  Clinging to the hair and making it visible to see in the poor lighting were tomato sauce and little bits of spaghetti. Keep in mind everyone at our table has dark brown to black thick hair so TGI could not say it was ours. So of course no waitress ...so I approached the hostess and told her that I needed to the manager regarding the blonde hair in my daughters spaghetti. So,  she said she would get the manager, and walked away.  20 mins later she walked up to me asked if the manager spoke to me.  Needless to say the answer was NO.   She  disappeared ...again. 20 Mins later  the manager showed up .  This is also when the ranch dressing showed up for the fries that were delivered 40 ins. ago..  We told her about her cooks blonde hair in the angel hair spaghetti.  She apologized and stated she would replace the spaghetti...yes another 20 mins. to arrive. My wife's salad with chicken breast (presented in the menu as two chicken breasts) showed up, but  looked like a naked chicken nugget butterflied to like two mini chicken breasts Worst dining experience ever! I'm surprised  the food wasn't served in  dirty ashtrays.
Wow!  Let's just say that 1 star is being extremely generous.  All the problems from the previous reviewers below are valid.  NOBODY IS EXAGGERATING.  IT IS THAT BAD.

Dirty, gross and dry! Sticky and filthy tables. It was a slow Wednesday night (service and crowd.) I should've read other Yelp reviews because I agree with the over priced dry chicken. It was barely warm and not worth the wait or price.

The family and I came here after a day of standing in the scorching hot sun while waiting in long lines at Knott's Berry Farm.  As we exited the park we came across the entrance to TGI Friday's, and decided that this is where we wanted to eat.  Our dinner at Friday's turned out to be a great way to finish off a fun day with the family. Service was on point.  The staff were friendly and accommodating, but also gave us our space.  The food was the same as every other Friday's, but the side portions seemed to be much bigger.   I have always liked the taste of the food at Friday's, and I swear that their Jack Daniel's sauce can make anything taste good.  My biggest two complaints about Friday's has always been that the services usually sucks and the portions are always small.  Both of these issues were not an issue at this Friday's.  I have to say that this was the BEST Friday's experience I have ever had!  Almost every other Friday's experience that I have had has sucked.  This time it was much different.  I had a great time and I was happy that we ate here. I would not mind eating at this Friday's again the next time I visit Knott's.  In fact, I look forward to it!

Oh yea, definitely a tradition for us!! We've been coming here for years. The food has always been great; the wait staff and host/hostess always friendly and helpful. Although not fine-dining, the food is great and price's reasonable. A family atosphere but not extremely noisy like other places. Being from out of town, we visit the area at least twice a year. We make it a point to arrive early the day before just to dine here and spend the day shopping at Knott's Berry Farm gift shops.  The atmosphere is so enjoyable, we leave looking forward the the next time we can visit the restaurant.

Decided to try Fridays as an alternative to the restaurants at Knott.  Big mistake.  The restaurant is filthy, service extremely slow, ridiculous prices, and the food is mediocre.  This is not a typical Fridays.
Bad service. Cold food. Closes too early.  Parking sucks.

Our Food Was Good And Our Waiter Was Very Attentive! But Our Food Did Take A Long Time Come Out! Get Ready To Pay Higher Prices Than Other TGI Fridays. But It's Better Than Paying The Same Amount At The Park And Not Be In Air Condition And Able To Just Relax. Would Go Again! :)

I don't know why this place get such low reviews! I've been here plenty of times and the food is amazingg! The bartender always takes care of me well and the servers are faabulous! I give this place five stars !

We are never going back to this TGFI again! The service was fine but the food was awful. I ordered the Parmesan Crusted Chicken and I'm pretty sure they forgot to put it into the oven before serving it to me. I took a couple of bites before realizing the texture of the chicken was off and when I cut it open, it still looked raw. It did not look anything like the photo in the menu and was white and crumbly instead of brown and crusty. The restaurant wasn't even busy for them to forget to heat my chicken and yet it took a long time to get our food. I ended up having a bowl of cheddar broccoli soup that was too salty and had just my chicken comped. My husband ordered a way overpriced club sandwich that didn't look appealing. And my kids had the kids Mac n cheese and then both had stomach issues the next day. My husband finished their Mac n cheese and he also spent some time in the bathroom that night. I'm still waiting to see if I get sick from my undercooked chicken but I felt compelled to write this review because of my poor children and all the others who may eat there after a fun day at Knott's.
Cannot recommend this location. Bleh. Food was absolutely horrible! Tasted as if it was taken from the freezers at Target and reheated by a heat lamp.

This is located in knott's berry farm-so -it's a tourists/park goers hangout/dinner place..so it's always full & as expected the wait times are more compared to other TGIFs, refills after long time, food portions very less.

I would give it no stars if possible. This is the second time I come here and both times they screwed up my order. The first time I came in it was a damn ghost town in there and I still waited 45 min. For a spinach dip. I talked to the manger and got a free appetizer. So I came back for that reason. Now this second time they were swamped and my food was served faster, but now they brought me the wrong food! And when I told the manager he tried to make it seem like I screwed up in ordering the wrong thing and he's doing me a favor. Don't come here! Try another location if possible.

Decided to go to TGI Fiday's since it was across Knots, we went inside and the host said it was going to be about 45 min wait, but if we found a place at a bar we can take a sit there. We decided to see if there was a open table.  The busser was cleaning of a table, and he was the slowest busser I have ever saw. All the bussers that I have seen pirior work their ass off and to get the table clean as quick has possible, but not this guy, he just took his sweet time while we were waiting for him to clean the table. After he was done cleaning the table I have said thank you because I do appreciate the bussers cleaning the table and he just totally ignored me. So after we sat down a few minutes went by and no one came and asked if we needed menus or drinks, servers/bartenders would pass our table by and act like we were invisible. We then saw the busser who have cleaned the table throw a rolled up paper and miss the table and went to the floor, he seemed that he was not happy at his job and had a bad attitude. After waiting 15-20 mins with no help I have asked a waitress, I believe her name was Jasmine, that we were waiting here for 15-20 min with no service and would like some help please, she replied that she would get a bartender/sever but no one showed. Got tired of waiting so we left and went to IHOP instead. Never have i ever experienced such HORRIBLE service from TGI. I will never come to this location again. Waste of our time...

This place had a few people yet had very bad service. The servers were all on break and they were juggling servers around to help us until the correct server came.
