We waited for at least 10 minutes for condiments and we were at the table at least 20 minutes till we received forks. The food was ok for it being overpriced. Not too much effort put into preparing the food. Pretty disappointed....

I see why the reviews weren't great. After a few hours in the park we thought this would be a convenient place to grab dinner on the way home. Really disappointed in the quality of the food. The potato skins had a bizarre quality where we weren't sure if the were frost bitten or over cooked. The bacon my hubby had was rubber. Wings were dry and just bad. Drinks were decent. Will not be returning.

Went in today with my kids and I read the reviews, but wanted to see for myself. Yes the food is over priced in my opinion but having a season pass it helps a bit... Food wise it's pretty good, I was satisfied with the pasta and my kids with there fingers and mac an chez. Now... I was a sever back in my days and know when I have a good server. My server was Oscar and I wanted a limaide with a shot of vodka and told him that it requires fresh lime juice not the syrup kind. . . He brought me the drink I tasted it and it was on the spot! Usually when I order my drink it either has the syrup lime juice and i send it back or the sever/waiter simply tells me we can't make it. I was very satisfied with him trying going above to make the drink.  I will definitely come again and ask for you bud. thanks.

This place does not participate in the other deals that other tgif do so its way more expensive. Also we made reservations for 8pm a week and advance, showed up at 8 and had to wait an hour for a table.

JAN 9, 2012 First, they did not have a 2 for $10 menu as advertised on TV (perhaps because they're owned by Knott's Berry Farm - so they're not always updated with all the other TGIF's), and food arrived after 20 mins when server said it would take only 10 on a Monday night thats not busy at all. We even placed the order right away when server was barely asking for our drinks, because we knew what we wanted. He hasnt checked back with us even when theres just one other party sitting in our section. I used to work here years ago, and I notice that the service is never really up to par with other TGIF's (lots of inexperienced kids who don't give a crap about their customers working here) - very disappointing. Good thing I love the Jack Daniels Menu, which is reason enough for 2 stars.

Folks don't be fooled no endless appetizers here. They renigged on offer said they are part of Knotts not the franchise,  damit they carry the name. I guess what they are saying is we are fake, just want your money. Last fridays I go too.

TGIFridays used to be veggie friendly, offering gardenburgers and other non-meat salads and things. No longer. I even asked the waiter if they had any vegetarian things on the menu, or veggie substitutions. He said no, TGIFridays doesn't have anything vegetarian. Nothing.  I won't be coming back.

I just left the restaurant business after 16 years.  Couldn't take it any more. Such a level of entitlement from customers nowadays its disgusting.  It was becoming harder and harder for me to maintain a smile, as well as serve the guest's needs.  Just want to say thank you to this entire staff as my family and I dined there this week.  Everyone was so friendly.  From our server, to the host, as well as the food runner and manager.  Food was great as well.   The positive attitude really stood out for me as I know first hand how difficult it is to deal with the public, esoecially with the clientele I'm sure they get around here.  Thank you again.

My worst TGIF experience ever! Waiter did not know the menu, we received our silverware after our meal. I ordered the JD flat iron and received a different steak, after returning it my steak was over cooked! The people next to us did not get what they ordered, I mean the list goes on!    Save your money! And eat on the park. I will not be returning!

The next rant, or review, will cover first the experience of past three years, and then last night (4th experience). FYI, we always got to TGI around 5-530pm.  What better way to go into scary mazes and face horrifying creatures, clowns of doom and stuff creating nightmares than being a little.. Giggly? heehee. As long as one pregames/parties responsibly and safely, everyone involved will have a good time.  For the last three years, something always went wrong at Fridays.. Food and/or alcohol related. We ordered beer.. THAT had more alcohol content than a Long Island! Im afraid to order a shot of hard liquor in the case its watered down!! That's pretty concerning. If one is ordering food with large fat/calorie content, there should be enough alcohol in the ordered drink. Also FYI this location doesn't offer or accept coupons/specials/etc that are affiliated with TGI Fridays, because it's owned and franchised by the theme park. Also, drink costs are more expensive during Scary Farm season. Beer is a tad cheaper.  My friends and I have been going consistently to Knotts Scary farm for the last three years. We always went to TGI's prior to entering the park because of the alcoholic stuff they provided.. No risking driving intoxicated and getting a DUI or OMG a crash or death prior to a theme park!  Yesterday was our fourth. Will write a review about Knotts right after this..  Our first year, the place was packed so we got seated at a table in the bar. The girls and I ordered margaritas, which they provided to us with shaker cups, which we thought was pretty cool. Until my bestie's shaker pretty much sprayed all of us with sweet alcohol and we smelled drunk before we started drinking.. But we were able to get a replacement. Second year, again we were seated in the bar. Drinks had almost no alcohol content, and the waiter hardly checked on us. We had to wait 20min after being seated to order food! On top of that, my friend's "medium rare" steak was cooked super super rare -- toasted on the sides, blood literally oozing out when sliced. We sent it back, came back the same. Did the cooks even see the plate? Was it bothered to be even taken back to the kitchen? That we will never know. Last and third year, we were seated in the dining area, in a booth. Table was still filthy with ketchup/aioli stains, cup water marks and dropped fries from the prior customers. Isn't it procedure to wipe down the table before seating people?? With our prior experience with the steak, we decided to keep it safe and order pasta, salad, and a burger. At this time, I ordered a lettuce wrapped burger... How can a burger go wrong, right? Well.. They gave me a different TYPE of burger from what I ordered. And the toppings were not fresh. Meaning the lettuce hidden under the top layers were starting to wilt and the tomatoes had white and green patches. Sent back, and received a .. Better looking, and correct, burger. My friend's salad also had the same "freshness" problem. The portions smothered in the salad dressing were visibly wilted. What's going on in the kitchen?? Did delivery of fresh produce skip a day or something??  Finally, last night's review. Sorry for the long rant but reviewing back the last three visits can be pretty long.  The wait was not long at all. 20-25minutes or so for a party of six, compared to nearly an hour wait for the last three years. We were seated and almost immediately a server came (she was covering for our 'real' server's break) and took our drink orders, which came 10min later. Drinks came in, not in the cool looking shaker glasses, rocks glasses or even margarita glasses we were used to, but in clear green plastic "SOLO" type cups. Cutting down on costs much?? Three of the five drinks we ordered had none or very minimal alcoholic content, which we had to flag down a manager and had alcohol added.   Food was.. Acceptable. Came About 15-20min after we placed order. I ordered a burger, but with the meat patty on the side... Which did not happen haha. (Sent back). My friend's pasta dish was cold to the touch, and when the pasta was tasted, it had a slight rubbery texture that comes with stale cold pasta. It was obvious it may have been sitting out for more than 10min. Isn't it supposed to be fresh? Sent back.. And then returned in 3 min. Server said it was heated back up. Since when does a restaurant kitchen have a microwave to heat "fresh" meals???  Everyone else seemed to either accept or truly enjoy their meals...  I don't know if this will happen again next year. Only time will tell.

Not a good TGI Fridays. The menu is different from ones in the San Diego area, very different I would say and worse too. Prices seemed the same if not less, but the portions were very small for the price. I went here with a group of 5 other people after going to Knotts. The restaurant was not crowded at all. We had who we thought was our waiter come by and ask us if we were ready to order our food; at that time we were only ready to ask for waters. I asked that waiter about drink prices when he came back and how much a Moscow Mule would cost (a drink not on the menu). I asked how much it would cost with New Amsterdam and then how much it would be if I wanted Grey Goose instead. He wasn't sure and said he would ask (He wasn't even sure if they had New Amsterdam but I could see it when we walked in). At this point he asked me for my ID which was fine. A second waiter greeted us and said, "I'm your real server" which I thought was odd. I mentioned to him that I asked about drink prices and he brought over a 3rd waiter. This waiter said it would be $9 for a Moscow Mule, no matter what vodka I chose to go in it. That means it would have been $9 for a New Amsterdam Moscow Mule and the same price for a Grey Goose Moscow Mule which is ridiculous. I just decided to order it with Grey Goose of course. In addition, the 3rd waiter asked for my ID again even though I already showed it to the first waiter. During our stay, none of the 3 waiters bothered to check up on us when we needed water, more food, and another drink. None of us got a fair amount of food for the prices we paid. The only way I would recommend this place is if you absolutely don't want to eat at Knotts. Service is bad and unorganized.

I have been to this TFI Friday's several times while visiting Knotts.  Today I got a Black Bean Burger, which was ok, but apparently very calorie laden (1023 calories).  My daughter got the kid's pasta dish.  For those 2 items, our tab was over $26 including tip.  Yikes!  The service was mediocre and slow.

Worst Birthday dinner EVER!!! We visited the evening of February 15th. We didn't have to wait too long for our table. Once seated we waited about 10 minutes before someone came and took our drink order. We ordered our drinks and an appetizer. There were 3 of us, myself, my husband and my 5yo son. Our drinks were delivered first then came our appetizer. Our waitress, Samantha delivered only 1 plate. Perhaps she thought only one of us needed to eat. At the time our appetizer was delivered we ordered our meals. I ordered the 3 for $20 which are like appetizers and they're meant to share. The waitress asked if I wanted that as my entrée and I told her I did. So I'm thinking she knows that I wanted my food to come with my family's food.. I mean anyone in their right mind would think the same, right? Well apparently not Samantha but I will get into that in a sec. As Samantha is leaving our table, the table next to us stops her and asks if they can order as they are trying to get back to Knotts Berry Farm. We were seated about 10-15 minutes before this family of 3 adults and 2 children.  Twenty minutes passes and here comes Samantha with my dinner. I'm the only one that gets their food. We wait and wait, after all, we would like to eat together! The family of 5 next to us gets their food about 5minutes after my food arrives. Where is our food you ask? Yeah, we were wondering the same dang thing. I think Miss Samantha was smitten with the sweet talking (and good looking) gentleman that expressed his desire to get back to Knotts Berry Farm before they closed. I think their order was placed ahead of ours. The rest of our food arrives about 15min later and what do ya know, my food is cold! I had the waitress take my food away. While the manager took the price of my food off the bill it doesn't make up for such an horrible experience. Next time we stay at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel we will not be visiting TGI Friday's!

I went to this Friday's for lunch today after my day at Knotts and it was awful!  My sister wanted grilled cheese (which they didn't serve) so we got creative and ordered a cheeseburger with no cheese.  Instead of making the meal cheaper for not having any meat that made it 50 cents more expensive!  The food also took very long and our waiter never checked on us.  This was an awful experience and would never recommend this restaurant.

A friend and I came in before venturing over to Knott's for the day. At noon, this place wasn't crowded at all. We were sat right away and out drink order was taken not far after. She had the Pink Punk Rocker, or whatever it's called, and I had the Hendrick's Cooler. Our server convinced me that the drink was good and I ordered it. Considering she was an avid gin hater, as am I, I took her word for it and was rewarded with a delicious and refreshing drink. I will absolutely be ordering this again. My friend wasn't a huge fan of her drink. It was crazy sweet and not as strong as she likes. We split potstickers as an appetizer, like we always do, and they were really good as usual. We both ordered burgers for lunch. I, the New York Cheddar and Bacon burger, and she, the All American Stacked. Both burgers were very good. Considering we would have paid the same in the park for a burger a la carte and half the size, I'll call this a win.

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! Our Server left home, so Kayla introduced herself to let us know she'll be taking care of us. We ordered the exact same sandwich and when it arrived to us our meal was cold and our fries were stale. She took care of it ASAP. But when our new sandwiches came out, the lettuce was missing on both, and my boyfriend had more onion strings on his burger than mine. She later noticed that we both barely ate our plates. We explained to her that it wasn't that great. She gave a very insincere apology. We left no tip and had stomach aches. If our order is wrong, it's okay, just fix it. I understand mistakes happen. But for the "fix it" meal to be worse, pfft, forget it!

Food took forever even though they were not busy, chips tasted like they were 2 weeks old sent them back. BBQ chicken flat bread finally arrived it was cold chicken...also sent that back. Wouldn't come here if the food was free.

Not sure why this place is receiving such a bad rep. Clearly the parking is the only issue, but you can park for free at the Knott's parking.  Now that we have the con's out of the way, let me say tell you about the positive things about this joint.  You have a nice clean and friendly restaurant that services up some good food. The menu does seem to change on a regular basis and does keep it "fresh". Nice alcoholic drink section and the waiters seem knowledgeable on what really does taste delightful and doesn't.  I have read that some of the waiters take forever bringing the food or asking if everything is fine, but you have to consider that this place does have a lot of business. Being bugged every five minutes irritates me, but seem people like the attention, so I guess they have to make a big fuss about it.  My conclusion about this place is that you should come here if you are not in a hurry and are in the mood for a zingy environment. The bar area does seem to have quicker service than the restaurant area. Also make sure to ask the waiter questions and don't be shy to bring up any details about his/her service.

If there were stars below 1 I would check them.  You would think I would learn from my mistakes from the Corona Dos LGos TGI that have me food poisoning but really.  I am 48 and my husband took me to knotts for their Christmas crafts.   We figured we'd get a bite to eat so my husband dropped me to TGI Buena parks door.  The moment you walk in there is an over powering smell of onions and grease.  So rather than cause a fuss I asked to be seated outdoors.   I was led to a table so filthy dirty that I can't believe they told me was actually wiped down.  I then proceeded to ask for a cocktail and figured I'd surprise my husband with one waiting for him while he parked the car.  Not only was I denied I was accused of ordering a drink for a minor. When I showed my license and asked if I looked like I was married to a minor or would give the appearance to do such a thing.  End result apparently I do.  I asked to see the specific laws which restricted the ordering of drinks and was told by the manager he could not be bothered to do so.   Pre judging a persons character then accusing them of illegal activity  is called defamation of character and is against the law Manager Kirk.  How dare you and how dare this company for such unprofessional unethical and profound ignorance of the law.   This has nothing to do with the drinks, this establishment should be shut down not only for the unsanitary environment but for the disrespect they show towards their customers.     Friends don't let friends go to TGI Fridays.  Your better off walking away.

I come here before I go into Halloween a haunt each year. This review is based on my experience tonight. We had dinner in the bar and Ian was our server. He was awesome! Honestly he deserves a huge shout out because I couldn't image dealing with that clientele. Food was good black bean burger was tasty and cooked just right. Drinks were poured just right and pretty cheap! The table was a little sticky and the bathroom was kind of yucky but overall I will come back of I'm going to the park.

location: East Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Just went there this past Friday (7/8 and ) the only great part was being greeted by the host in the front. Our waitress took forever to come to our table once we got seated, the menu's were dirty and looked old, they don't offer the "lunch special" because according to our waitress, this location is considered different from the other TGIF's (BS they just want more money because they're on Knotts turf), I asked a question about a dish and had to go to the back and ask the chefs because she obviously didn't know, and we rarely saw our waitress for refills. That experience ruined my whole outlook on ALL the TGIF's....never again!!

We came here a little worried because it only had a 2 star rating, but... We got greeted right away, seated right away and Justin our server was quick and efficient. He was polite and asked for our drink menus then went ahead and asked if we were ready to order which was nice because we were. We had drinks and appetizers and they both were pretty good. I can tell they get busy here so our service compared with how busy they were was pretty freakin great. Thanks Justin! For a great experience with T.G.I Friday's!

First off the location is really small and cozy. Now, We arrived around 8:30pm to this location we went in and were seated right away. Usually when I go to a restaurant by the first 5 minutes we have been greeted by our server and given drinks. It's was 8:45 and we still hadn't been helped or acknowledged. A few minutes later this girl comes up and mumbles I'll be with you in a minute. This girl passed by us literally 10 times and couldn't stop to at least to take our drinks. I was so irritated! Not only that the prices are ridiculous!! A freaken burger is $20! Hell no! After waiting long enough we decided to leave and went to El Torito ten minutes away. I'm not kidding in the first five minutes the server had presented herself and brought us our drinks. Ohh and the prices are much more reasonable.

DO NOT come here. Horrible service. Food was less than mediocre and overpriced. Waited over an hour for horrible food. I had to ask the bartender for my food and drinks. Our waiter visited us twice, to take our order and bring us the check. The food had no taste to it and it was cold to room temperature. You're better off going to Mc Donald's across the street. The location was poorly kept as well. Waste of time and money. 0 stars if possible.
Oh dear waste of time. Waited 40 minutes for our food.  My chicken sandwich came out cold, bun hard as a rock and cold fries. Forget it.

Management gets 5 stars. Wait staff-3. Food - A BIG FAT 0. We ordered the 3 for 20 appetizers: meatballs, mac n' cheese balls and the sliders. The food came out pretty fast but no flatware. We asked for JD sauce and flatware and we were told it would be right out. 10 minutes and nothing. We got our waiters attention and asked again and waited anoth we 5. Went to grab the sliders and one of the buns had mold on it. Totally disgusted.  Management took them off the bill and credited us another appetizer. Even though the manager did an awesome job handling the situation,  I wouldn't be able to step foot in there again knowing they served moldy bread.

Waited 30 minutes after being told it was a 5-10 minute wait. Took 20 minutes to get two drinks. My steak came out before my drinks. The steamed broccoli was cold. I would not recommend coming here ...  The fastest thing dropped off was the check ...

Went in and was seated promptly. As I sat, I noticed the decor on the was was filthy. I was a little grossed out. The server came and took our order, after that I went to wash my hands. As I walked to the restroom I noticed every surface was dirty and full of either fingerprints, dirt or food. Inside the womens restroom, toilet paper on the floor, sink counter full of water and tile/grout was dirty and had hair stuck to the wall by the sink. I've never been in an food establishment with such grime everywhere, if the front of the restaurant was this filthy, one can only imagine what the kitchen was like. When I returned to my table, I told my husband what I noticed. He too looked around from hus seat and pointed out more filth. We decided to cancel our order and left. Our server was nice and did not cgarge us fir the drinks. I did tell 2 managers we were leaving because the restaurant was dirty. One said it was because they had a rush of people. The other apologized. The filth definitely  was not from the day but over time, just disgusting. I didn't eat there and never plan to.

Came here after a trip to Knotts Berry Farm. I don't know if we got lucky but there was barely a wait on Valentine's night.  Our customer service was great! Our server took our order and drinks right away. When she went to break, she made sure to introduce us to the breaker. The breaker made sure we were good. Brought out our food right away. Two managers made sure everything was good as well and took our dirty plates away.  Food was good. We don't normally do franchise restaurants but we were starving. I'm glad we came in and hope to come back soon.

We waited for close to 10 minutes and still had no service. We also had a sleeping baby and we asked for a quiet area links, but they sat us next to a birthday party! I will never come back here for horrible food.

On vacation with my other half visiting friends . Really disappointed in the service and the staff. The lackadaisicalness was atrocious. We weren't acknowledged when we sat down. 6 count them 6 servers passed up before I finally spoke up and said something.  We put in our drink order and my drink had the labels from the lemons in it. At this point I am severely disappointed in this establishment and the service. I ordered a rib eye medium rare with shrimp.  Shrimp was over cooked and I received a well done skirt steak. Obviously this establishment need leadership in the kitchen and in the front of the house. Too many mistakes made for me and my wife to have an enjoyable time.  I will not be eating at this establishment ever again. Very poor performance and food quality.

Horrible service!!! We got seated and no one came back.  Almost all the staff passed us several times not one person said anything. We sat there for about 20 or 25 min and nothing so we left! They didnt even know we left!
Horrible service. The food is okay but it probably would taste better if it wasn't sitting in the kitchen for 20 minutes. The only good thing probably is the strawberry passion iced tea.

Honestly this was the worst service ever. Non verbal employees. No eye contact, basically ignoring. I'd smile and they'd look away & keep talking to each other....There were eight people working in the bar and three, counting me- customers.  The beer I ordered was awful, I thought  something was wrong with the tap- I had my friend taste to make sure it wasn't the bad experience clouding my judgement. She agreed it was terrible.  I gave the waitress my card to cash out told her I just wanted one beer and I was leaving - she came back, brought me my card "said my pleasure" ... I got up to leave then she told me I didn't pay...I was so confused. I will never go here again or ever recommend this place to anyone.  (They said nothing when I advised them about how I believed the beer had possibly gone rancid...& paid $11.45 for the beer I didn't finish)

Not your typical TGI Fridays. Owned by Knotts Berry Farm, they stay true to amusement park pricing standards. A tall Cooers light costs $11.60! The food was also slightly more expensive than a regular Fridays. Our beer tasted like soap, so we switched them out for Blue Moon, which also tasted like soap. The bar staff is friendly, but unexperienced. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger, which was very good, but the fries were undercooked and underseasoned.  Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. It's not worth the inflated prices.

Even though this place had a 2 star rating, my family and I were starving after a night at Knotts and decided to end the night here. We walked in with a warm greeting and were seated right away (probably because the place was empty). We sat for 15 minutes without 1 person even coming to say "Hello." Needless to say, we left. The waiter for our section even saw us get up to leave and literally looked the other way.  The manager was apologetic as we walked out but by that time In-N-Out was calling our name!

check your bank statement after you visit, should you dare....our server added a $20 tip to our bill after her horrible service!!!! Waiting half an hour for your food is UNACCEPTABLE. And Jennifer was a little indignant too, blaming the kitchen being backed up. Well, it would have been nice to know that earlier. Now it's been nearly an hour... Crappy service, and their manager needs to better monitor their inventory levels-they were out of many items,.including several types of beer!

It's been a very long time since I stepped foot inside a Friday's, and today as I write this review sitting on the toilet in pain from stomach cramps I am painfully reminded as to why that is...  All joking aside,Friday's has to have the worst tasting food out of all the chain restaurants out there. There's no sense in me writing a long review about how the burgers are horrible and how everything in this location is OVER PRICED! (Seriously $31 for bbq ribs and shrimp that at chillis would be half the price) just save your money, or better yet, if you even think about going to Friday's just grab about $120 and throw it out the car window as you burn out of the parking lot, at least you will leave more satisfied than eating that God awful food. As for me? Yeah I'm a sucker for eating here, but if I convinced one of you to go elsewhere my job here is done. Time to flush. Good day.

We don't normally go to chain restaurants and if you've eaten at one TGI Fridays you've been here.  We decided to eat here because we were staying at Knott's Berry Farm Hotel and had to walk past here anyway ( no car). We did end up here two times on our vacation because I was pretty sure I left my hat here the first night and I was looking for it.  Food: The food is pretty good, again if you've eaten at any location it is about the same as any other location. Staff: The hostess that walks with a cane is super nice and our server the first visit was fairly nice but slow. The server on the second visit was just slow. The bar: How long does it take to pour a beer or mix a drink? I'm pretty sure that drinks should be out within 3 minutes. The perfect time is when the server comes back to take our dinner order. Not at TGI Friday's. On both of our visits the drinks came when our food had been delivered and halfway consumed. Here is a tip Friday's, if you want to make more money get the drinks out faster. I would never, ever order a second drink at that speed. In fact I hate having to rush my drink because my dinner is almost over and I am ready to head back to the hotel so I can go swimming.  Next time I will use Uber and find a better place to eat a few blocks away.

Omg this tgi Fridays is awesome. My son loves coming to tgi Fridays bc they have a kids ribs. Well this one doesn't and with his allergies he is limited to what he can have and he started having a meltdown bc he didn't understand ( he has autism ) they worked with us and made him a happy child. Thanks for making him feel better. John was great and so is our server Stephanie  We will be back

This is the worst Friday's I have been to as far as the food goes! It looks great inside and out. It was clean enough, and our service was great but the food was horrible! I have been to Friday's all around in many State's and this is by far the worst! I even felt nauseous for 2 days with no appetite! We stopped in mid day after Knott's Berry Farm so we can fuel up for later for the Knott's Scary Farm! We had to head back to our travel trailer to check on our dog so we wanted fast service. We knew what we wanted. Service was slow. We were probably 1 of 3 people in there on a Thursday. My order tasted like it was yesterday's reheated with extra jack sauce to cover it up! It was almost too hard to even eat! My side salad was not only over priced but the dressing was gross, so that just sat as well! The only thing some what edible was my sweet potato fries and they were soggy! Some one needs to fire the cook here!
The food is average at best. The service was VERY slow and they were NOT busy. One of our dishes was cold when it came out. I would recommend finding another place to eat in this area.
the manager was nice but our order was all messed up. We told the waiter no garlic butter on my moms steak and it came with it and we ordered fish and they gave us chicken instead.

Ordered a beer from the bar before being seated. Bar service was subpar, and bartender was slightly rude. Ordered a craft beer on draft, one that I'm very familiar with, watched them pour the beer from said tap handle and hand me the beer, but did not receive the beer I ordered. They're serving the wrong beer from the tap. I also have a feeling that they're aware of this.  After being seated, our drink orders were taken after 20 minutes. 15 minutes later a different waiter comes by to retake our drink orders. It took nearly 45 minutes just to get our drinks and to order our food. You're better off paying 4x as much inside Knotts.

My family and I  came here because is across knotts berry farm! For "happy hour" I guess it was not a good day for our waitress, the bar was not busy at all waited for more than 8 min for her to show up at the table and without greeting the customer she ask for the order , then our order went to another table and they gave us the wrong check! It was not a nice experience.  It was unfriendly and a very  bad service

This place is awful.I will start with my drink. When you put on your menu "muddled" I expect the things you said would be in the drink muddled not syrup n sprite and not even a lime wedge! Next was the cold food. I ordered hot Sandwhiches and they came to me cold. The place was practically empty. Why? Lastly the service. Which she then brought out our food which was cold
Food alternative outside of Knott's Berry Farm. Typical Fridays, although it is a bit small and very busy because of the amusement park crowd.
Yuck, yuck and yuck!!! Never ever again will I step foot at this Friday's!! Food is absolutely horrid as well as the service! ***WARNING*** this is not a Friday's!

Worst service I've ever had in a restaurant.  Literally had our food hit the table and watched it die because we had no silver.  Asked 3 different people...waited 7 minutes.  And just stared at our food getting cold.  Not even a 'sorry' from anyone.  Pathetic.

Liked the convenience of it being across from Knott's. However I didn't know it was a special menu one. I was really looking forward to some of my favorite dishes. So that kind of bummed me out, but good service and the food came out quick. Nice to sit in air conditioning instead of the outdoor areas at Knott's. Also pretty cool that my Fridays Rewards worked because I had a 20% coupon, was great since the prices are a little higher than other Friday's restaurants. I ordered a garlic chicken and cheese skillet with mashed potatoes that was pretty good, but the Buffalo wings we ordered were hard and not appetizing. My niece and nephews had kids meals and they liked them and eat everything in their plate. I don't think I'd come back unfortunately because I would rather wait to go to a full menu Friday's.
The food is overpriced and not good.  The menu is about 25% more because Knotts is across the street.  The fries were cold and soggy.  Enough said.

I gave this location 2 stars because they are pricey compared to the average TGIFs plus they are owned by Knotts so they don't have the same promotions as other TGIFs. My bf got 2 tall IPA beers and it came up to $38! We've never paid that much for 2 beers. It's crazy.

This place is a great little escape post park visit or for a mid-day lunch. It is a typical TGI, but perhaps the line is a bit longer than normal. No worries - just send someone ahead to put in your name. Food and service is great and typical of TGI.

Thought it would be an ingenious idea to circumvent the obviously overpriced and low quality trap of amusement park venues by stepping out to TGI Fridays, a relatively well known established chain.  Foiled!   Food = SUCKS BAD.  SUPER dry burger, much worse than the usual TGIF. Service = VERY FRIENDLY but also VERY SLOW + and - there. Price = I'm not sure but I think it's a little more expensive than usual. Convenience = It is indeed convenient being right outside Knott's Berry Farm. Oh man this place sucks.  What the.......how does it suck so bad?  I guess maybe because they know they can get away with it?  I don't know. Probably better off eating the food onsite within Knott's.

We came in this evening and decided to sit at the bar area since it was pretty empty 3 servers on the bar area. Waited and waited for over 15 minutes and where not even acknowledged, worst customer service ever especially that the bar was empty!

Been to Friday's at other locations before and love the food and drinks. Especially the happy hour on Sunday's. But this location only got 4 out of 5 because they don't have happy hour at this location on Sunday's due to being close to the park I suppose. But good service nonetheless.

Arrived and its not busy at all and the host Robin said it be 10 minutes to be seated. Our server Gina is very nice. Our food orders came out really quick. Gina was on top of our refill and the food was warm and tasty.

This place always has a bad odor walking in. The girls at the front desk are always talking barely acknowledging you when you walk in. Which makes it awkward. Then the bartenders take forever to make your drink when it's not busy, and they seem not to know who's helping who then when you need something else you have to wait for the one bartender helping you when the other one isn't busy. Not recommended.

Let me tell you about the only decent experience I had at TGIFriday's, and that was the music. Other than that, this place is horrible. My wife and I come in, and ask to sit at the bar to avoid waiting for a table. Luckily the hostess let us know there was an available booth in the bar. We thought we scored, boy were we wrong. It probably took 5-10 minutes for a server to notice us. Once she did, she told us she'd help us in a moment. A moment turned into another 5-10 mintues. Our server finally came to our table and asked us if we were ready to order, in which we weren't because we wanted a full menu. She didn't even ask us if we wanted to start off with something to drink. Then she walked over to the hostess table and picked up two menus for us. She then told us that she would give us a few minutes, but we were ready to order our drinks. After we ordered our drinks, it took about 10 mintues to get it out to us. We finally ordered after receiving our drinks. We thought after having our drinks, maybe things would go a little more smoothly, and we were wrong yet again. We started to see more customers flow into the bar dining area, and that's when the waiting game started. Other customers began ordering their meals, while my wife and I were still waiting on our appetizers. After about 20 minutes, we noticed the other customers who arrived after us were getting their appetizers and meals. We normally don't care about that, but after waiting so long, we were pretty annoyed. I felt that the waitress had seen my wife and I look over at the customers who received their meals before us because she came up to our table and told us our food would be out, but they were just backed up because of the other side. I would have believed her bologna, but customers on our side were receiving their food on good time. But because we don't like to make a big deal about things, we let it slide again. Our appetizers finally came out, and that was okay. Probably only because my wife and I were practically starving. While we were eating our appetizers, they brought out one side salad and our Jack Daniel's burger that we were going to share. Please note we had ordered 2 side salads. One with balsamic dressing and the other with italian dressing. I had to tell the food runner we ordered 2 side salads. She then asked what type of dressings for both, which we proceeded to tell her one balsamic and one italian. She then told me they didn't have italian and balsamic would be the closest in dressing. The Italian dressing was for my wife which she was fine with, but we were wondering why our server didnt tell us. Now let me tell you about our so called Jack Daniel's burger. One, the fries were cold. My wife had to try one because she was in disbelief. Then I pick my half of the burger and had to immediately put it down because it was cold. I had to touch the center to feel some kind of heat, which was nonexistant. It's like our burger had just been sitting on the counter in the kitchen. I was also looking for the Jack Daniel's sauce the burger was supppose to have. My wife had asked me if  she should speak to the manager and luckily I happened to see the manager walking by. So my wife called out to her and told her our burger and fries were cold. The manager was very apologetic and nice, and offered to remake the burger which we were happy about. The manager ended up returning with a new burger in less than 5 minutes and we were pleased about that. The manager once again apologized and asked if there was anything else she could do. In my mind, a new server, but out loud, nothing. I think after we had talked to the manager, our server began acting rude towards us. At that point, we didn't even care. We just wanted our check and to leave this horrible place. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone. I should have read the reviews about this place and gone to Claim Jumper's.

You know the song where Rebecca Black sings "Friday"?  And how it's so annoying and BAD?  That basically describes this TGI Friday's.  Which seat should I take?....Don't take any of them. Because of our experience, the bf and I will now forever check Yelp reviews before entering ANY establishment. We went into the building, unawares of the health hell that we were about to traverse into.  No lines, no crowds, few people in the dining room....oh woe is us to not see the danger signs.   Issue 1: When we walked in, there were two girls there, folding menus.  They did not greet us immediately.  Instead, they went on with their folding.  They were fully aware that we were there, but they wanted to go on with their tedious and pointless task of folding menus and recording down how many menus they already made and such.  When they were done writing down how many menus they made, they finally looked up and greeted us.  However, they can't find their seating map because it's buried underneath all of their menus, and they more or less just go into one of the dining rooms, look around, see a table that is still being currently cleaned and take us over there.  We walk over there, the busboy is still cleaning, but the hostess basically shoos him away so that we can sit.  But he wasn't done cleaning, and it is obvious he wasn't done cleaning. Issue 2:  Because the table was actually still dirty, she seated us, and covered a nice fat piece of lettuce with the menu, thinking that we wouldn't see it.  I made a point of removing the menu, flicking off the piece of lettuce from the table, and then sat down.  Sorry, missy, but I'm not stupid; you try and cover stuff like that, and it will be pointed out.   Our waitress eventually came by, and we ordered two waters.  Which moves to Issue 3: the water tasted of more chlorine than the Big Foot Rapids water at Knott's.  I mean, I understand that most of the time the water you order is tap water.  But there's a point in time where the taste and hygiene coming from the tap water either needs to be sanitized or some filter needs to be replaced.   We eventually order our entrees.  I get the shrimp and chicken fettucine, while the bf got the sirloin steak and shrimp scampi.  This launches us to Issue 4 and 5: they gave me a plastic fork and knife in a wrapper while the bf got a dirty-ass steak knife and stainless steel fork. It's a restaurant...is it weird that I assumed that there'd be actual silverware, not plastic stuff.  The only good thing about my stuff being plastic is that we could somewhat safely assume that the plastic utensils were sanitary.  However, for Issue 5, the bf's silverware were disgusting.  The knife was still grimy, it was not clean, and there were plenty of stains on there that I could not move with a napkin and friction.  Now, I love my bf, and we are prone to getting food-poisoned as much as everybody else.  Didn't want the risk of a food poisoning, so the bf decided to take my plastic knife so that he would have something a bit more sanitary to cut the steak with.   Got the food promptly, so that was good...right?  Issues 6 to Montezuma's Revenge. - My chicken tasted old and cold.  It tasted as if they had originally cooked it a few days ago, put it in the fridge or freezer, and then "cooked" on a George Foreman grill when I put in my order.  The pasta was hard and cold, as if it was either out for awhile, or they had made the pasta in the morning, no one ordered any, and it was sitting where ever it was sitting for half an hour or so.  The sauce itself was warm.  But, everything was definitely less than 160 degrees, and probably a mediocre 135-145 degrees when I had the food.  Major food code violation. - The bf ordered the steak medium, but it came out from well done to raw.  As in, he would slice into one portion and it was medium, but then he'd slice into another portion and it was raw, and then he'd slice into another portion and it was well done.  His plate looked like a horrible murder scene after awhile.  The shrimp was okay, the mashed potatoes were like cardboard, and the veggies was soggy.  A few minutes after we were "done" with our meal, the bf already felt sick.  The food basically slipped right through his stomach and into his ass because it was so coated with oil that it launched right through digestion like the Mountain Log ride.  Had to run home after that.... Our check was ridiculous.  Two meals and it was basically $50 with tip.  If it was good food, then I would have been happy to pay for it.  But it wasn't, and it sucked, and the bf got sick.  Fuck you, TGI Friday's.  Not very Friday-like of you at all. So, the next time you're near Knott's, and you're hungry?  DON'T COME HERE.  Standing in line is better than the bullshit that we saw and ate.  Bleh.   Only thing that was okay was that our waitress(es) were nice.  We'll see if that changes and I somehow get a bank statement of them adding a bigger tip than what I put in..

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Wow...  Came here for dinner before going to Knotts Scary Farm and what a disappointment!  We were seated right away and drinks came very shortly after.  That's when it took a turn for the worse!  We ordered our food with salads and then waited, and waited and waited.  Our salads came with our food and then to top it off, we never received silverware!  We had to ask for forks, knives and napkins!  By the time we began to eat, our food was cold!  Service was extremely slow and inconsistent.  I do not believe we will be returning to this location again!

Absolutely the WORST food I have EVER eaten in any restaurant!!! There are six of us in my family and typically the majority of us are happy with our food wherever we go. But this one gets a HUGE thumbs down!
Food was too over priced. Their NORMAL prices push es the realm of decency. Making a mental note to never come here again. I'd rather trek down to McDonald's...

Bad servers and bad food. They dunt know how to Walt on customers. It was dead the other night and our waitress was to busy chatting with the bartender too take our order we had to wave then down and ask her everything. Not worth spending my money there.  I'd rather go elsewhere
Because i am obligated to give 1 star The customer service  is horrible Ive counted about 13 servers  and can get 1 person to give a straw Server took our order was a mess Never again coming here

TGI Friday's Buena Park is a good alternative to the always crowded Knott's Chicken Dinner Restaurant a short walk across the street. Great food and service along with Americana that extends that already provided at the farm.
I love this Friday's it's never crowded wait time is short as soon as we walked in we were seated on a Sunday afternoon awesome. I love the Jack Daniels burger it is so yummy

Terribly slow service. Waited extra long for extra overcooked and cold food. This Friday's is higher in price than others because of its location outside the park, but certainly not better than any other location. The manager was quite pleasant to speak with near the end of our visit and she tried, but the rest was so mediocre it's hard to rate any higher than 2 stars.

Service is awesome! Or waiter came by our table like a million times to see how the food was. Price is higher than other TGI Fridays it seems, but delicious nonetheless.  We started with loaded potato skins, which were great. I had the chicken ceasar salad and a Blue Moon.

First time eating here at this location with my daughter n I have to say it's been the worst  eating experience I've had at a Fridays. First of all we sat down at the bar cuz of the wait so were sitting n waiting n waiting for someone to stop n at least ask if we want menu's. Dinner was okay, service was bad, had three different waiter/waitresses. After waiting for 45min to be seated we had to wait another 15mins for the waitress to take our drink orders. Food is very expensive along with the drinks. Taking advantage of the people who are  visiting Knotts and staying close by. $15 for a cheeseburger/very small salad..beers 10.00 for a bud light. REALLY...and bad service. bad taste in my mouth. Go up the street to Rock and Brews you will not regret it.

#rude I ordered a refill on my slush because the menu says they're free. Waitress told me I was wrong. (I checked multiple online menus when we left. I knew I was right. FREE was the whole reason I ordered it!)  Boyfriend ordered mozzarella sticks and potato skins. Cheese was undercooked, not gooey. Potatoes were dry and gross. Don't go here. It sucks. Stick with Brea.

Soo.. I am not fond of leaving bad reviews but I must. After seeing the poor rating at this location & experiencing it first hand I see why this establishment only has two stars. My husband & I were having a day at Knott's & he decided to take me to lunch here. We were greeted warmly by the seating hostess which was nice. This was around 1pm so there was no one sitting in the area we were seated at when we arrived.  My complaint was with our "waitress", Raylene. She walked up to us without a smile & hardly a hello. I was not expecting her to do a dance but she should know a thing or two about customer service. All of the four time she came to our table she had an attitude. She came to give us menus, take our order, bring our food, bring our check. She even walked around like the world irritated her & had better things to do... It was really sad to see.  When I ordered my strawberry lemonade, she brought me something that had been sitting around for a while. All of the "mix" or whatever they put in it had settled at the bottom of my glass. The food was ok.  TGIF, after all these bad reviews, it would be nice to see something be done about the lack of customer service.

TGIF (thank God it's Friday) A good place to get a veggie burger with BBQ sauce, my kids get the cheeseburgers kids meals are so good to, I get the steak and ribs and salad for myself.  this place has great food for families, please check it out. the place is next to Knott's Berry Farm.
Ok food. Not a great menus sekection.fast service and our server was atrentive. Rating is for food taste and selection.

Reviewer bias/preface: Friday's fucking sucks.  I equate eating here with someone telling me bad news, like I'm going to have to spend the next 48 hours watching Whoopi Goldberg films. So, why did I eat here? Easy: the guys in our group for Knott's Scary Farm wanted to get drinks beforehand, and this is really the best place to do that.  Unfortunately, it also means that if you didn't think to eat ahead of time, you'll probably be tempted to crack open a menu.  FOR THE LOVE OF CHRIST, DO NOT DO THIS.  For starters, they have instituted a new policy that limits food ordering at the bar to a small menu during Halloween season. I get that you don't want to back the kitchen up with 82 orders from half-drunken assholes waiting to enter the park, but gauge accordingly, guys. All this new policy managed to do was piss off my group since we were all hungry, and getting a table didn't sound like a fun idea. But we did it because we had to.  I cautiously opened the menu, quickly scanning past every caloric behemoth to find something that wouldn't shave years off my life. I settled on the Jack Daniels chicken, with mashed potatoes & vegetable medley.  That can't be all that bad, right? WRONG. My "chicken" (I feel I need to use the term loosely here) seemed... off. It was like someone had ground up all the parts of the chicken, then compressed them together into the form of what resembles a breast. I eat A LOT of chicken, and this did not seem like a fresh breast of it. The sides were absolute garbage. The potatoes were - naturally! - covered in a congealed, slimy mess of "cheese". The spuds underneath were so stiff someone must have mixed Cialis into the batch. My "vegetable medley" was just zucchini and squash. It was also so overcooked that each piece was just a limp, sloppy, sad slice of what could have been a decent gourd.  Everything about this place - from the garish decor right on down to the painted-on smiles each shit-shoveling server brings to the table - makes me want to wretch. Vile establishments like this are why you're so fat, America. They pander to the LCD, with zero regard for quality, health, standards, or otherwise.  Next time, I'm making the guys eat anywhere but here.

There's a strange familiarity between Chili's, TGI, and Applebee's. So gimmicky these national chains are, that it's Twilight Zone-ish. But we all go, like herded animals. Cheap ingredients, prepared a hundred different ways, that cost way more than it should, to pay the corporate CEO's.  Needless to say, I'm not a big fan of the McDonalds business model. I support the Mom and Pops establishments. Something more "real" about it.  On the flip side, you just don't know what you're going to get. There's a need in our lives for consistency, especially in eating. Go to any town across the nation and you'll know what to expect at these establishments. Large group, no problem. The variety will probably meet everyone's taste.  I go, because I must sometimes. At the end, I'm glad that they're there.  Thumbs up, but only a little. As always, let me know what you think.

Service here is really slow. It takes about 20 minutes for the server to bring out beer. This place rarely gets busy. Every time I come here, it's always slow. When it's slow, service shouldn't be so slow or bad either.
This place is the biggest rip off location for this franchise. $11 for a beer during happy hour - insanity
$10 kids meals, no thanks! Better choices inside the park. My $15 salad was worse than a fast food joint as well. Skip this place!
Came for the $10 dollar endless appetizers! But they don't have it at this location apparently....Ended up paying $10 dollars for one beer instead.

Came here on Sunday afternoon for a late lunch...The place was pretty empty, we decided to sit at the bar... Service was very slow...considering how empty the restaurant was and there were many bartenders and servers working too... A couple servers sat in the back booth and chit chatted while we had to chase people down for service...Ordered the jack daniels chicken and shrimp with french onion soup... The meal itself was ehhhhhh.  The chicken was too tough and the veggies were overcooked to where they were soggy... I love their french onion here so that didn't fail me....

After a long day at knotts, my friends and I decided to have dinner at TGI. I ordered the jack Daniels burger and it was delicious. The fries were a bit salty though. Our waitress Jan was very friendly and the music selection was great! I would definitely come back here again.

"We went to this TGI Fridays for lunch and to say the least it was a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! do not eat here. The servers have attitudes, the restaurant is filthy, tables are dirty , waiters have attitudes, food came out cold twice, and the management sucks. Avoid here at all costs. Completely nasty.

Meh...The thing about it is I HAVE to give it 3 stars. You know what?  I noticed that a lot of places I review might just be getting lucky because I'm STARVING before I go eat there lol. Went to knotts for my daughters 19th birthday and fathers day. Decided to go to fridays instead of bad food at the park. Intead we got bad food at fridays, for double the price. I ordered the blue cheese burger. When it got there 30 minutes later, the waitress dropped my sons sauce all over our table and on me. My burger had no bacon on it, was way over done, and the fries were cold. $13. what a joke. I stopped going to all fridays years ago, because they just went down hill. Never will I go to any fridays again. The food there is just bad. Just TV dinners is all they are.

This establishment is by far one of the worst places I have ever dined. I only chose to go here because I wanted to grab a quick drink and appetizer before I went into Knott's Berry Farm. So we go in there and order our drinks at the bar and the manager is playing with, scowling and being very rude saying that my boyfriend's ID is fake. Mind you, he is 25 years old... like most people in the US, he got his drivers licence at 16 years old so yes the picture looks slightly different but she wouldn't give us our drinks because she swore that the ID was fake. He clearly looks his age (25) so WTF. I finally went on my Facebook and pulled up old high school photos just to prove to this ignorant person that that is his ID is real. In the end, we finally got our drinks. Then we ordered some boneless wings, among a couple appetizers, I believe some Jack Daniels thing? DISGUSTING.. everything is overly fried and not in a way that even tastes good. I felt like I got a box of chicken wings out of the frozen food aisle in a grocery store. Not restaurant quality at all!! I've been to other TGIF locations that actually have food that is up to restaurant quality... Ok so there's more. The bartender and a waitress were talking very close by where we were sitting and we could hear every word of them bashing their customers and saying rude things about other people that work there. The food and staff quality left a terrible taste in my mouth. I will never go back there. I do, however, highly recommend the Claim Jumper and Black Angus down the street. Still close enough to grab a drink before going into Knott's and way better quality all around.

AMAZING!!! We have gone to Fridays forever..... Until last night!  While we did expect things to be a little higher due to is being across from knotts and it being Halloween haunt, we did not expect to pay $60.00 for 4 shots! You have got to be kidding me...... Like many have said before me if your thinking of going here TURN AROUND. DON'T GO!!!!!  I believe in paying for service and for what I get but this was a complete rip off!  This place is A no go!!!!!!!!

Just left restaurant, got to say that after not getting my wings right and after sending them back for the 2nd time I was intrigued to watch the flow of all personal. Chris was our bartender who apologize for the kitchen not getting it right the first time. He asked if we wanted to speak to manager (Melissa) and we said "No its ok" all we wanted was extra crispy chicken wings...This is when my attention was caught to look at the restaurant flow, Melissa the person in "charge" brought our wings and SAID NOTHING.  I think Chris and Andrew were more concern of customer satisfaction than the "Manager" ever seemed to show.  I am writing this because as a professional in customer service felt the staff were all working VERY hard with no direction of upper management. Staff...Chris, Andrew, Micheal and John (who should be the manager) were very hard workers and got very little or should I say NO support of their manager. She just watched and not once offer help to make sure customers were first. Its a shame because this is a high productive team who can be very successful but because of management fall short on quality and customer satisfaction which should be at the forfront of any business.

I went with a group of 3 other people.  We ordered our appetizer significantly before ordering our main course, yet the appetizer came out a few minutes after our food.  They call them "starters" for a reason.  When we politely mentioned to the waiter (actually, the food runner) that we expected it before our meal, he said "yeah, I kinda messed that one up... but food's food, right?"  I guess at least he tried to make an attempt at an apology, but he should have stopped there. The "appetizer" was delicious (loaded potato skins).  For my main course, I ordered the Captain Morgan Conga Line Chicken Sandwich.  Granted, it wasn't the most expensive thing on the menu, but I would have paid more for something edible.  The chicken was entirely overcooked and difficult to cut with the steak knife. I will give TGI Friday's another chance, but certainly not this location.

on a Saturday afternoon and the restaurant is not crowded at all.  we sat in the bar so he could watch tv (football).  my only complaint is that our waiter does not know how to make strawberry lemonade.  And, so he had to add more strawberries for the first drink, when he made the second one, he did the same thing again, and he wasn't that busy, so for me that meant that he wasn't paying attention.

TGI Fridays is like your typical cookie cutter sit down restaurant. What I enjoyed about this was that they do have some great tasting meals for under 700 calories, but the prices are pretty high. I tried the Jack Daniels Chicken and Shrimp which tasted great but at over $17 that is pretty hectic. The service was good and patient with our large party. They do have very cool decorations and the vibe is very relaxed.

Wow I wish I had looked up the other reviews before eating here!!! I dragged my family out of knotts to eat lunch here because I thought that the food would be better than over priced amusement park food and it was by far the worst meal I have had in a long time. They were so understaffed. The restaurant was almost empty and we must of been in there almost 2 hours just to have lunch! We ordered drinks and they brought the wrong beers and brought my 1 and 3 year old Soda instead of lemonade in their kids cups!! My 1 year old had drunk half a cup of sprite before my 3 year old told me it wasn't lemonade!! I was so annoyed. The waiter apologized over and over. The food came out. One of us received the wrong burger, I ordered the french dip sandwich and the Au Jus Sauce was like water it had no flavor at all and the sandwich bread was so wet and soggy it was disintegrating as I picked it up. It truly was disgusting. Would never recommend eating here and we regretted it so much when we went back in the park and saw some of the amazing smelling food inside the park!

I really think TGI Fridays is a great place to eat. I found the one located at the Block in Orange is the best of them all. My family and I go to Knotts quite often as we have annual passes. So of course when this particular TGI Fridays opened up we had to give it a try. What a disaster it was. I have been there two times. The first time the place was brand new. The decor is like any other typical Fridays establishment. The food on the other hand was pure filth. The food was like pig slop. I ordered the chicken fettuccine and it was soupy and not even close to being hot. The server was a complete ding bat. After trying to let her know that my plate was a huge pile of slop with no success we decided to just get out of there. The second time we went there (I know it seems I am a glutton for punishment) we had received a gift card. It had been a year or so since we had gone there the first time. Note that this TGI Friday's uses a different menu so my favorite specials weren't available.  It was dead when we went on Tuesday night.  But, that didn't mean that we got special attention. The server seemed to disappear. We came for the fried green beans and weren't disappointed. These are nice and crispy and the dipping sauce has enough wasabi to add a little kick without over powering.   I had the Key West Shrimp to help keep my calories down.  It comes with a huge portion of broccoli and two skewers of shrimp.  When I ordered it the waitress asked if I've had it before - my guess to warn me that it's just shrimp and broccoli - my guess is that people complain when all their other dishes come loaded with food.  But, since they proudly display the calorie counts on each item and most items come close to exceeding my daily allotment, I choose carefully.  (Those green beans were 840 calories on their own!   Don't worry about parking they have 3 hours free parking in the lot next to the restaurant.

eat here a few times and every time i was disappointed! there is always something, servers are ass holes, food ran out, coffee machine is broken, blender broke for mixed drinks, like damn it you are a resturant fix this shit! but always  got a discount on the bill cause the manager knew he has a shitty place here

I went to a wedding held at the Bride's uncle's huge-mungous house in Buena Park. Now she's Mexican and the Groom is Indian so there was this full on Catholic meets Hindu ceremony  that basically went on for 8 hours. After numerous bottles of Syrah and the conclusion of the formal festivities, a group of us where looking for the next level of partying. Unfortunately, Buena Park ain't a party town and the only thing there besides hotels/motels is Knott's Berry Farm. Someone found out that there was a TGIF there and figuring that there was a full bar and munchies, it would do.   To our discovery, the bar was full of other people looking to rage, and who also figured this to be the only game in town. Lot's of twenty-somethings, a mix of locals/tourists,  and now  a dozen or so raucous (but nicely dressed) wedding participants. I was actually surprised to see a number of cute girls (well it is still the greater LA area) and find that the wait staff was going to be equally as out of hand.  So we ordered a spread of appetizers and burgers to fill our post wedding hunger pangs.   As the waited for the food the Guinness, shots, and other fine TGIF libations started flowing. Some of the girls in our party agreed to partake in one of the bartender's "LA Dirty Water" mixoramas, which had Midori, Blue Curacao, and a number of other liquids that gave it a greenish-brown hue. They gave it a thumbs up and several rounds were to follow. The food was typical TGIF, mozzarella sticks, potato skins, cheeseburgers; nothing fancy but  good enough to fulfill the wedding/alcohol marathon binge. One of the amusing things of the night was the cocktail sign printed in giant letters with a ceiling lamp obscuring "tail". So from where we were sitting, the sign read: "ULTIMATE COCK" and we tried to get a picture of one of the male employees giving the Groom a lap dance under said sign, but neither party was going for it. So we continued to eat, drink and closed the place down.   I totally forgot how fun a chain place like TGIF could actually be when you're with the right people and everyone else around you is just looking to have a good time (and it's not someone's frickin' bday). As we were leaving, we noticed that there was a joint down the street called "Mrs. Knott's Chicken Dinner Restaurant". In front of this place was a 7-8 foot tall statue of a rooster. There he was in all his glory, THE ULTIMATE COCK.

Went with a large group of people for lunch and a break from the roller coasters. The service was terrible. 4 out of 10 of our orders had to be sent back because they were cold or incorrect. The server took 20 minutes to bring out a sangria because she "couldn't find a bottle opener." I went to the bar 3 separate times over a 45 minute period and was told that they were out of 22oz beer glasses so I had to keep buying pints. One of the times I was denied a 22oz I noticed a bartender on the other side serving another guest a 22oz. I asked to talked to the manager about their apparent dishwashing and/or lazy bartender problem. His reply was "I wasn't there, sorry about that, I don't know what happened." He didn't offer me a beer or any sort of solution, he just stated he didn't know what happened because he wasn't there.  Overall this location is ruining the reputation of Friday's. When you go to a chain restaurant you expect consistency, they do not have it here. Crappy service, lazy bartenders, and management that doesn't have a clue nor do they even care. I am not a picky person, this was just ridiculous.
Worst service ever had at a TGI Friday's! Find a different one!

TGIFs isn't so great i've hated it and i always will last time i went i just got tenders and  french fries  the other time i went the food make me sick and i puked I HATE THAT FEELING food is suppose to make you feel GOOD not make you sick AND THE SERVICE SUCKS  me and my friend once were completed ignored by  the waitress we had to get another waiters attention just to get DRINKS. So I signed up for the "Give Me Stripes" card and they send me coupons through my email.  I decided to use the coupons, only to find out the manager accused me of copying it and said I couldn't use it, even though he knew I was a cardholder.  They should attach a bar code on every coupon, if they are afraid of people copying it.  My friends used it at TGIF @ The Block without any hassle. Anyways, the food was good though.  I got the Jack Daniel's Flat Iron and my friend got the Jack Daniels Ribs.  Yum =)

I'm a big fan of Fridays and spent lots of time there in college (celebrating birthdays, end of finals, etc). It's the safe, reliable place to get appetizers, drinks, and when you're feeling bold, the Jack Daniels Flat Iron Steak. THIS Friday's however, is one of the saddest restaurants I've ever been to. The service was extremely slow, which was appalling considering it was Monday @ 4:00. There were maybe 5 other tables of customers. Sonny, a waiter who wasn't ours but took pity on us, brought out our appetizer before our waitress could bring us water. We were halfway through the dish when she finally reappeared with 2 glasses of water (there were 3 people in our party). I ordered the spinach dip and was charged an extra .99 when I asked for more chips. REALLY? You're going to charge me for extra chips?! It's not my fault there were only 15 chips on the plate to begin with. When the waitress told me, I thought she was kidding. But no, she was dead serious. I've never run into this practice at any of the other Friday's locations (Costa Mesa, Cerritos, Orange). I can justify giving this place one star because the waitress carded my mother, thereby making her day. The fact that she refused to serve my mom alcohol after she explained that she didn't bring an id was hilarious. She pointed out that I was her child and that she had the C-section scar to prove it, but the waitress wasn't buying it. So in the end I showed my id and ordered mom some booze. The story is so ridiculous its funny, which makes it the only quasi-enjoyable part of my experience here. Fridays is good, just not this one.

I know 4 stars for a Friday's.   This review is mostly for our server 'Rex'.  Above and beyond the call as our tab was going to be low with 2 adults and 3 children.  Thank you management for allowing kids in the bar area now btw...  Rex gave us carte blanche service and the food was good too.  Fyi, if you are a season pass holder, your discounts work here as well.  Will be back

Decided to eat here after Knott's, This is by FAR the WORST TGIF I ever ate at !!!   My appetizer was just warm & tasted like it was sitting for a while not  fresh at all. So, I ordered my usual Jack Daniels Chicken & Shrimp it was terrible !!  Just barley warm food. My veggies looked all GREASY & they were suppose to be steamed. The chicken I couldn't eat it much tasted old. Shrimp was ok but, smelled fishier than usual. Yesterday... This trip to TGI Friday's next to Knott's was by far the worst experience at a restaurant we ever had. My daughter's burger was served to her with Mold all over the bun. Lots on the menu. Although this location attracts alot of tourists since its by Knotts. I wont even start on the crowd. Anyway, if you know youre coming here ahead of time make sure you have a salad for lunch. I think my plate was like 1000 calories. oh boy! I had a chicken and cheese thing. it was ok. Given that this place was dead at the lunch hour, I can honestly say we got decent service despite being part of a large group.  Service was a little  slow, but we all got our food served up right without any problems.  Plus I was able to keep my lunch down even after riding the rides at Knott's!

The green bean fries paired with the Ultimo Margarita is a good choice after a day at Knott's Berry Farm.  The bar area smelled pretty nasty but the margarita,  which was surprisingly good, made it tolerable.

"Knott's" is next door so, yea. Really kitsch, not even in the usual bad way, but in the annoying way. Where you're like, "Okay you don't have to put a Twister board on the wall next to a Spock cutout", that's pushing it too far. I GET IT. AMERICA HAS COOL STUFF. But the crew boat will always be my favorite item, they have one! Will I come back? Not likely.  Don't get me wrong, I LOVE TGIF. It's my favorite f*ckn chain restaurant in the world. this is by-far the worst place restaurant my wife and I have been. I don't want to get into the detailes, so just go somewhere else. This place needs a make-over in wait, bar and kitchen staff. more-over the mgmt needs to change..

It so turned out that it was a great recommendation...thus earning a 4th star. However, a short while later, she and another server (male) arrived at the register at about the same time, and she turned and snapped at him "CAN'T YOU SEE I AM USING THIS? WHY DO YOU THINKING I'M STANDING HERE?!" Star removed! The guy was shocked and embarrassed, I felt for the dude. That stuff just doesn't fly with me. I work with about 200 other people at any given time and I am sure that there are employees that don't get a long with one another, but never would that type of behavior be accepted! Be a grown up and shut your mouth. She needs some stress management lessons.

Zero stars, Yelp will only allow a minimum of 1.  We were accused of not paying our bill by the manager, Where was he when the service was so bad?  Hiding in the back?   Service was awful.  Order all our food including an appetizer at first intro to server.  Waited 40 minutes to get appetizer & drinks. this place is impossible to find using mapquest! my goodness!!!  My company had their holiday party here, and I just knew it was NEAR knotts, but I didn't realize you actually drive into Knott's parking area.  Once I finally got there, I was pretty impressed with the location. It's surrounded by other little restaurants on Grand ave, right outside the theme park. Also right outside of the Patio area is the ride Ghost Rider. You can see the ppl on the ride, hear them screaming, its kinda neat- you feel like you get to be apart of all the action!!  I'm reviewing this place mainly on location.  Food here is decent.  TGIF's Jack Daniels sauce is their specialty which is pretty good!!  This time I tried their honey pecan salmon, probably should have stuck w/ usual Jack Daniels steak/shrimp or chicken. Salmon was a little dry, and sides were just rice and broccoli...pretty bland and boring.   So basically if you feel like eating at TGIF, maybe try this location for something different! Especially with the large patio area, it would be nice to eat outside when weather is nice.  Restaurant parking is free for the 1st 3 hrs. Over 3 hours might be a little pricey though!

There are alot of things about this Fridays that I don't like, so I will start with the stuff I do like. I do like the service and the place is kept very clean. Also, there is ample parking next to it. Oh yeah, and the food is decent. Now I'll start with what I don't like. I decided to meet my friend there last night for drinks,  and as soon as I entered the place my ears started bleeding. It was Karaoke nite at the bar. Now I love to karaoke, I'm Filipino, but  the volume was too high. It was difficult to sit in the bar area and have a conversation with my friend. I requested to be moved to the farthest table they had. I asked to be outside in the patio. This is where the 2nd complaint comes in...they weren't doing service outside for some reason. Why have tables outside if you aren't going to use it! So instead, we were moved to a table in a far corner of the restaurant.  Third complaint,  no Happy Hour. Don't all Fridays have Happy Hour??? Why is this one different?Isn't this a bar? Fourth, they close at 11, unlike other Fridays that close midnight and beyond.  Unless I have no other choice, which is highly unlikely, I would not go here again. I would rather go to a little Korean pub down the street.

it's was friday night and i wanted a long island so i sat at the bar with 2 girlfriends. I expected plenty more people since it was happy hour, but hardly anyone was there. it took way way way too to get a server. our server was inattentive, not friendly, and just cold... We took our business elsewhere TGIF at Long Beach Town Center, Cerritos Town Center, and The Block are all better. Avoid this one folks   :(

I am out of work and thought I would use a 2 for 1 +$1 coupon for a date with my wife. This TGIF would not take the coupon because they were close to Knotts and knew they had a captive audience. I was embarrased as I walked out in dissapointment. Complained to corporate, but was ignored.

Fridays can't even cook right.  I called the maneger after I got better and he didn't even apologize.  He didn't even SOUND sorry.  I am never EVER going there again.  I would tell everyone not to unless you want to experience food poisoning.

i thought this place wasn't too bad.. or was i just hungry after riding dangerous rides @ knott's berry farm? hmmm.. my hunny & i decided to eat lunch at about 3ish pm & it happened to be really slow. our waitress was nice but quiet & didn't know how to sell when i asked for her opinions or descriptions on food.. we got our food really quick which was a plus since we were extremely hungry. i guess its a good thing they didn't come around to check on us? & we had to chase after a waiter to get the bill after waiting for days. we never got to see our waitress who hosted us so we met other waiters along the way. the food itself was delicious, the service was horrible.

We didnt have to wait to be seated that was great considering its accros from knotts service was great but they dont have the offers that the other tgi fridays have and it is a little bit pricier than other tgi fridays but its better than eating anywhere Inside knotts. We had a cheeseburger With beacon and fries 13.60 a chicken fingers kids meal 8.60 it included the kids drink and a chicken finger with fries regular meal 13.60 two sodas 7.80. Bill came out to 47.09 with tax

Painful in every respect is the only way to describe our experience here. No matter how convenient it seems to go to this restaurant because you're at Knotts I would recommend not doing it and finding somewhere else.  We went at an off time for a late lunch and the service took at least twice as long as it should have. The server seemed inefficient and inexperienced.  The food did not all come out at the same time.  It also seems that they take any opportunity they can to add an up charge.  Food quality is poor and pricing, while not expensive, is higher than it should be for the quality.

This Fridays is horrible, came in with a group of 9 sat in the bar area. Waited for two tables to be bussed for over 20min. Decided to take matters into our own hands and bus the dishes ourselves and had to ask the bartender for a towel to clean the table. We the guest bussed and cleaned the table, the staff even saw this and did nothing. Drinks were overpriced and terrible, our Washington Apple shots had way too much pucker in them and the bartender had to ask how to make them. The Long Island ice teas were even worse, beyond the rational amount of sweet n sour. Seriously Fridays these two drinks are simple for any novice bartender to not screw up.
