We had asked our bartender to speak to one because they all watched us bus our own table. Manager never came by.  Paid our ridiculous $450 tab and will never be back. $10 a drink is outrageous. This isn't Vegas or a fine dining restaurant. Get your act together TGIF. You're sinking fast

starters were good...got the mozzerella, fried green beans and the spinach bread... my cajun chicken & shrimp pasta was a bit too salty i couldnt taste the cajun..=(  my daughter enjoyed her steak...my son loved the half rack--- i think the best part of my dinner was my dessert...had the peanut butter chocolate pie & the vanilla bean cheesecake...it hit the spot!

When I go to any TGIF I don't expect much in terms of food or service, but when my family and I stopped in here after a day at Knott's I was really disappointed. The food runner knocked over my full bar drink as she placed my entree on the table, and the glass broke all over our table and my drink soaked my shirt and pants. We had to move tables so my 2-year-old wouldn't touch broken glass. I know accidents happen and I wasn't upset, but what bothered me is that I didn't receive my new drink until I had finished my meal, and no one really apologized or checked to make sure we were ok. No manager visited our table, and no mention of it again. You'd think that with broken glass around my young son and a long wait for my new drink that there would be some sort of apology. But, then again it is TGIF at Knott's so what can you do.

While at Knott's Berry Farm, we got hungry. (We: the better half, 2 teenage step kids and myself.) The menus were greasy and were disgusting to touch. One of our menus had week old spinach dip caked inside. I had to wash my hand after touching those bad boys. When I told our server that the menus should be wiped down, he laughed. I feel sorry for whoever puts food in their mouth after touching those menus.  We ordered an appetizer. There was a hair in it. We didn't say anything because I didn't want the server to think we were "those customers" who complain about everything just to get a free meal. So our app. went unfinished. Then our dinner arrived... there was hairs in TWO MORE of our meals!!! No joke people. They need to learn how to wear hair nets in that damn kitchen! We didn't tell our server because he never came to check on us. Had to get our bill from another server. Never finished our food.  On the way out, I told the hostess about the incident. She couldn't care less.  Avoid this place at all costs. You will probably have a better experience dumpster diving behind your local dog food factory.

I should have read the reviews. First $3.90 for a soda? Really? Average meal price is $15.00 for lunch. I ordered the French dip based on a photo which made it sound and look good. Well it did not look anything like the photo. A very small roll and a few slices of beef with a side of flavorless au jus. Fries where good. After a couple bites told waitress I did not like. She knocked off $10.00 from bill. I would understand price if food would have been exceptional. One thing though Gina the waitress was very kind and attentive.

My family and I had such a bad experience here. I do understand it's not a 5 star restaurant but I have visited different Fridays locations and never had such a bad experience. When we walked in we were seated right away which was great. Our waitress seemed so sweet at first then all things went down hill once our drink order arrived at the table. My husband's beer wasn't really cold and had a strange after taste to it . We asked how fresh the keg was ? They didn't give us it straight answer so my husband ask for a different brand beer and it was cold and tasted better . We placed our order it took 30 mins the kids food came out first my son order cheese fries the fries had no cheese. After waiting 10 mins still no food for us adults . I made eye contact with our waitress I saw her face when she noticed we didn't have our food yet and rushed to the kitchen area. Another 10mins later our food arrived ! As I ate my burger I thought how strange I didn't order a BBQ burger and told my husband he then noticed he also had the wrong burger! We asked for a menu to double check and we were right we had different burgers then what we ordered but they weren't even accidentally switched they were not our burgers at all we couldn't even find the burgers on the menu with the condiments that were added to ours! We told the waitress she said "sorry" as if it happens a lot there. I couldn't believe it . She then said "ok I will talk to my boss I will be back" whatever that meant we so hungry we just ate our creative cook burgers . The waitress came back and said I can give you a free dessert if you want one ? I just wanted to leave but the kids order an Oreo ice cream sandwich . When the dessert arrive it was so frozen that we couldn't cut it it had probably been in freezer for years. We waited for it to thaw it and it won't so just left it there I wonder if it ever melted?? It's sad that this location has bad service and bad food since it's part of knotts and at a great location . There were so many host, waitresses , managers just stand around not doing anything they could have walked around checked on customers . We had to keep trying to look for someone to refill or drinks , ask for ketchup or dipping sauce as the workers just huddle behind a drink station in the middle of the restaurant chatting . I also forgot to mention this Fridays location is more expensive then other Fridays maybe because of location. We will visit knotts again but will not visit this Fridays location.

My review is based on my experience with the manager Miriam.  After getting served a small steak and not so great service she completely eased my mood by her sweet personality,  understanding while calmly fixing the problem by making sure the correct meal was brought in a very timely manner.  Just turned our night into a better evening after leaving knotts. She even complemented the meal.  I didn't expect that done or asked for any discount.  Very special people you come across once in a while.

Patio was flithy. Concrete floors need a pressure wash. Tables need to be replaced. They were rusted and dented. The menu is different and does not have specials. The prices are higher than usual. Which is to be expected since near Knott's. But the dining experience is not worth the price. Food was average. Service was OK. We went there out of convenience but won't be back.

Service terribly awful. Took 10 mins to get chips and salsa in which the chips tasted like cardboard and old and additional 20mins to get a new one. The burger took 20-25mins to get to us, when we got it it was dry over cooked and burnt. They did not even offer anything to compliment their bad service. Your better off going to a tgif's somewhere else than here. The manager that helped us "kurt" did not even double check on us. Sorry Kurt you and the other manager need to be more consistent with both the bar service and food service.
I got here at noon. They gave us these gross tables. At 2 they told us they forgot our orders. And we called ahead. The folks that did get there food had non appealing meals. I won't return.

After running around the park for a few hours and taking in some libations, it was time to eat and sober up.  We searched the map for eateries and this was by far the better option of everything available. Some people in our party wanted hot dogs from Pinks but I just wasn't feeling it so we settled on Friday's. Hooray! The wait was short considering the mad rush at the park and the crazy line at Mrs. Knott's. We really lucked out and seated ourselves at the bar. Our first waiter was quick with the waters. We must have really needed them because we downed them before he could come back with the menus. After that, we got another server. This was annoying because the wait staff kept changing throughout the entire meal and we had no idea who to flag down for what we needed and none of them could remember what we had asked for and what had already been brought out. Ugh. We finally placed our orders and yet another person brought the food. I ordered a salad to stay somewhat healthy since I had already had my fair share of amusement park junk. The salad was good but not great. It was a chipotle chicken mix with avocados. I love avocados and wish there were more but alas I only saw a few pieces. :( Overall, the experience was very unprofessional. It would have been nice to just have one consistent server/waiter throughout the entire meal. We were only there for an hour, business was slow, so it didn't make sense for all the rotations and confusion.

First off, this TGIF does not have the normal menu that you might love and crave. Knott's owns this place and they have changed a few things. I really wanted to go in to detail and tell you just how BAD this place is but I just don't feel like it. All I want to say is that the people that own and run this place simply don't care about what their customers have to say. If they did they would read all the bad reviews and see that they have alot in common and learn what they are doing wrong. I asked the manager why they don't read the reviews and make change and he said that they don't feel the reviews are accurate. Something like that. I told him about my bad experiance and he did nothing for me. This TGIF is the worst location I've been to and I've been to several.

Think McDonalds with a bar. Somehow this gives them the right to charge $15 for a burger. Came in on a Tuesday and sat at the bar. Wasn't very busy, but still managed to get ignored for 10 minutes. Staff is friendly once they do come by. Food wasn't as pictured. This is my first TGIF I've been to. If the food is the same at their other establishments I'm surprised they are still in business.

Had my son's birthday party here yesterday and had a blast!  Monique and staff were very accommodating!  Service and food were excellent!  There were about 15 of us and we were promptly seated.   Food came out just in time and they kept our cake in the fridge until we were ready. When the time came they brought out the cake with the lit candles and sang Happy Birthday! Throughout the event, Monique made sure all my guests were taken care of.  Being a Season Pass Holder saved me some $$ and being a Rewards Member provided a Free Appetizer!   Everyone had a great time and loved the food!  Thanks again TGI !!!

If  a negative star was an option, trust me this location would be getting a -5. - Really?! An hour for food/order to come out.  - No refill on  drinks when you've asked numerous times for a refill... - Attitude problems with servers and staff.

Worst TGIF EVER!!!!!! Overpriced and they don't honor any commercialized discounts or specials. You cannot even substitute like at the other Friday's. Also no happy hour specials on Sundays like at the other Friday's. Service was also horrible. We we're informed that their pricing was different from the other Friday's because they are owned by Knott's Berry Farm. Although they are close to Knott's you are much better off going to one of the other restaurant chains that are walking distance away.

This was our 2nd time eating here, needless to say it's our last. Started off when we ordered ice teas we received Instant Tea. It was Horrible we sent it back & got 2 diet cokes. I ordered the fried shrimp,  when it came I asked for tarter sauce they told me they don't have tarter sauce I couldn't believe that. They offered to bring me blue cheese. Lol I said ya I guess. My husband ordered the beef French dip with side of horsradish sauce when his sandwich arrived it had some purple jelly, he asked again for the horsradish server said that's it. Which it wasn't he had some on his sandwich just wanted extra they had no idea what he wanted, just gave up. Server never asked us if we wanted refills on our sodas. Plainly ignored us plopped down the ticket without asking us if we wanted anything else. Lesson learned don't ask for anything extra. Wont be back!

1. There were four people at our table, but they only gave us two sets if silverware AFTER asking for it. Apparently people with burgers don't need napkins and knives? We had to ask again for a knife. And they didn't even give us a napkin with it. Uhm... 2. The chicken burger we got was cold and the top bun was rock solid. It was so bad we had to ask them to replace it. They just brought us one top bun. The food was cold, and the chicken was extremely dry. 3. The portions are considerably tiny. (Or at least in the items we ordered. My chicken parmesan had five pieces of tortellini and a very small piece of chicken.) I recommend going elsewhere for your after-Knott's dining.
Salad was gross, bagged salad and gross bottle ranch dressing. Club sandwich was ok, bread was very hard. Green bean fries were good.

I was a little nervous about having a birthday dinner there. We were spending the day at Knotts then wanted to meet family there for a B-Day Dinner. I did a reservation for 22 a few days before. We got there early and they directed us to our area and let us set up decorations.  Our server was prompt and curtious. We there a lot of zealous kids and handled it with ease. Our food was as advertised. They do not do the nation specials there and I think a lot of the prices are a couple bucks higher.  I would go again, we had not issue and service was good.

This place isn't good. We came here after going to Knott's and it took them along time to bring out food. I got chicken kabobs, which asked for no pita bread with it) and they gave me pita bread and like two bites of chicken! This place is gross, I definitely won't come back!
This place doesn't have the same specials as the other Fridays.....why??????? The service was so-so. Only saving grace is that at least the food taste the same as all other Fridays. So sad, too bad

I've tried this Friday's several times before and never had a huge problem with it. Sort of changed my mind. Party of two? Awesome, two min wait time for me. But holy moly there were huge parties of 6+ waiting before us and we got seated before them, which I don't really think is fair but i'm hungry anyway so what the hey. In the past I have ordered the chicken crusted parmesean and it was yummy! This time I wanted to try something fancier so I ordered the 6oz petite sirloin with a side of mash and brocolli, steak ordered medium done. DRY DRY DRY! I've never had to smother my steak with A1 sauce before and the brocolli was burr cold. sigh.  If you wanna go just for some drinks, its a great place. But other than that. Rather dissapointed.
Worst Fridays restaurant... Runner gave wrong food , server charged 12 extra items adding an additional 40.00 to the bill and THEY RAN OUT OF BLU MOON... Too pricey NOT WORTH IT AT ALL
Not a huge fan of chain restaurants, but this is right next to Knott's Berry farm, so it was an easy, walk to choice.

Smelled like vomit and even with four bartenders and I'm assuming four "managers" behind the bar it took approximately 5 minutes to even be acknowledged at the bar top. Poor services all the way around from the management to hourly.
Servers are no where in sight. Too long of wait times, have to track down servers yourself. Bad service

Friday's is everything to me ..until I came to this location all my friends and I did while waiting to our crowd to go to knots berry farm was have some food and drinks and we had nothing but attitude from the bartender from the moment he decided to make the wrong drink for me with an attitude and then we asked for shots and and he passed it over to another girl to make the shots she made us show our Ids all over again even though they were already checked and then she didn't know how to make a shot so she went to someone else which I understand but when I went to my original bartender he gave me an attitude AGAIN sayin she would be right back she didn't know how to make it Which again is fine but it was the approach and then he tried to put it on us about a drink he was going to put in my check when it wasn't mine he asked what I ordered from the chick and then because I am sitting all the way at the end of the bar and my shot 15 minutes later to me is handed to me underneath the beer stand instead of rough around on the countertop like sorry for my language but what the fuck is that???? What kind of service is this ? Sad part is I have been a waitress for 10 years and never have I ever done this and I am a great tipper but not tonight sorry and FYI his name was CHRISPY AND KAMRYN UGH SO DISAPPOINTING

Great place. Great service. Kid friendly with Knotts in walking distance. If you prefer a small crowd it's best to go on Mondays before 4 pm. The food was great. This was my first burger in months. Excellent!! Also thanks for playing all of the country songs that my husband likes. He was singing the entire time.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE SERVICE !!!!!!!!!! They took 15 mins to take our drink order ...... Then we ended up just walking out and even the manager seemed like she didn't care. DO NOT EAT HERE. If you want a great meal and great service DO NOT come here. Go somewhere else. Trust me. I work in the restaurant industry and they don't even deserve one star.

For starters let me just say I work in the food and customer service industry. I have never said this about any place, but this place needs to be shut down!!!!! When I go out I always take in the fact everything a server and sales rep have to put up with. I am very lenient and am not picky. But my experience at this Friday was by far the worst I have ever experienced!!!! Dining with me was my mother, daughter and her friend. We got sat down by the hostess and a server never came by for 30 min.My mother ordered a beer which we never saw. We ordered a appetizer and our meals. Appetizer came and there was a hair in the mozzarella sticks. Gross!! I told the server and they took the plate away. Was not replaced. Then we got our food and in my food there was another hair. All of us had a baseball cap on so we know it wasn't ours. And the hairs were in the food not on top. I asked to talk to the manager and she finally came by and apologized. After all of this I was disgusted and did not have an appetite. My burger was the only thing comped. If I was the manager and a customer of mine found not one but two hairs In their meal the whole meal would have been comped. I will never go to this Friday's again!!! Disgusting.

Had dinner here last night and our server was Gina, she was the cutest. So cheerful, polite and an overall great server. Our food was delicious, as well. Knowing that this particular restaurant is owned by Knott's I inquired about the rewards points being valid there, and they were, without us even knowing if you're a rewards member you get free chips and salsa which Gina quickly brought to our table. I ordered the pecan crusted chicken salad which was delicious and my boyfriend ordered the Jack Daniels mix of chicken and ribs and he was happy as well. I'd have to say it's nice to see a server who acts like they actually like their job.

We dine here for Father's Day on Sunday for lunch. Entering the restaurant we where greeted by friendly hostess whom to took us to our table. Our waitress was Jennifer and while taking her break Jose took over they where both excellant. We oder drinks they where out pretty fast. The menu has been change here so it took us a while to oder. The new menu has 5 pages with about 5 Items per page. The menu had cut off all of their pastas and appetizers. We where surprise to see that ribs and steak with two size are $27 for this location and for a kids burger with a side for $8. All of this price we understood it was because the restaurants are in Knott's grounds. We end up ordering a appetizer $17, two grade salads $8, JD buger with fries $14 and a side of boneless winges $12. The food was had a good taste and serve in about 25min. The location has clean indoor and outdoor seating.

We came to this Fridays bc it was the closest location UNFORTUNATELY!! We walked into the bar area bc we wanted to do the happy hour. (this location has a more expensive happy hour menu and it stops an hr before the other locations) Anyways we came in 10mins before 6pm and figured we could order some appetizers and a round of beers before the happy hour was over. The bartender (possibly manager bc she was professionally dressed) made eye contact with us and said she would be right with us. 20mins passed and we had not one waiter/bartender come to our table. It wasn't even busy, we saw one waiter cleaning an empty table and two bartenders in the bar area doing nothing. Horrible service. We ended up walking out. I do not recommend this place to anyone! Plus the prices are more expensive!
I usually love TGIF but today the presentation of the food was VERY disappointing, the servers were awesome but the food presentation was VERY sad
Service was so so. The server was nice but be aware of your check! They pad the prices hoping you won't catch it. Then if you did catch it, they're ready with the "system error" excuse.

Service was very slow, food cold by the time it came out... Had to ask over and over again for whatever we needed. Paying to be served food is why you go out to eat but if you can't even get that and have to ask over and over for your food and drinks.... Well let's just say I won't go back there again. Unfortunate cause I like Friday's but this one is crossed out of the list.

This TGIF is right outside the gates of Knott's Berry Farm, across from the Chicken Dinner Restaurant.    I'm not sure why anyone would eat here when there is amazing fried chicken less than 100 feet away, but it is a great place to grab a drink.   That is of course unless you want to drink after 11pm.   Even the bar closes early here.   I had friends staying at the hotel across the street, and unless you want to drive anywhere, this is your only choice for a drink in the area.  Amber Waves in the hotel closed even earlier. Food is Friday's mediocrity.  It always looks so much better on the menu (and the commercials).    Our server was awesome though, and she made the evening a lot of fun.  Until last call at 10:40!

I'm downgrading you Friday's!   My friends and I wanted to go to a happy hour so we decided to go here - Friday's usually has good drink/food specials.  Not here though!  When we asked, they really don't do specials on drinks...the best to offer is $1 off of beer and that's it!  They also only had 4 food items that were discounted to $3.99 - buffalo wings, fried mac n' cheese, fried string beans and potstickers.  Needless to say, it was disappointing... Another reason why we came here was to use coupons for this new "rewards" program called "Give Me More Stripes" - you can earn points when you eat to get free food and they also give coupons for discounted food, free desserts/appetizers, etc.  So we had a printout of coupons that said an appetizer for one cent with drink purchase and one dollar for an entree when you purchase another - our waiter walked by and said they don't acknowledge any of the TGI Friday's coupons.  Uhm...what? Apparently, this TGI Friday's is owned by Knott's and they don't have to follow what the other chains do.  They'd probably get even more customers if they did - I've noticed a drop in customers lately.  So yeah...we were not happy about this.  I am disgruntled.

We visited this TGIF @ Knotts on Sat, June 28, because the line to Mts. Knott's Chicken Restaurant was too long even at 3 pm.  The service was okay; were greeted upon entering, seated in just a couple of minutes and the waiter took our beverage orders fairly quickly even tho the restaurant was also packed; I guess because they serve the Knotts crowd. The reason for only 2 stars is because of their food!  We ordered their 3 for $17 appetizers (2 orders of pot stickers and 1 order of boneless buffalo wings). Whatever you order, do NOT order the potstickers!!! These have to be THE worst potstickers I've EVER had!!! They were SO bad, even I couldn't duplicate them at home if I tried.  The potsticker skins were crumbling when we attempted to pick them up with our forks or try to cut them in half! (We had children so we wanted to cut them up smaller for bite size.) It was as if the potstickers had been frozen for MONTHS then thawed in the microwave before they pan-fried them; it's the only explanation for their condition and texture.  I should know cuz I've seen it done and that's exactly what happens!  Their children's Mac n cheese was too lumpy, like it sat out, my drench dip had a weird meat consistency that's hard to explain, like they tenderized it too much...and it took too long to get an extra order of ranch dressing.  Like the other reviews the prices were definitely on the higher end than other TGIF's. It's really too bad they can't serve better food because we like the other TGIF's...
terrible! food took forever, pasta was boring and had no flavor, mozzarella sticks too longer than the pasta, the wings were cold n dry. Not good......

I love TGI Friday's, but not this location. They have a limited menu which I was unaware of when I went before going into Knott's. Their prices are higher than the other Friday's I usually go to. Also something I was unaware of. THe night I went, we had very bad service, the waiters switched out and kept forgetting what we needed. My burger had 1 onion on it. ONE. I asked for more, the manager finally brought me some. This place is not good for a Friday's. Will never go back.
I love TGI Friday's its a fun place to go to to have a beer and some appetizers uncle Tommy

very overpriced, no special menu at this TGIF right across the street from Knotts. poor service. the server (chrispy) got several of our orders wrong even after he repeated it to us...hmmm??? and it took another 20 minutes to bring me my meal. he never apologized for getting it wrong and took another 5-6 minutes to bring mayo. overall, not a good experience at this particular location. he wasn't available even though the place wasn't busy.

My experiences here have been pretty ok. Let me start by saying, this is a terrible place to come if you are trying to watch your calorie intake! Wait...nevermind that; it's ok to indulge a little, right? On to the review..first of all, it's best to bring a friend. The appetizers are huge, and the rest of the food is pretty big too. It's hard for me to come here without getting the potato skins...mmm!! The fish and chips is great, too. I think they give too much, though, and taking home the leftovers is almost always necessary. The cheap $5 menu items are great as well; I got a Jack Daniel's Chicken Sandwich, which is extremely filling and delicious! If you like pasta or cheese (or both!) you will love the Gourmet Mac 'n Five Cheese, which is indescribable...definitely NOT Kraft mac 'n cheese, that's for sure! They used to have a really good dessert that was like an oreo ice cream sandwich...not sure if they still have it, though. The prices are decent, especially with the $5 menu items, and the atmosphere never fails to keep me entertained. This review is mostly about TGIF in general, not really the location....this one basically has less than impressive food and service, so any other location would be great. In fact, the one at The Block in Orange has never let me down. One location perk here:  Knott's employees get discounts at this location (and ONLY this one).

I have been to this TGIFriday's twice...I work down the street...both times it took us about 5 minutes to be seated. There was on one waiting in front of us, the hostess was just no where to be found. The first time I went our waitress was great, even helped me make a decision on what to eat. This last time our waiter "sucked" for lack of better words. For starters, he was wearing a baseball hat. I don't think I have ever seen a waiter or waitress do this before. After bringing our food, he didn't even come back during our meal. Every other waiter/waitress in the place walked past our table more than 3 times and he never did. I had to ask someone else to get me a refill and my friend never even got one. When he FINALLY showed up (too long after we were done eating) he asked if we would like our bill, we said yes. It took him about 5 minutes to come back with our bill and then about 10 more to come by and pick it back up. They were in no way busy so it makes absolutely no sense that this happened. I don't think we will be going back.

I won't be visiting this TGIF again.  The service was descent but their food gave me food poisoning. I ordered the chicken and shrimp pasta and it tasted good but I woke up the following morning with a chills and stomach pains. The 'Slushes' are horrible. It's nothing more than flavored water with extra ice that isn't event crushed. As I was drinking it, I could not help but feel like they forgot to throw it in the blender.

I hated the whole experience! The waiter messed up my bill and proceeded to blame another employee. We asked to talk to a supervisor and she was a complete idiot! I will never go to this location again. Plus it is not a corporate TGIF and that is booty. One of my worst experiences at a restaurant ever. if you want to get screwed over and have the worst night ever please go here. Totatlly ruined a company outing that we would have kept coming back to if the service was at least up to par.

Driving up from San Diego to celebrate my daughter's 16th birthday party at Knott's, I was pleasantly surprised to see "real restaurants" on the periphery. We decided to try our luck at getting our group seated for lunch at TGI Friday's, since I hadn't been to one in about 20 years. Although they were obviously busy, they must have saved the big table we could see from the hostess stand just for our group.  We were seated immediately, and I must say that the menu selections were ideal for a group of 16th birthday celebrants. Our waiter, although limited in personality (or just intimidated by our group), didn't miss a beat.  Even when he went on his California-mandated break, the server that covered our table was spot-on.  The portions, interestingly enough, were far larger than what was portrayed in the pictorial menu.  I mean, when does that happen?  I couldn't even finish my Cobb salad. Anyway, I was just pleasantly impressed with the whole experience.  And the money we'd saved with our coupon at Knott's almost completely covered our lunches. I would absolutely recommend this Friday's.
Nasty! Is what best describes my experience here!! Chicken wings were nasty. Lettuce was frozen!! Meal was ugh! Never again!!

Friday's is usually a good go-to when it's late & you want some cocktails & appetizers. NOT this Friday's though! The service is HORRIBLE, thanks to Knott's management. Once we got seated (with no menus, I might add) we were ignored by every server walking past for 20 minutes until I walked over to the bar to ask when we would be helped. The bar tender said someone would be with us soon & then HE disappeared!! We ended up walking out without anyone ever saying anything to us, and this was a Saturday night!! LAME. I will never go back to this Friday's location, nor will I go to any Knott's establishment.
The food is ok  not the greatest thing ever..service here sucks to be honest and expect a crowd of ppl seeing as its located in a tourist part.

ive only been here during the weekday, the staff isnt as personable as other spots there happy hour is kind of sad, other spots seem more lively like at the long beach towne center or cerritos, more kids here then not and older people, our more recent visit gave us a ditzy waitreess or she just had an off day. she didnt give the correct changed she shorted us and she wasnt attentive. the food was okay.parking can be validated remmber your ticket

the worst restaurant i've ever been.. the place is so crappy u would see the gathering dust on their decors which i think is already more than 2 decades.. this place is a shame compared to the TGIF restaurants back east where i stayed for many years.. yeah the service maybe a little bit ok but the food is something i won't even feed my dog.. u have to ask for silverwares (because they think u are not eating there?) and they are so dirty i wont even use them to scratch my itchy foot.. BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE THEY CALL RESTAURANT!!!!!.. u would feel better throwing ur money in the trash can than spending it here..

I usually have bad experiences whenever I go to Fridays, and this one does not disappoint. I keep going back because it's borderline entertaining. I worked in food service for a long time and it's fun seeing how terrible some restaurants can get. If you're into that, and you don't mind drinking beer from a glass that smells and tastes of sanitizer, this is the place to be. Otherwise, that $15 cheeseburger combo from Knott's isn't THAT bad an idea.

this has to be the WORST dining experience I have ever had! It started with unwrapping my silverware and seeing food stuck to my fork and knife. My family unwrapped theirs and their silverware was also dirty. The napkins were actually black with dirt! I took them to the manager and he acted like it was no big deal. I asked for new sets of silverware and he said he couldnt guarantee that they would be clean so did i want plastic forks and knives! I should have gathered my family and ran out of this place, but I gave them a chance... which I totally regret! Our waiter came to the table and we all swear he was cracked out! He was fidgeting and rushing us to order and talking all fast. So we order our food and this is what we got: cold broccoli cheese soup, uncarbonated soda, chicken breast that was so small I cut it into 4 pieces (it was probably 1.5oz of meat), overcooked steak (ordered medium, received well) rubbery shrimp, and soggy fries. The food was so disgusting! I could not even eat it. My husband complained again and all they did was take off 19 dollars from an $89 tab and there was only 5 of us and no alcohol was ordered! I literally get a stomach ache every time I think of this horrible experience! DO NOT EVER GO TO THIS PLACE!! If I could rate it accurately, it would be a -5

What can I say about this place. Food is ok and the service is bad. My family and I went to Knott's and decided to have lunch here. We were seated and ordered food. Great. We were hungry...15 minutes passed...Ok its busy...20 minutes passed...No problem, the place looks busy, I get it....25 minutes passed...I asked our waitress and she said "Your order is almost done. It will be coming out shortly"...30 minutes passed and still no sign of our lunch. By this time I was sucking the air through my straw because the water in my glass was finished. Our waitress was nowhere in sight and getting help from someone else was replied with "I'll get your waiteress". Nearly 45 minutes later our food came out. Oh and what did we order in a group of 6 people 2 pasta dishes and a fish dish. Nothing too complicated. After asking what took so long our waitress replies that the kitchen was short staffed.
